title: Teacher of Math,Statics,Mechanical courses in Savannah, GA
review:
My name is Sadi and living in Savannah,Georgia Now.I am emeritus college professor.I have a Master‚Äôs Degree in Mechanical Engineering and have been tutoring professionally.
I have taught Math and Science in high schools
and Statics, Mechanic of solids and other technical courses in colleges and Applied University of Technology for many years.
I charge reasonable rate, negotiable depending upon the level, subjects and length of sessions.

title: Sound doesn‚Äôt play with Videos with current version
review:
Even when the volume is turned all the way up & I verified that volume works on my iPhone & that I‚Äôve got the most recent version of the app. It seems like it started when LinkedIn released the version for iOS 11.

In addition, when I tried to create a Support Request for it from the App, the website it brought me to put me into a loop that wouldn‚Äôt let me create a case - it makes seem like that LinkedIn doesn‚Äôt want to get feedback from their Users!

title: Unnecessary Notifications
review: According to the App I‚Äôve turned off all notification types, yet every other day a new red badge comes up telling me I have a notification. I‚Äôd expect a notification for when I get a connection request, not for when I‚Äôve been connected to a contact for 5 years and that I should consider endorsing them. Either give me full control of the notifications in the app or don‚Äôt push useless notifications to your users.

title: New ‚ÄúCatch Up‚Äù section is horrible
review:
They‚Äôve added a new ‚Äúcatch up‚Äù section that could just as easily be a part of normal notifications. The app functionality also doesn‚Äôt work, telling me there is a notification of the same thing 5-10 times. No matter how many times I click in or out it still is a ‚Äúnew‚Äù update. 

Makes me think twice about wanting to use the app.

title: Profile Issues
review: After answering a few short questions about being open to work when setting up my profile, there was a disclaimer at the top that reads ‚Äúyour answers will not be visible on your profile‚Äù. However, my profile showed ‚Äúopen to work‚Äù publicly. NOT COOL. The app experience is disjointed like Facebook. Less is more.

title: Gina Fletcher McLeod,RN
review: I look forward to talking to you to improve my self esteem. Great encouragement.  I used to have close friends prior to my divorce. My friends  chose to continue to leave me and included my husband at function and our children.  I‚Äôm happily remarried now and my feelings have been hurt.

title: Unusable feed
review: Long time user here - The sorting algorithm has made this app virtually unusable. I‚Äôm constantly seeing weeks old posts or the same posts day after day after day (not just old posts with new likes or new comments). Give me the option to show recent posts in a chronological feed similar to the web experience. I want the new content not the same old posts shown repeatedly.

title: Job Matching App Designed by People Who Can't Do Their Hobs, Apparently!
review:
Not only is the site ridiculously unintuitive to the point of hostility for its feature of making multiple languages of profile, you can't even access them to edit or anything from the app.

Never mind the one good thing about sites like these, here called "Easy Apply," DOESN'T EVEN WORK ON MOBILE. 

Bet the workers at this company, too, are relegated to toilet scrubbing. Yet another case of only the incompetent being allowed to lead...

title: Sign in doesn‚Äôt work, logged me out
review: Hi, I‚Äôm unable to log in to my account on App iOS 15.4.1. Launching the app today logged me out, upon entering sign in credentials, I got my email pin, but going into background to fetch the pin, resets the screen. Any further attempts to sign in gives me an error: ‚ÄúSign in already in progress‚Äù :( Also, the layout is totally messed up and is spilling into the safearea

title: Job search filters are lacking
review:
I‚Äôve been trying to find a job that‚Äôs as close to possible to me, but LinkedIn likes to throw in multiple results from nearby cities. The filters don‚Äôt help with this because it‚Äôll only list major US cities (Chicago, Phoenix, San Diego, etc) without the option to add another city.

The ‚ÄúTitles‚Äù filter generally has titles unrelated to the title that I searched, and the title I search would be missing from the list. 

There should be an education or requirements filter because I keep getting listings unrelated to my search that I am not qualified for yet.

Basically, the filters need work because the search is too tedious. I get plenty of results, but none are what I am looking for.

title: Buggy
review: I resisted updating the app until LinkedIn forced my hand, and it‚Äôs buggy enough that I‚Äôm probably just going to uninstall it. It never lets me interact with others‚Äô posts anymore‚Äîread the comment, react to them, or post a comment, making the website fairly useless for me. It also keeps logging me out non-stop. If all you want is to scroll through others‚Äô post superficially, or make your own posts, and you don‚Äôt mind logging back in all the time, this app will still work for your needs.

title: Needs Dynamic Type
review: LinkedIn is a useful tool, but I have one big ongoing complaint: the app doesn‚Äôt use dynamic type.  Overall, the type is small which make the app very difficult to use for those who are visually impaired or have seen their vision diminish due to age.  I would use LinkedIn much more often if it was easier to read.

title: Feature Requestüôè
review: Please add the option to sort news feed posts by "top" and "recent" respectively just like the LinkedIn website. Would like to get the latest news instead of seeing the same old top stories Everytime I get on the app. Thank you!!

title: Don‚Äôt bother
review: I can‚Äôt even explain to you my experience on the app since I‚Äôve spent the last ten minutes trying to make an account!! It won‚Äôt let you continue unless you confirm your email, which isn‚Äôt a problem, until the link they send you brings you back to the app with an error message stating something went wrong. I‚Äôve tried eight times now and even went to their help center where I noticed another person having the same problem. Their response to the issue, NO HELP!

title: I use this DAILY
review:
This is embarrassing to admit, but I am on the LinkedIn app virtually every day of the year.
Yep, between communicating with prospects for my consulting business, and keeping up connections with recruiters, and keeping up to date with my relatives in other parts of the world, I find LinkedIn to be a huge and wonderful resource.

title: iPad interface is clearly an afterthought
review:
I‚Äôd been primarily using LinkedIn on my phone, but started trying to use it more on my iPad. The experience is a joke.

There‚Äôs a huge amount of wasted screen space. Touch targets are too small and fickle. Animated transitions are janky as hell. And it doesn‚Äôt support Split View (this is a quick way to get me to spend LESS time in your app).

The iPad is a platform. iPad apps need to embrace the platform. That‚Äôs what separates a good native app from a web interface.

title: Ok app with stale information
review:
The app works ok for the notifications and messaging. However the news feed is worthless. Why would anyone want to look at articles that are 5 or 10 days old? Where is the option to see the most recent information? 

Other problems. This is not an entertainment platform, this is not Facebook. Why are we being asked to like birthdays and other non-professional items? Why are people posting non business related pictures and articles?

title: Most used social media app
review: LinkedIn has become my most favorite app in social media as a whole. The user friendly interface with buttons aligned perfectly for every platform allows users to quickly navigate through content. Love it!

title: Huge improvement
review: This app makes it easy to search for people and jobs, update your profile, apply for jobs and get news. It is the critical app for every professional.

title: A lot of People Selling goods or services
review:
LinkedIn used to be a good app, but lately I‚Äôm getting more and more chats with people trying to sell me goods and services that I don‚Äôt need.

I reported this to the app and they said that this bad behavior of contacting people to sell goods and services is within the policies.

I love LinkedIn back when it was a real professional network, and I hate the new policies that allow for people to waste your time and send you spam or scams trying to sell you something.

title: Can‚Äôt manage payment or account from app
review: Incredibly inconvenient that you are not able to edit payment methods, manage subscriptions or any of the financial management portions of the account through the app. Even the web browser on a mobile device will auto launch the app, only for it to refer you back to the desktop. It‚Äôs so shady when the a company makes it difficult to manage the money going into the website.

title: Laggy on iOS
review:
I really like to be in touch in Linkedin because I think it‚Äôs the best virtual network due to it‚Äôs professional community but the Linkedin app on my phone , iphone 6s with iOS 15 , is so laggy !! I‚Äôll be really thankful if you can make it better.
It‚Äôs always laggy when I scroll down/up within the app it does not work as smooth as it should.

title: Useless
review: Do you want a place to discuss to interact with out of touch upper management? Do you want to interact with phony‚Äôs that have been in a corporate bubble for the last 40 years?  Do you want to look at pictures of corporate events to make a toxic company look good? If you answered yes to any of these questions, LinkedIn is the place for you. This the perfect place for corporate drones. Come talk to people that create toxic work culture and exploit their employees for low wages. LinkedIn is everything that is wrong with the world

title: why is the app so bad tho??
review:
It's good for keeping up with notifications but that's about it.

Pages don't load correctly, scrolling feeds and pages is not very responsive, and content doesn't always display correctly. I understand it's a mobile app and there's limitations compared to a desktop experience, but this is trash. Get it together please!

title: Job search function is faulty
review: When utilizing search feature,  in either job search or networks search location should default and save profile location. With every search I have to select my city and it doesn‚Äôt drop down in options. Please add a ‚Äòsaved city‚Äô option or default

title: Figure it out
review: The amount of times I toggle back and forth between a job app and LinkedIn and then find to my dismay that I can‚Äôt locate my application I‚Äôve spent 20 minutes on‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs really upsetting. LinkedIn, people who are trying to find jobs use your app to just get lost and create more work. It‚Äôs useless and upsetting. To whichever amazingly crafty dev responds to this, let a higher up know that it‚Äôs simply not an easy process to apply for jobs on the biggest job board in the world.

title: Director, Client Services
review: I use LinkedIn on a daily basis and can‚Äôt imagine my professional life without it. The platform keeps me connected and apprised of important facets of my clients and colleagues professional endeavors which allows me to be most effective when communicating. Download the app, you‚Äôll be VERY glad you did!!! üëçüèº

title: Was awful, still awful, avoid if you can
review:
LinkedIn has decided that whenever you update that they want to sink their claws into your contacts. They will email you about ‚Äúimportant‚Äù notifications (which are not important) and say that you have messages when you do not. Then they make the timelines up without any input or say from you.

Then there‚Äôs all the other internet tracking nonsense.

This app should be put into an incinerator. Heck, throw the whole website in; it‚Äôll do the world some good.

title: Won't update on my ver 4 iPad with retina
review: App still says it's not compatible with my iPad (version 4 with Retina display) running IOS 10.3.3, the latest version for my device.  What good is it if it can't be updated for fixing bugs.  If this keeps up, I'll uninstall it.    They think that their app is some sort of Facebook.  I decide who I want to link with and don't need suggestions.  If I don't know and trust and respect you, I won't link you.  If you're a recruiter trying to get to my network, you will not be linked either.

title: Weird bug in messaging app
review: I've noticed a weird bug when reading lengthy messages; when I scroll down and want to scroll back up, the app crashes and shuts down. This has happened in a couple different messages but appears to be limited to messages initiated by others I'm not connected to who want to discuss opportunities. Operating the current version of iOS 11.3.1 on an iPhone 6s.

title: Very buggy
review: App regularly freezes up my entire phone, crashes and is nearly impossible to upload photos to. When it does actually stay open long enough to upload a photo, it is either stuck loading the post or posts the photo 2 or 3 additional times. I think it has to do with the large size of photos on the iPhone and not compressing the images like Facebook does...but I‚Äôm not a programmer so I don‚Äôt know.

title: Cache Gets Bloated
review: Can we please have an option to clear the app‚Äôs cache without having to delete and reinstall the entire thing?  If I spend a decent amount of time reading articles on LinkedIn using the in-app browser, my ‚Äúdocuments and data‚Äù storage swells to hundred of megabytes.

title: Couldn‚Äôt Be Better
review: I‚Äôm on this app more than all my other social media combined. The value that it presents from articles and posts to helping with job searches and all the other tools it offers is unbeatable. Not to mention it‚Äôs also extremely easy to use.

title: Feed shows old news - Create a sort function for feed
review: With all the updates done to the App, why has the feed not been fixed? I don't want to see what LinkedIn thinks is important (it's stuff anywhere from 1-4 weeks ago). I want to see the most recent stuff and the fact that I can't sort is ridiculous. You're not giving me the most update information to keep contact with my network. It makes this app a moot point.

title: This is just signing up for email spamming
review: Crazy amounts of emails even after unsubscribing and of course when you log in everything is fine UNTIL you try to click into the area where you can turn off all of the data collection and notifications then it kicks you off and ‚Äúrestricts ‚Äú your account no matter how many security puzzles you solve and security codes you successfully provide.  Deleting my accounts asap

title: So slow & glitchy
review: If I‚Äôm responding to a message, it will start to type and then delete everything, it is so slow. My messages take forever to send and receive I get notifications on my watch before I can even see anything on my phone. It takes a good solid minute or two for me to actually open the message before it displays on my screen  please fix this.

title: Film Industry
review: Linked in is great however when I was updating some of my content I found that film isnt listed in the industry section. I was forced to put movies and sound recording, but I have never worked in sound before. I am a makeup artist and movie maker, so the appropriate industry would be film & tv or entertainment.

title: It‚Äôs a scam
review: I worked very hard on LinkedIn for a long time but they couldn‚Äôt me a job at all I would‚Äôve found a job Faster not using it and they charged me 37 bucks for some thing I didn‚Äôt even realize I signed up for. like apparently I‚Äôm on the premium but I didn‚Äôt volunteer for premium they just put me on it and then charge me for it. and they won‚Äôt let you cancel the premium through the app I don‚Äôt own a PC I don‚Äôt even know anyone who owns a PC so I don‚Äôt know what to do.

title: Customer service
review: For some reason I had two accounts out of nowhere under the same email and the main one I was using was no longer able to be accessed. So somehow somewhere somebody started a new account under my email and I was never able to access the old account. The amount of time and energy I spent on networking and all of it lost. Out of no where. Both accounts still exist but I can only access the one I didn‚Äôt make.

title: Issues with latest update
review: I am having issues with latest update. After opening the app its hanging and even after restarting its stuck in the same place. Kindly resolve this issue. Its happening very frequently. Not sure if its just my own issue or some other people are facing the same issue too.

title: It‚Äôs a trap
review: I have been on linkedIn for a good year now and still jobless. If you want to access the meat of this app (resume help, lessons, etc.) you‚Äôll have to pay. I did pay for a few months only to find my purchases to be worthless. If you are the creator of this app and is reading my review.. well.. I‚Äôm still on your app and I‚Äôd love to know your true statistics of people being hired based off of LinkedIn.

title: Signing me out of app everyone I close it
review: I love using Linkedin to casually browse for jobs but for the past week or so, the app requires me to sign in every single time I open it when I‚Äôm usually always signed in. It‚Äôs a hassle for me to re-enter my email and password when I use the app MULTIPLE TIMES a day. There seems to have been an update so I‚Äôm not sure if this is a bug or new feature. PLEASE fix this!

title: The worst app ever!
review:
I‚Äôve never seen an app as bad as LinkedIn. I loaded the app, but the app icon never appears on my screen, I can‚Äôt login to my account no matter what I do! I‚Äôve been trying to login for two days. What a huge wast of time! 

The Forgotten password process is ridiculous too. 

I‚Äôve had a LinkedIn account since the early days-maybe 2004 and every aspect gets worse all the time. It is now virtually useless, since I was literally forced to load the app on my phone and now have no way to login. I give up!!

title: Invading privacy by accessing clipboard without permission.
review:
How dare you invade users‚Äô private clipboard contents without permission. This is an enormous invasion of our privacy and a breach of trust. Just ended paying for LI Premium. Screw you!

UPDATE:
1. Don‚Äôt patronize me. I didn‚Äôt bring this to your attention. LinkedIn, TikTok and others are getting roasted in the press over this form of privacy intrusion.
2. Quoting Erran Berger‚Äôs party line response is BS. Vague enough to quiet the mob but totally disingenuous.
3. Given that LI has a history of sneakily stealing contact addresses, you have zero credibility.

Why would LinkedIn need to perform an ‚Äúequality check‚Äù when the app is not in the foreground? Huh? Why perform an equality check PERIOD? If a user doesn‚Äôt paste a clipboard item, why validate that the clipboard is equal to inputted text?

This is grounds for a nice juicy class action suit.

title: Randomly get stuck on scrolling.
review:
From last 2 years it‚Äôs happening. Such a shame for LinkedIn team. I‚Äôm editing my rewrite for the third time now. Responsible person should be asked to take strict actions.

I using iPhone 6s plus but from past year to till now I‚Äôm not able to freely use the app. I have tried many ways by deleting and reinstalling, restarting iPhone and updating but results remains same. And am I the only facing this problem let me know please.
It will much appreciated if any developer fixe it or guide me. Thanks.

title: Please fix
review: This is a very well made iOS app. Being a principal iOS dev myself, I can surely see the QA & design that went into this. One issue I‚Äôd like to bring up is a crash im facing. When on the suggestions/explore tab (second from left) tapping my connections at top left where it shows the count causes a crash. Looking forward to an update.

title: Quality Assurance & User Protections
review: The app freezes on  a regular basis when reading posts, commenting or applying for jobs. It simply freezes and has to be uninstalled to get out of it. Likewise there are accounts of mentally deranged, racist and homophobic people posting horrific things with no way to report them. Finally if you are anything more than a VP job listings are not coming up to you even as a paid subscriber. Drastic improvements and monitoring of this platform is needed..

title: Constant Badge App Icon for no reason
review: For as long as I can remember, the app has had a badge icon as if there is a notification of some sort. When entering the app, it will hold a badge on the networking tab, yet when you click it, there is no request or anything. I have uninstalled, reinstalled and signed in on a Pc to inspect my profile. Guess I‚Äôll have to turn of badge app icons? Very annoying!

title: Great app
review:
02/15 message attachment crash reported few days back resolved. Thanks for fixing.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî- 

02/13 : This used to be a great app. With latest version has a quality issue. When I open Resume sent as a PDF attachment in messages, app crashes . Please fix it. It was working great last version.

title: Going down
review: Last version of application makes me extremely sad. Are you really believe we are idiots? I may reading an article and get distracted for a few seconds to answer sms message from my friend and return back to linkedin application and booms, all your news feed is reloaded without possibility to finish reading? I stoped using facebook exactly because this stupid behavior. Now is it a time to stop using linkedin and move somewhere else? Your UX designers should be punished and don‚Äôt receive yearly bonus.

title: The app needs work. There is a lot of malfunctioning occurring.
review: The app won‚Äôt let me sign into my account at all. I can sign in manually using the internet, but not on the app. I hate that I have no access to my own account through the app. It keeps saying no internet when there is internet. I have tried uninstalling and reinstalling the app and nothing works. It also won‚Äôt let me post anything due to it saying no internet when there is internet and a signal...no matter where I am. Please fix this.

title: Excellent networking tool!
review:
LinkedIn is my go-to app for keeping up to date with my network. Customizing my job search streamlines my notifications and saves me time! Great job!

One recommendation: dark mode please? It would make my last minute - late night checks easier to read without lighting up the room. Thank you!

title: Problems updating
review:
The rating would be 5 if not for the fact that for over a week now, the iPhone app does not upgrade content.
The app is updated automatically, and i have had the same issues with the previous IOS as well as with the most recent IOS. Please fix. I use the mobile app much more than the computer interface. Thanks!

title: Ghost notifications?
review: It seems that every few seconds the app is telling me that I have some sort of new notification only for me to discover that there is in fact nothing there. I don't see any way of reporting bugs on the app or website (it happens there too). I've seen this happen with other apps but never this bad.

title: Crashes every single time I try to send DMs
review: I don‚Äôt understand how a fix still hasn‚Äôt been pushed for this. Whenever I try and send a DM with a job, company, link, etc, I press the send button and the app crashes without fail. It has been like this for at least 2 quarters now. Unacceptable. I‚Äôll rewrite a better review when this is FINALLY fixed.

title: It won‚Äôt let me put the Open to Work frame!
review:
I‚Äôve had this issue a while ago and now it‚Äôs really beginning to getting on my nerves!
I tried to put the Open to Work frame on my pic and it‚Äôs just keep opening the preferences page and when I approve them and press done nothing happend!
Then I tried to use the browser and it worked but the next day it removed the frame suddenly without my permission! It‚Äôs frustrating and stupid please fix it!!

title: Black screen after facial recognition
review: Still problem with your mobile facial recognition. Now it goes to black screen after doing the recognition so have to close app and do again. Then for some reason it works but it‚Äôs Really annoying that it won‚Äôt automatically open after the initial facial recognition.

title: Job search broken
review: Job search messed up since an update ago. Location searches don‚Äôt work correctly. Have notified them through Twitter but they mostly just argue with you rather than try to fix the issues. You can‚Äôt put in a city and state anymore for location, whatever you put in changes to ‚ÄòUnited States‚Äô. They don‚Äôt seem to do enough testing of their own app as an issue like this should never make it to the live app.

title: Delete messages for both parties
review: Sometimes mistakes are made in sending messages or sending wrong messages to high profile individuals can be annoying. One should be able to delete messages and shouldn‚Äôt appear on the other side. Please effect this on the next update. Thanks

title: Abandoned on iPad too
review: Same as on my iPhone, my older hardware can't be updated and LI has just stopped working, kind of... I can fee behind the "update now" window the app is there and looks like it is refreshing but can't get "update" window to go away!!!! Ugh it's just like on my iPhone and I have deleted and reinstalled a couple times on each device. LI Expert just closed my last ticket before it was fixed, their metric need to look like the "solved/closed" open ticketed. And you can't reopen a closed ticket.... ugh.

title: LinkedIn app pages does not scroll after iOS upgrade to13.1.1
review:
Mainly daily rundown pages, articles does not scroll after I upgraded to iOS 13.1.1. Does anyone else experience similar issue?
‚Äî‚Äî-
I just got the new update of the app after writing above review and my problem was resolved.

title: Fix the crashing
review: I really enjoy using this app and connecting with professionals around the world. I‚Äôve gotten the chance to learn with and from some amazing people. My only complaint is that the app crashes sometimes when I‚Äôm trying to share a post and I have to start over, sometimes several times.

title: App Won‚Äôt Unfollow and Opens Wrong Links
review:
I‚Äôve been having problems for weeks now with the app not actually following through on unfollow requests. I‚Äôve tried to unfollow a particular individual dozens of times. Instead, they‚Äôre at the top of my feed. 

Additionally, I‚Äôll go to click a link or expand a comment box and the app will start loading some other page. Sometimes it‚Äôs a link for a post above the one I‚Äôve selected, sometimes is one for a post below. 

I‚Äôm so frustrated with this app.

title: Auto updates homepage
review: I liked it when I pulled down on homepage using iPad to update. Now I will read an article and go to research it and when I return to respond the article is gone‚Ä¶this happens daily. Why not let us ask for newer articles when we are ready?

title: Terrible customer service
review: I recently changed jobs, so I was unable to recover my LinkedIn acct as I no longer have access to my email address and I didn‚Äôt link my phone number. I gave up trying to fix the problem and created a new acct which has now been restricted, because they don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs me although I‚Äôve provided my drivers license. And I can‚Äôt contact customer support because I can‚Äôt log in. This is a very disappointing experience.

title: Couldn‚Äôt find a good way to quickly disable push notifications
review: Notifications menu was hidden behind 4 button presses (home, profile picture, settings, notifications). Then each notification category was hidden behind a new menu. It would take navigating through several dozen submenus to turn off all annoying notifications. I simply disabled all notifications in iOS settings instead.

title: SCROLLING BUG
review: This app is great for looking for easy applications, however, there is a glitch that is commonly complained about including by me it's getting bad to where you are scrolling through job postings and all of a sudden you can't scroll. They need to fix this ASAP! Scrolling will just not work after a couple minutes and I have to restart the app in the middle of applications!

title: Extremely cluttered app - nearly useless
review:
Sorry for the scalding but I have never seen a modern big name app that was so outdated in appearance and absolutely horrible UI. I almost never use this. 

Not to mention the fact this is just another mind control censorship platform where you are required to believe in things that are extinct especially as it relates to ‚Äúscience‚Äù. Don‚Äôt bother posting anything that doesn‚Äôt conform to the narrow minded universities that teach things long since disproven.

title: Sort feed by Most Recent...?
review: Why must one drill through multiple layers of settings to make this change? Why not make it easily accessible directly on the feed view so one can switch back and forth quickly and effortlessly? When you watch TV, do you set it on one channel then put the remote in a box, in the garage, on a shelf? Obviously not. You place it somewhere convenient.

title: Could be better.
review:
One of my biggest complaints is the inability leave the app without it reloading your news-reel and putting you on Home every time your renter the app. 

If I‚Äôm looking for a job for instance and I change apps to look up the company in chrome, I tab back and the listing is vanished.. and I‚Äôm back at ‚Äúhome‚Äù

Extremely annoying.

title: Will charge without any notification
review: Beware! This app will charge after free trial ends without notification. I‚Äôve used many other platforms/apps and they won‚Äôt do that. In my opinion it‚Äôs very shady way of doing business. I strongly believe that as a customer I should have a choice to continue with subscription or no after free trial ends. And automatic notification is a common courtesy. Not that hard to do at all. Needless to say, I‚Äôm done with this platform. Very disappointed.

title: More than two positions
review: LinkedIn is fantastic, however I often work more than one position and I‚Äôm not sure if the application has an option to put multiple positions on the headline page.  I think it would be an excellent edition to the application, as having multiple jobs has become common.

title: Smmfh
review:
So this app locked me out of 
My account for violating terms of service..
I violated when I tell someone I‚Äôll ‚Äúhit you up later‚Äù they said I was harassing and bullying when I said this.,, 
Needless to say that‚Äôs the stupidest thing I‚Äôve ever heard 
They tell you who you can and can‚Äôt message and they will call you out in public if you make a comment they don‚Äôt like .., they monitor everything you say‚Ä¶ this app isn‚Äôt worth the trouble,, do yourself a favor and keep scrolling

title: Most recent posts
review: The app is fine but I hate the fact that the app doesn‚Äôt allow you to see the most recent posts on your feed. My feed is just the same thing over and over again and are usually posts that are 2+ weeks old. It‚Äôs the worst part about the mobile app honestly.

title: App feed is not good
review: You miss lots of opportunities because the app keeps showing the same posts from days or weeks old instead of the new posts. It doesn‚Äôt give you an option to set the recent posts like the laptop does. That needs to be fixed. People pay for this service and lots of money for it. Least you can do is update that issue!!

title: Resets when you come back!
review: One of the purposes of this app is to find jobs and apply for them.  When you are applying, you have to go back and forth between apps on your phone to gather files and information.  When you go back to LinkedIn app, it is reset back to the homepage, kicking you off the application, and you have to start over.  Very inconvenient!!

title: App launches from safari PLEASE  FIX
review:
App launches automatically and randomly from Safari if active tab is on LinkedIn mobile site.  Assume this is happening when checking if the iOS App is installed.  Should  only launch when selected by user.  iOS version 13.4.1

The iOS app should not launch by itself.  And relaunches after closing the app.  There is some communication between safari and the app that is broken.

Can send a screen recording.

title: Yikes
review:
The app gets two stars for two reasons. 

1. Premium didn‚Äôt help in my job search and it‚Äôs expensive.
I used three apps to job search: LinkedIn, Indeed, and Zip Recruiter and each one had the same job application materials. I got a lot of interviews with Indeed, a fair amount with Zip Recruiter, and zero (!) with LinkedIn Premium. I ended up with a good attorney job using Indeed. 

2. LinkedIn has become more Facebook-y

LinkedIn used to have some level of professional demeanor on its feed. Now my feed is filled with ‚ÄúI am oh so honored to be using the toilet at the Bank of America Building and beginning this new chapter of my life‚Äù. It‚Äôs corny and it makes me not want to use the app. If you want business or niche professional news just subscribe to Axios.

title: Feed view
review: Is it that hard to organize the feed in chronological order? The main function of this is to find jobs and be able to network with people.  It doesn‚Äôt help that just now I see a job fair or an opening from TWO WEEKS ago.  I log in to the app every day, a few times a day.  We also need a ‚Äúsee less‚Äù or mute/hide option for connectios that like/react/share to too many articles.

title: Overall
review: Overall, this is a great app. But LinkedIn needs to give an option to its users about hiding the activity of its members. I personally don‚Äôt want my connections to see posts that I‚Äôve liked. It would be nice to be able to choose/hide it from followers.

title: Terrible app
review:
I‚Äôd love to meet the decision maker who thought that being unable to sort your feed was a good idea. I constantly see 2 week old posts; even things I‚Äôve already engaged with. Why? 

Some of the same formatting issues that ruin the website on the iPad plague the mobile app, which leads me to believe that this ‚Äúapp‚Äù is really just a badly packaged browser front end. 

I want to like LinkedIn, but it seems that LinkedIn still hasn‚Äôt figured out what it wants to be, or how to really be anything.

title: Poor Functionality
review:
Many issues and bugs such as not being able to truly optimize your time line. I‚Äôve hidden the same people multiple times and every time I log in I see their content front and center. 

The web browser is terrible and will often freeze. If you‚Äôre attempting to apply for job in the app that take you outside of LinkedIn, be sure to open it in a separate browser.

title: Crash with messages
review:
Dear LinkedIn,
I have a big problem with this application. Every time that I want to write a new message, this application crashes and I have to open it again and write again. Could you please check and resolve this issue üôèüôèüôèüôè

title: Great Articles!
review: I love that I‚Äôm able to read, connect, and follow with some of the greatest and influential people of our time.  It‚Äôs like waking up and opening an app of knowledge, inspiration, and encouragement!  No other app like.  Oh and it doesn‚Äôt hurt to see all the wonderful way the CEO of LinkedIn supporting his employees.

title: Network equals net worth
review: LinkedIn gives you the opportunity to grow a network through your network and keep growing being able to reach the right people you may want to be included in your network!

title: MICHAEL SERO
review: The LinkedIn app is absolutely ideal for staying connected to my network when I'm on the go.   This app has actually helped me make better use of my time in-between meetings and sales calls.  If you truly want to get the most benefit from what LinkedIn has to offer, the app is a must-have.

title: Please fix this
review: Could you please fix news feed.  I know every time I get on LI, my most recent feeds are not from three days ago or seven or whatever it always says after I refresh. Is there no way you can make news feed that is current come up?  This continues to baffle me and frustrate me. This is not Facebook.  Looks to me like more current feeds could come up. Please fix this.

title: Promoted Jobs
review: LikedIn has always been my go to app for job hunting until now. When I search for a specific job title, I have to scroll through 50 or so promoted jobs that have absolutely no relation to the job I specifically searched for. After scrolling through unrelated jobs for 10 minutes, I get one or two jobs that I was actually looking for, and then 50 more promoted ones.

title: Premium Member - locked out of account
review: I am a premium member who has been locked out of my account for over a week. I submitted my documents to be reviewed. It says it will take 48 hours. It has been 8 days. There is no email address nor phone number for LinkedIn. I cannot get updates because I cannot log on. I cannot send any messages to LinkedIn because I cannot log on. I cannot contact support for premium members because I cannot log on.

title: Something real classist/elitist about this platform
review:
Why is this advertised as a great way to network and find new opportunity?

This platform only cares about appearance and not about actual skills. It only resulted in one actual job that was as a measly barista/server for a very mean and racist company.

Everyone just wants to be successful why there have to be so many barriers and obstacles for people who are so called ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù?

title: Never seem to get anywhere, even when I paid for subscriptions
review: I rarely come to this site anymore, it really has not help with job employment. It seems I get more junk from people and takes up too much of my time for any reward return.

title: Great app for networking
review: I‚Äôve used this app to network and learn about opportunities and it has worked well. There are a lot of people on the platform, so that is a plus. With that in mind you will come in contact with people of all walks of life.

title: Buggy
review: Scrolling on the phone locks up almost every other scroll. Also you can‚Äôt leave the app for one second without it jumping back to the home page. This is very disruptive and makes the app hard to use. Also searching for an intern job immediately shows you senior positions, which makes searching useless. Also the tag of ‚Äúentry level‚Äù will be on senior positions, and director level will be under ‚Äúmid level.‚Äù It‚Äôs a mess.

title: Random idea for you all - Please consider
review: I love LinkedIn. I‚Äôm trying to replace my scrolling on social media with scrolling LinkedIn. I was thinking - why not implement a discover page sort of thing where you can find new ideas other than who you are connected with. Make it controlled enough so it‚Äôs not just a bunch of useless nonsense like instagram or tiktok. If you need some help developing, I‚Äôm graduating with a marketing degree in May and would be honored to be part of the team ;)

title: App is OK - but limited
review: LinkedIn would be so much better if there were just a couple of feed settings. Why users can't opt out of seeing what our connections have liked or commented on is silly. I am completely disinterested in having my feed be dominated by seeing posts/updates from people/organizations I am not familiar with just because a connection hit like or made a one-word comment.

title: Visual format bug, overall satisfactory
review:
The personal profile was displaying starting slightly further than the edge of the screen, cutting into the profile pic and wallpaper.

Btw, personalized homepages are informative of brand, which is important for me to recognize in people I meet, please consider. Thanks

title: Sad to see it go
review: I have issues with sensitivity to bright light . And no matter what I do (follow all the instructions) on how to turn on DARK MODE for my iPhone 12 Pro it won‚Äôt work!!  I don‚Äôt have any of those options given on the instructions. Dark mode works on other apps from my phone but for some reason it won‚Äôt work for my linkedin account but will work for my husband who has a iPhone 12 Pro Max. Please help me fix this. I really want to keep this app.

title: Ridiculous algorithm
review:
Why is my farewell note being displayed to over 40k random folks on the platform? Setting ‚Äúanyone‚Äù should mean it is displayed to anyone who comes and views my profile not that you go and display my post to everyone on LinkedIn!! 
Even Facebook posts are not made this public while it‚Äôs supposed to be more casual and LinkedIn is supposedly to be professional. 
If premium subscription makes your profile more public then no thank you!

title: Needs Improvement - Erase Racist People
review: LinkedIn is a decent platform to use. However, LinkedIn is full of racist people who don‚Äôt seem to be banned for some reason. I‚Äôm not the first black person to mention that.  Non-black people get away with saying whatever to minorities especially black people and that‚Äôs the biggest downfall to this platform. Be aware!

title: Non stop notifications
review: The app works for a professional profile, but for real cool it with the notifications. I‚Äôm constantly sent uninteresting news stories and ‚Äú30+ new jobs for ‚Ä¶‚Äù all day and I honestly don‚Äôt care. I know I can turn off notifications but I do want some, and it seems like every time I turn one notification off, the app just sends more of the other types.

title: Totally Confused
review:
I thought I had the linked in app. A job app indicated I needed to buy an upgraded linked in app to speak with the recruited. When I clicked to do so, there was no way to activate that happening. I‚Äôm old school and my argument is that unless you are a millennial, you can‚Äôt figure out how to use this computer stuff. If it was that good, anyone could use it. 

I can drive any car but can only use some of these computer programs. Therefore one customer lost.

John

title: Stop prompting us for update
review:
LinkedIn, here‚Äôs a tip‚Äîif a user wants to update their app, they will go to the App Store and do that.

Currently, if you aren‚Äôt using the latest app version, this app will force you to select ‚Äúupdate‚Äù or ‚Äúnot now‚Äù constantly. It doesn‚Äôt save your selection and prompts every single time you switch back to the app. This is not only happening after closing the app and reopening‚Äîit will actually prompt when simply switching apps. This is horrendous UX.

title: This app is meant for spying, staff is shady
review:
1st off, Microsoft owns LinkedIn. They are collecting and selling your information.

LinkedIn actually committed the same spying as tiktok and they‚Äôve had breeches of information in the past. Microsoft has also been hacked multiple times.

2nd There‚Äôs a lot of things this app doesn‚Äôt do right and yet it pries into your phone, unnecessarily.

Like posting and reposting doesn‚Äôt work.

They try to force you to have by using ‚Äústories‚Äù as a app only function. No one really looks at stories.

This app unnecessarily collect and stores picture.

They try to make using it via browser difficult so you go to the app.

I‚Äôve contacted LinkedIn staff and they‚Äôve been shady, evasive in regards to verification, data collecting and other procedures. Particularly a manager named Ludwig. 

Deleting this app.

title: Going downhill
review: I think it‚Äôs awful that now you have to pay just to message someone. This is supposed to be a networking app and I believe you‚Äôre just too greedy. It‚Äôs one thing to offer premium features but to cut off all connections through messaging unless you pay- that‚Äôs ridiculous. It‚Äôs not like anyone is profiting off of it besides you and you‚Äôre using your customers ina reproachable manner especially during COVID is reprehensible. It is just not cool at all! Shame on you LinkedIn or should I say, LinkeDONE.

title: Contact theft
review: I‚Äôm sure this is old news, but back on February 13th 2019 when LinkedIn updated its terms of service, it also imported the contact list from my phone. Now when I find out, while using the latest version of the app,it won‚Äôt let me remove my contacts, claiming it can only be done on the app. Pure Avarice on the part of LinkedIn . As soon as I am sure I have removed this data, I will no longer user this app or service in any way

title: Bug when changing default picture
review:
I‚Äôve been noticing an on going bug when attempting to change the main default on profile settings.

 The brightness / contrast on the picture I choose becomes extremely dark and changes the quality of the picture. 

I always have to resort to making changes on laptop. Pls fix.

title: Profile pics look very dark all of a sudden
review:
Whatever settings were changed in the profile pic section they are horrible and make the profile pic very dark when uploading a new photo. The uploaded picture looks nothing like the original. 
Also need to add functionality to be able to change background photo in the header. It‚Äôs 2020 - you should be able to do that from your phone.

title: App is horrible all around
review: I don‚Äôt get it. It used to be helpful. First there are connectivity issues. It keeps saying I don‚Äôt have Internet service. No other app has this issue on my phone. I deleted the app and reinstalled it and it still has this issue. Also, the platform has changed so wildly that it‚Äôs no longer helpful in connecting professionals. You cannot easily upload a resume anymore. You have to manually type everything and try to make it fit. Terrible.

title: Automated Job Search is Flawed
review:
The automated job search is garbage. I‚Äôve completely filled out my profile, listed several job titles, given location preferences but the job listings recommended are never applicable. If I do the same search myself, I can usually get a couple good hits. Makes me think this is by design favoring higher profile LinkedIn customers - companies or job searchers.

Still, it‚Äôs a good way to maintain network contacts.

title: Suggestions do not work correct.
review: I just deleted this app from my phone, it keeps sending me notifications of people I should link up with.  I delete the notification, it comes back, same person day after day, sometimes 3 or 4 times a day.  It eventually goes away and another contact is suggested and the cycle starts up again.  I looked for a way to stop the suggestion feature, couldn‚Äôt find.

title: Many problems
review: Is it my iPhone 8 or does this app just have a lot of blank pages when I click through the app? To me it‚Äôs awful-can‚Äôt see a place to post, messages don‚Äôt work at all, and the app lags. My suggestion to developers: when you want to post that should be one of the plus sign categories. Plus fix the messaging function. As of now I need to rely on the web version which is not good. At best this is 2 Stars.

title: Cannot add photos, documents, etc.
review: When posting in the app, it isn‚Äôt possible to add a picture or other medium because it not only fails to respond, but the screen freezes, and trying to do it after reloading the app does not make it work.

title: Self Branding Best Platform Ever In App Industry
review: I forgot from when I was started using this Apps. but,I can remember from that moment to till today every moment I‚Äôm learning and start developing my self. This is the app which can make and help us to create ourself as a brand to compare with others.

title: App always crashing
review: When I go into the app most of the time it will freeze or just crash. When I check notifications it will also freeze and often times after I have checked them it will still show that I have unseen notifications. Also, after a recent post there has been a bar at the top that shows posting even though I posted it more than two weeks ago.

title: Great Networking tool
review: Have used this for keeping in touch w colleagues and people within the Southlake Focus Group. Also have received calls & contacts from Recruiters and being over 50 and having periods of unemployment in my history this is as real a help as it gets.

title: App Review
review: I‚Äôm in the income distribution business and I‚Äôve been wanting to upload video illustration for quite some time now. It‚Äôs great to see the time has come. I‚Äôm looking forward to using this more frequently going forward. Thank you for this update.

title: Much better now
review: Gotten much better now in terms of Ui and ease of use. I like their daily digest and jobs feature. However not a fan of the way people are using LinkedIn to share jokes or sentimental stories which have nothing to do with any profession.

title: User Friendly and Efficient
review: LinkedIn‚Äôs app is so easy to use. I always appreciate the line where I can see where the new stories begin. The ease of connecting with people and confirming connections is seamless on the app. I highly recommend this professional networking tool.

title: Bug
review:
Has a bug that is driving me insane!!
Will not let me filter more than one job option. For example, I click on part-time, then click on on-site, and it removes part-time but leaves on-site, then I‚Äôll try to click on part-time again and it won‚Äôt let me. I‚Äôll click on past 24 hrs and it will jump back to part-time but not on-site. It is driving me nuts!!!

title: Premium Subscription Won‚Äôt Work
review: I wanted to try out free month of premium so I signed up with my Apple account.  Yet, I wasn‚Äôt able to use any of the premium features.  Support was useless and kept saying it should take 3 days to work - after three days nothing changed.  I was very disappointed since I wanted to see what premium actually was like, but it wouldn‚Äôt let me access it even though I subscribed.  Horrible customer service.

title: Good but what would make it better is‚Ä¶
review: I‚Äôve been using this for sometime. The only problem I have with it is I can‚Äôt copy my Contacts from my LinkedIn to a new phone. Without manually writing each down, or saving it on a Desktop, or Laptop. It would be great if I could sync my contacts to my iPhone directly.

title: Dark Mode Missing?
review: Love LinkedIn and have never had issues with the app. Giving it 4 and not 5 stars though because dark mode is apparently out but my account has no Display option in the settings. Would be really nice to get this working.

title: Great app but...
review: This has turned into my most used app out of all of the other social media apps that I own. The level of networking through this app has been a catalyst to my success. I just wish there were a dark mode for the app that way many users like myself can stay on the app longer !

title: Business Format
review: Where is the business and professionalism?  I don‚Äôt need FB, instagram, oor repeats of other social media!  I want a business like atmosphere to conduct those types of contacts.  I am very disappointed and you app needs major overhaul for funtionality.  Keep up with the times!

title: LinkedIn app: Excellent!!
review: As many apps turn out to be less than stellar for many reasons, the new LinkedIn app has been far and away, every bit of a pleasure to interact with!! Easier and more fluid than the actual LinkedIn site? Hhhhmmm, perhaps!! Congrats LinkedIn app builder guy, you are a rockstar!!!

title: Can‚Äôt create an account??
review: I deleted my account by accident and now when I try to sign up with a different email it says my phone number can‚Äôt be used. However I never saved my number on that site. And when I try the captcha thing it tells me something went wrong and to please try again. Can you please fix this! I can‚Äôt create an account on the app or website. It gives me the same problems!

title: Worst Software Design
review:
The app encounters errors upon errors especially when trying to update your profile. Instead of giving useful error codes the app outputs very frustrating generic messages such as "try again later" "this did not succeed"

The point of a mobile app is to execute things on mobile and when it's not functional more frustration comes up when the error codes are very generic

title: Cannot sync  2 profiles LinkedIn created and they won‚Äôt help
review: UPDATE-IM GIVING UP ON THESE MORONS After Multiple requests, The LI customer service has not assisted me- what gall- no guts to admit their mistakes/ they screwed up. Somehow a duplicate profile for me was created and now I am a ‚Äú beginner ‚Äú I am very upset that I cannot get onto my original LinkedIn account which took 10 plus Years to build and my name is not even correct on the false dup acct!! The LI  directions to merge accounts do not work. Beware of LinkedIn duplicate accounts and LinkedIn screw ups

title: This app has one MAJOR flaw (and a minor one)
review:
This app has a MAJOR flaw: You cannot add a note when requesting to connect with someone. If you hit the connect button, it just fires off a generic request. If you want to connect with a message like a normal human being instead of a robot, you have to use the LinkedIn website.

Also, tagging is very limited when using the app.

title: App crashes on Scrolling Messages
review:
UPDATE: App was updated May 9th 2018.
It was NOT fixed! With as many messages I receive. Now I have to use the web based app on PC, thus rendering the app useless.
Downgrading my rating from 4 stars to 2.

Since the update of May 3rd 2018, while scrolling a message the app crashes. This is NOT intermittent, It‚Äôs repeatable. I also have the latest iOS (11.3.1). I hope it is fixed. Otherwise, I would have given it a 5-Star rating.

title: Good Business Networking App
review:
I gave it 3 stars because there is no 2.5. The job suggesting part of this app needs work. I have no where to locate any preferences and the items it suggests for me seems like they are just throwing spaghetti to see what sticks. 

I have no bilingual experience anywhere in my profile yet every day I see a Bilingual sup position as my #1. There needs to be a dislike option.

title: Dark mode would be nice
review: I use LinkedIn to network, job seek, learn about companies and polish my skills, but my one complaint is that it‚Äôs really hard on the eyes. It would be great if dark mode was an option, especially since I do most of my learning activities at night.

title: Great App
review: It's user-friendly and practical. I enjoy using it. I alternate between my iPhone, iPad and desktop. For me, the ability to message quickly when my contacts have an event, an interesting post etc is key. As a networking tool, this app is probably the best that exists.

title: Just another social media site
review: I‚Äôve had this app for almost a year and I‚Äôve gotten no hires from this app. I‚Äôve updated my resume and I‚Äôve applied and connected with individuals from companies but I‚Äôve gotten rejected every time and I‚Äôve done all that I was supposed to do. Wouldn‚Äôt recommend this site if you‚Äôre looking for a job. Go with indeed or somewhere else just apply directly. This is just another social media site, just terrible

title: No disagreements allowed
review: It‚Äôs basically fakebook for the business world. Opposing views of leftist orthodoxy are verboten ‚Äî in the name of ‚Äúsafety‚Äù, of course.  (There is nothing more intolerant than the so-called tolerant left). It‚Äôs pretty much useless with everyone connected to each other through recruiters. The only content people post are the awards that they are ‚Äúhumbled‚Äù and ‚Äúhonored‚Äù to receive, extravagant vacations that they are so ‚Äúgrateful‚Äù to show, and the ‚ÄúI know I should be posting this on Facebook, but‚Ä¶‚Äù posts.

title: Useless
review: Everyone who uses this network is putting on a facade and patting each other on the back for their efforts to convince each other they are trustworthy to verify the credibility of one another in being credible. Nobody in reality cares about LinkedIn. It's just another Microsoft Certification in the form of a Social Network. 99% of it is marketing and bot accounts. Look up the video of "A day in the life of a PM at LinkedIn" to get an idea of what you can expect from it.

title: Weird UX choices in mobile app are annoying
review: Notably: on larger posts there is a ‚ÄúSee More‚Äù button. Clicking this expands the post, which makes sense. But it also scrolls you down to the very bottom of the post, making you lose your place and have to scroll back up to keep reading. This is extremely irritating, and makes me wonder if the people deploying these changes ever actually use their own product

title: Constantly refreshing
review:
I often have articles up, or posts or messages half written. Then life happens. My phone goes to sleep.

When I open it back up. Everything is refreshed. Usually the article is unfindable in a new newsfeed, and the comments, posts or messages that I may have spent a ton of time on are completely gone.

Please fix. Happy to 5 star otherwise. But omg I just wasted 30 minutes with this happening twice in a row.

title: New app update is not user friendly
review: Profile and message icons are in far corners of screen unable to click on then in any view horizontal or vertical very frustrating. Then going online to use web login certain features such as message request are only viewable through app which i am unable to click on my messages let along requests. Please consider developers to correct this very stressful and pertinent inconvenience.

title: No Notification Control
review: Push notification settings are a total disaster on iOS. There is no way to tell which category of push notification is being sent to the device so they can be turned off. After trying to disable the same type of notification 4 different times I have to just block linkedin notifications because I don‚Äôt want all the useless reminders.

title: Mobile site is better
review: I tried to send a message with an attachment but there‚Äôs no option to on the app. Even the mobile site allows you to add attachments! Worst part is if you try to message someone out of your network on the mobile site it redirects you to the app so I wasn‚Äôt even able to send the important message I needed to send until I got to my laptop. So dumb.

title: Keeps logging me out
review: Not sure what happened recently, but every time I open the app it goes to my feed and then quickly logs me out.  I have to type everything in each time I use it, even if I just briefly use another app.  It never did this before the latest update.  Nice app otherwise.

title: Cannot access app on IOS
review: every time i open the app its comes to the "what kind of job are you looking for" page and will not let me move forward, ive tried putting in titles and locations but whenever i tap to choose the screen comes up with the choices for all of 2 seconds and then goes completely white. i reset my phone, installed the latest ios and nothing has worked. very disappointed

title: Suggestion
review: Thanks for improving the application i think we need to send videos sometimes in the conversation which is not enabled in the messages between contacts. I can only send images and audio but cant send any videos.

title: What‚Äôs happening to LinkedIn?
review:
My son has been with LinkedIn for several years but rarely uses his account today his account is restricted.
There is no method to actually speak to a human being at LinkedIn there is no site that will link you to an actual human being so how can he even find out what caused the restriction?
For a site that demands so much to join you would think they might have an actual process to go through to unrestrict an account.  Very dissatisfying to say the least.

title: About ready to delete
review: The more items you keep adding to the ‚ÄúMy Network‚Äù tab, the closer I am to deleting this app! If I delete one of your ‚Äúrecommendations‚Äù once, that means I don‚Äôt want to connect with the person or subscribe to the link, newsletter or hashtag. Got it? And the ‚Äúbased on your profile‚Äù connection additions must be very loosely defined in your algorithm!!! Not going to put up with this repetitive requirement too much longer. Dissatisfied.

title: Handy but not equivalent to website
review: The app is great don‚Äôt get me wrong, but I often encounter issues when trying to update my profile. Additionally, it lacks a fair amount of features that the website offers, such as seeing most recent post first. It‚Äôs frustrating when a majority of the post a 3 weeks old, I‚Äôd rather see most recent post in my feed.

title: Another FB group
review:
Just remember work history and profile informative have not been verified! Many people put college and degree profiles, beware ! Not true! People who provide false information should be scored as unable to validate! Un trusted profiles! Let‚Äôs score people 
Linked in would be more valuable if they told account members to call OUT all members that Lie about College degrees and work experience!

title: Hack
review: Liked the program and the connections it enabled but the app was accessed twice on my phone adding a bunch of connections I didn‚Äôt know or request. The first time I tried to reach out to LinkedIn but they provide no way to contact them. After the second hack even though I changed the password Ideleted the app. If it happens a third time then I‚Äôll disable the account

title: This app is crap
review: It‚Äôs okay when you‚Äôre Easy applying and even then sometimes I get errors. I apply for jobs on my iPad. The worst is when I apply for a job and it takes me to the company‚Äôs form. It‚Äôs still in LinkedIn but it never fails, it always freezes and all the information I have entered falls into a black hole. I then have to start over. If you‚Äôre going to apply for jobs in LinkedIn, do so on your Mac or PC not on a tablet or phone.

title: Buggy
review:
The app struggles with freezing for me. iOS 11. 

I have clicked apply for some jobs and it takes me to the job posting for some companies and then everything freezes until the app crashes. Way to go, LinkedIn! I‚Äôve contacted their social media team about this, and whomever responded to my inquiry about trying to fix this isn‚Äôt very good at her job. Nothing like asking me everything that I‚Äôve already said and volunteered. üëéüèª

The app needs work and so do the techs at this place.

title: App needs a feature update
review: I‚Äôm not sure why an app such as this has not adapted the ability to allow the timeline to be organized by ‚Äúmost recent‚Äù.  The web version offers it.  Why not the app?  Let‚Äôs get this feature implemented LinkedIn UX team.

title: Freezes too much
review: What‚Äôs the point in having the option to apply for a job if the app is going to crash EVERY time I try? I can scroll through the list of job openings, but once I hit apply, it freezes and crashes. A few times, I managed to start the application before it froze. I‚Äôm a student and have heard about how great this app is for finding jobs, thought it would be worth a shot and it hasn‚Äôt been.

title: President, Girard-Lake City Chamber of Commerce
review: In addition to finding my current position through LinkedIn, it has been my lifeline for professional networking. I have secured two private consulting engagements solely thanks to LinkedIn.  It allows access to my recommendations publicly 24/7 and has changed my life.

title: The Best Link!!!
review: "LinkedIn" is the best way for professionals and job seekers to stay abreast of the current job market that is specific to your profile! Stay "LinkedIn" to your occupational interests, your work staff, colleagues and more! I like it a lot. You don't have to be job seeking to enjoy being "LinkedIn!"

title: Hmmmm
review: I can relate to how you feel! However maybe this platform can help someone by saving their life!! Much better than helping to get someone a job don‚Äôt you think??? I really do understand your frustration though!!!üá∫üáæüá∫üá∏üá¶üá™üá¶üá™üáªüá®üá∫üá¶üáπüá¥üáªüá™üáªüá™üáπüá¥üáøüáºüá∫üá¶üáπüá≤üáπüá∞üá¨üáßüáªüá®üá¶üá™üá∏üá™üá®üá≠üáπüá®üáªüá®üáπüá¥üáªüá®üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å•Û†ÅÆÛ†ÅßÛ†Åøüáßüá±üá¶üá™üá®üá≠üáºüá´üáªüá®üá∫üáøüá¶üá™üá∫üá∏üáªüá™üáπüáªüáªüá≥üáπüáªüáªüá≥üáªüá≥üáªüá≥üáªüá≥üáªüá≥üáªüá≥

title: Removed the My Network Button with no alternative
review: Just the other day they added a ‚ÄúDiscover‚Äù button in place of the ‚ÄúMy Network‚Äù button. That‚Äôs great and all trying out new features, but they left absolutely no alternative method to get to pending connection requests. One would think they‚Äôd provide an alternate location to view that if they‚Äôre removing it from the main feed bar at the bottom. ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

title: Couldn't even use the app
review: I downloaded the app in my private phone and asked me to sync my calendar right away without option to skip. I don't even use my personal phone for meetings, and I didn't want to sync my calendar so I couldn't start to the app at all. I can't believe how greedy is this company for data (calendar, contacts, etc.). App uninstalled. I will have to use the web version in my phone. Shame on all of you.

title: Upon being restricted üò∂
review:
they well put too much on resume production over an incident in Saint Petersburg,Florida, where a human resources full stack was disgruntled enough to delete as many resumes as the population of Ottawa, Illinois.  How could so many STILL put an emphasis on resume production in the wake of this, let alone allow her to have active status?

The thing with the iOS features now that I am locked out you made it hard for my classmate to work with my cousin.  Really?!?

title: Feed is useless
review: The feed is absolutely useless anymore due to LinkedIn refusing to let us sort by date.  Algorithmic feeds are DUMB.  Right now my top post is a month old.  My top five are all greater than a week old.  Just absolutely completely useless.  I want to see what‚Äôs new NOW.  Not some post from 2 weeks ago I‚Äôve already seen.  Pathetic. I do not understand why LinkedIn won‚Äôt give us the option. Twitter does! They do on their website. But their app? Nope.

title: Keep in touch
review: I sincerely appreciate linked in. I am able to stay in touch with people I previously worked with and encourage them on their journey. As important, I am able to meet new professionals and learn about the amazing work going on around the planet. Thank you!

title: Feed Shows Error, Thus Unusable
review: A lot of my friends and family have suggested to me that I use LinkedIn some years ago. I downloaded the app back then and setup everything. It worked fine. Fast forward to today as I'm looking to relocate and find a new job, and I fire up the app and it simply says "Sorry, we weren't able to load your feed. Let's try again..." with a retry button. The retry button loads for a split second and then same error. Nothing in the app works.

title: The biggest waste of time ever
review: Seriously so pointless. I never get any job I apply for on here. The design of the app is all over the place. Lastly, whoever is running Linked in is literally scamming desperate people looking for work through the premium subscription. I‚Äôll never use Linked again, it‚Äôs always a waste of time & money for me. Paid $30 for a subscription that they bombard you with in order to access anything extra but even with the subscription is pointless

title: Great app! User friendly... easy to navigate.
review: One of the better apps out there. Very user friendly. Don‚Äôt have to spend a lot of time navigating when trying to utilize the main functions of the desktop website via the app...

title: App hasn‚Äôt worked in months
review:
I have used Linked In and Sales Navigator for years, but now my activity has dramatically decreased because the app never works. Every day for the last six months or so, my page won‚Äôt load and I get a message that it‚Äôs not me and to try again later. I have re installed the app and same thing. 

Linked in customer service is notoriously bad so I guess I‚Äôm just out of luck. 

Not a very good example of a business platform when the app doesn‚Äôt work.

title: Job Recommendations in App doesn‚Äôt work
review: I have repeatedly deleted and downloaded this app to continually come upon a screen that say ‚ÄúNo Recommend Jobs‚Äù and to Update my experience. This is very odd because when I go to the full website there are an abundance of job recommendations and my profile page is completely updated with 15+ years of experience and LinkedIn labels my profile as ‚ÄúAll Star‚Äù. No must use for the app at this point when it‚Äôs not so fingertip convenient.

title: Buggy
review: Latest version has a lot of bugs on iPhone.  Trying to x people out is instead sending invitations to them.  Not nearly as good as indeed for job search.  Keep getting invitations from people I don‚Äôt know, when I dismiss, the invitation shows up again numerous times.  Need to fix the bugs and improve job search section to avoid spammers or this will continue to be a second rate app for job seekers.

title: Updates to profiles are frustrating
review: When updating information in current profile, it‚Äôs frustrating to have limitations of character numbers even shorter to the current descriptions displayed in profiles. Just changing a few words in my profile forced me to remove 400 characters of my current descriptions. After 30 min of ‚Äúforced‚Äù editing, I finally gave up on making any updates to my profile. Very frustrating and such a waste of time!

title: Stop prompting me to spam my contacts
review:
Every time I open the app, I have to go through the same "tutorial". I've used the app before, so I know LinkedIns capabilities. The worst part is that you constantly try to make me inadvertently spam my contact list with connection emails. For such a large company, this is a very disappointing app.

Update: issues still persist. When I say ‚Äúno thanks‚Äù please don‚Äôt make me say it every step of the tutorial

title: LinkedIn will hijack your account
review:
Used linkedin and one day my account was restricted for some unknown reason that was never disclosed to me and to unlock it they want a copy of my drivers license or passport which has private info on it and they promised to delete after they verify who you are Really just like Facebook never shared your personal info Just wondering what other websites require that and why I would do that to expose me to id fraud 

Do not use LinkedIn 

If you want to expose yourself to this use them

title: This app is horrible to the point of being unusable
review:
I use LinkedIn a lot on the web and on my iPhone. I have a paid subscription. The ideal place for me to use LinkedIn is on my iPad. But I can't because this app has no useful functionality and it crashes constantly. I'm using it on an iPad Pro 12.9‚Äù.

The developer response shows how much they don‚Äôt care: They didn‚Äôt even read my review.  The app works.  It just lacks any functionality to make it useful.  It‚Äôs is crippled, not broken.

title: Feature Deleted
review: With the newest 2022 app update, I can no longer make posts on my business page. I used to be able to easily post on both my personal account and business page, and can no longer do this. PLEASE FIX!!!

title: Hooked on LinkedIn
review: I have become hooked on LinkedIn. I find my self on there all the time. I've gone from under 2000 contacts to well over 6300. It's a great place to connect. The app on my iPhone works even better than what you find online.

title: People misuse it as a dating app
review: I am on here strictly to connect professionally with people. This is 80 percent of the opposite sex collecting and preying with personal questions. I am not on there to find a date. The only reason I have not deleted it be because there has been professional people reach out. I will say though, a lot of people are in left field asking you to change professions to something that has nothing to do with what your currently doing. It may be a quota they must reach out to.

title: My favorite social app for business!
review:
I use LinkedIn daily to follow trends, to be challenged by articles about Leadership, Employee/Customer Experience, and to connect with industry leaders all over the world. 

I love the way LinkedIn is impacting individuals, institutions, industries, and business sectors everywhere.

Thanks, Jeff Weiner & the LinkedIn team!

title: Poor mobile sharing
review:
LinkedIn does a great job of letting me read what thought leaders have to say, but its app is poor for sharing original content. There's no way to manage a company page from within the app, and posting pics of events is a slow and failure-riddled process. 
Perhaps this is on purpose to drive users to 3rd-party apps that LI doesn't have to support?

title: Locked out for no reason, not being let back in for no reason
review:
Used the same email for years, never changed anything. Same activity as always, update my profile or apply to jobs. Got locked out for no reason and have received no contact in over a week as to why.

Just as I‚Äôm in the middle of a job hunt.

If I can‚Äôt use LinkedIn to help with professional growth then what is the point? Downloading Indeed

title: LinkedIn will ban Conservative Views
review:
If you thought things were bad at Twitter before Elon Musk rooted out the cancel culture, wait to you experience LinkedIn. Left Wing Progressives will harass the platform to ban you if they don‚Äôt like your posts and the ‚Äúauditors of free speech‚Äù will be more than happy to oblige them. This is now my 3rd and final time.

There are some very good people still working at LinkedIn, but since MicroSoft took over the great vision of their founders has been disrespected and disgraced. What a shame!

title: Dysfunctional
review: App is okay overall, but has numerous glitches. Example:  Second step of the ‚Äòadd hiring banner‚Äô process asks one for an email but there is simply a white screen with no field to input an email, no next button, etc.  Your app should not offer to place these banners if it does not work properly so one can complete the process.  I want my five minutes back.

title: Dr. David Chalnick
review: Had a 5 star visit with Dr. Chalnick yesterday he has operated on me for a broken femur in the past. Hopefully he will replace my L hip for me in late October. I have total confidence in him He is a marvelous human being and an incredible fantastic orthopedic surgeon. I would recommend him to anyone!

title: Help for download Link for ios 12.5.5
review:
My phone uses iOS 12.5.5 because it is 5s. After updating the Linkdin app, I can not longer use this app because the new version update is only for iOS 13 and later, how can I download the old version of linkdin? Please help me.
Thanks a lot

title: Great app. Too many emails.
review:
Great app. Too many emails. Yes I want job recommendations via email but there is currently no way to get one email p/day never mind am or pm. Instead my email just fills up.

It would also be great if the job search area incorporated company and job ratings like glassdoor. Then this would try be a one stop job shop.

title: LinkedIn App usability
review: Hello, I used LinkedIn regularly and for the most part it works well. I have to use it on my laptop because there seems to be no way to change the view in the app to most recent post‚Ä¶ I would imagine this is a pretty simple fix since it is available in the website‚Ä¶ thoughts admin?

title: No privacy
review:
It‚Äôs crazy that it takes upwards of 3-4 hours to clean up your connections like removing people.  It‚Äôs crazy that it takes another full hour to adjust your Visibility settings. It‚Äôs crazy that the person has to go through 30 different ‚Äúprivacy‚Äù settings.  It‚Äôs almost like they hope the average person overlooks one.

The security on this site is almost as bad as FB.  Sad because I love the App otherwise and the company.

title: Excellent app, but just a minor suggestion.
review:
Dear developers,

Could you please include a Dark Theme for the app? It would be of much convenience for those with issues related to their vision. Plus, a lot of people enjoy the aesthetic of darker themes, meaning it could attract more users.

Thank you for your time!

title: Profile photo updates
review: I tried to update my profile photo from app, once I choose a pic, app doesn‚Äôt show the original picture. Instead it applies filters on top of it and I can‚Äôt revert back to my original picture. Finally I deleted the profile picture and have to try from browser. This is such a bad user experience

title: Communication platform
review: This is a great and powerful platform for interaction between businesses people. You can easy four out potential colleagues and discuss your topic. I would recommend Pro version, where you get accessed to some internal info about companies and employees.

title: Forget it!
review:
Time to forget LinkedIn. They had no problem forgetting me with their last update. Now, when I open the app on my iPad, they tell me to upgrade, then I'm told my iPad isn't good enough anymore when I do try to update. 
It's been a couple of weeks now. I could get there on my desktop, but don't, so have realized that I'm not missing the pages of Facebook-like personal memes and the messages from self proclaimed "Social Media Experts" promising to provide unlimited growth for my business.

title: It‚Äôs just not working
review: Every time I open the app, something isn‚Äôt working. I‚Äôve tried to add my skills several times and each time, it tells me for some reason the function isn‚Äôt working and to try again. Today, I tried to add experience and I clicked save 4 times and still didn‚Äôt not save. I‚Äôve updated the app so I‚Äôm not sure what is wrong.

title: It works...when it wants to.
review: I wish I could attach a screenshot. I have been a fan of LinkedIn since the beginning but have always been annoyed by its lackluster quirks. One of the things that annoys me most is the mobile app. For example, right now I am on an iPhone XR and I cannot reach my search bar or any of the buttons at the top. I hope the developers see this.

title: Don‚Äôt waste your $$$$ on the Premium subscription
review:
I have used LinkedIn for years for free, and it is okay. I like the articles and connections, but never found a job or ever got a lead that went anywhere.

Not that I am looking for a job now...but I wanted to explore what the Premium service got me. After a month I learned...not much...it was a waste of my money. It sure would not be worth the $200 plus annual cost.

Anyway...I suggest you save your money and not make the same mistake that I did!

title: Need job search update
review: I would give LinkedIn all 5 stars but it‚Äôs a bit frustrating when refining my job search to my nearest area.  It doesn‚Äôt give me the option of loading the closest and shows all jobs in no order.  Thanks for reading my review.  I will keep using the app.

title: Resume
