review: No matter how many times I try to upload my resume it does not work please fix this I want to be able to put my resume on my profile it is beyond annoying, because every time I try to upload my resume it‚Äôs only part of it it doesn‚Äôt upload the entire thing and it‚Äôs extremely frustrating.

title: Latest version keeps crashing on iPhone X
review: The latest version hangs more often than not. Overall, good for a professional social network and keeping in touch with coworkers that you do not want on other social networks. Ever since they moved jobs into a separate app, this seems fragmented and less useful unless u use it to increase ur prof network

title: Issues issues issues
review:
The app has been having issues off and on fire a year. First i would get hundreds of emails from old dead groups with no way to unsubscribe. Talked to their help desk and they said I had to search and find each group and block it. 

Now every other time i log in it says it can't load feed, no profile, messages won't send or load. 

For a company based solely on an app, you guys aren't working very hard on keeping it functional.

title: LinkedIn App
review:
Love the LinkedIn App.  It is easy to use and is a lot like Twitter - only you are allowed to leave much more data.  I find I come to Linked now than before the App.  It is helpful in getting to see people‚Äôs skills and seeing how others rate them.  I‚Äôm having coffee next week with a new business partner.  Thanx to LinkedIn.

Sarah D

title: Fantastic tool
review: The app is useful in keeping me up to date on all relevant information related to the AEC industry which I work within. It‚Äôs easy to connect with people and do research, it‚Äôs become an integral way to do business. Would highly recommend!!

title: So much spam
review:
LinkedIn is supposed be a professional network where people can connect. At least that‚Äôs what I thought I LinkedIn is supposed to be. 

I would like LinkedIn to figure out a way to limit the amount of spam I get from salespeople.

title: Too Basic
review:
As someone who uses LinkedIn to mostly update and post on a company page that I run,  it is frustrating that there is not the capability to do this within the app. 

Will this be a function eventually? I'm always on the go and wanting to post company updates, but have to wait until I'm at a computer screen. Please help me out here! :)

title: Business Owner
review: LinkedIn allows me to connect with the world.  It keeps me current with today‚Äôs trending topics and is a great resource for research.  Another note is that it tells you a little bit more about someone you may be considering for employment or engaging in business.

title: Amazing !
review: I‚Äôm a makeup artist , nail tech & esthetician . Linked in is a fantastic way to network , connect with professionals in your industry too. I‚Äôve gotten many job offers from here . Be active on your networking , and have people connect with you to build your network .

title: Useful but some features don't work
review: It successfully shows me lots of available jobs, but their filter feature is broken. I filtered by Industry yet I was getting matches for the Industries I did not choose! Also, after I spent a lot of time choosing my filter options, they all went away when I made a change to the search text.

title: Best Networking Site
review: LinkedIn is an amazing place to network with business professionals and learn from others and view the insights and ideas of so many people in every possible field of work you can think of. Keep up the good work.

title: Intuitive App
review: LinkedIn has done well making their website and apps easier and more attractive. I love the app! Easy to navigate and provides all the functions you need to network and communicate with others.

title: The newly posted dynamic information cannot be displayed promptly on the homepage.
review: The company's newly released updates do not appear promptly on the homepage of followers' mobile apps. They can be viewed in the "Posts - Images" section, but in order to see the latest content on the homepage, users need to log out and then log back in.

title: Cannot view notifications on my app
review: Why is it both the new updated version and the previous one for this app, that I cannot view any notifications?  I have to sign into my LinkedIn account on the computer to view any and all notifications.  Is someone going to fix this?

title: really upsetting me
review: i only put 5 stars because i need this to be read immediately. i've been trying to create an account all morning and it's telling me my account is restricted? i haven't even been able to use the account so how would it even be restricted. i can't even get into it to make a profile for myself. i'm stuck at the login part. i'm being told by a friend it could be my comcast email? is this true? is there any way i can get help to make an account?

title: App Keeps Crashing
review: I love this app and all the opportunities it provides, but as of late, it is practically unusable. I can‚Äôt be on the app for more than 1 minute at most before it glitches and kicks me out. I came to the App Store to see if the app was up to date, and sure enough, it is. I‚Äôm just leaving this review so that someone can be notified of the issue and make necessary improvements.

title: Great for phone; horrible for iPad
review: I love the phone UX and experience.  However on my iPad the app is crap (it is a phone app enlarged).  I use the web browser (mobile desktop) version than the app because it is so bad.  I do NOT understand why LinkedIn cannot by this point have an app for iPad.  It is pretty ridiculous for a company so focused on business owners that are predominantly on mobile devices.

title: So easy to get restricted
review: I am adding people through recommendation page. After finishing adding recommendations, my account got restricted because it thinks I‚Äôm using a software to add ppl??? This is so stupid that LinkedIn doesn‚Äôt want user use software to add people so they just restrict all user who‚Äôs expanding networks actively üòÇat the end, who will keep using LinkedIn if they treat their user like a one-time user? Or are they just want to be a professional version of INS?

title: Aggressive in background and without value
review:
This app has no value when you look at what the timeline is and what posts are. You are just told you ‚Äúhave to be on it‚Äù in career. 

Somehow I got signed out and constantly the iPhone password sign in for LinkedIn shows up when I am using safari, on my Home Screen, doing nothing related to LinkedIn. This app is doing a lot of aggressive and potentially shady things in the background of a smartphone.

title: Mobile app
review: I love the new LinkedIn however I‚Äôve noticed that some individuals message history disappears? Is this a glitch? My WiFi is on when this happens and I definitely did not delete messages. Please explain why it‚Äôs happening with one or two people and others are fine? Thanks.

title: LinkedIn is USELESS.
review: LinkedIn literally suspends your account for LOOKING at profiles!! And I have the photo proof. They didn‚Äôt suspend me for following too many people or sending too many messages. What is the point of a social media site that doesn‚Äôt let you BROWSE profiles? They actually don‚Äôt want you to use their site. And to make it even better, there is NO option to speak with anyone to even question why they would do that.

title: Read the entire post / article before your phone goes dark or you will never see it again.
review: Doesn‚Äôt matter what you click on to read. If you don‚Äôt read / watch it all in that initial sitting you will never find the article / video / post again. When you go back into the app it refreshes for you even if you don‚Äôt want it too.

title: Often frustrating.
review: Great concept. Good for maintaining contacts. Often frustrating to use. Bizarre to see an interesting article appear- but disappear almost immediately. If you pass it by temporarily it may not be there if you scroll back. Ads and truly inane postings however remain for weeks.

title: Can‚Äôt update information.
review:
This app would be great if you could use it to do anything except view your page. 
I can‚Äôt add connections, change an email or phone number, or really do anything except delete what‚Äôs already there. The app just gives me an error any time I try. ‚ÄúSomething went wrong. Please try again later.‚Äù I thought it would be a temporary problem, but it‚Äôs been a few weeks now and trying again later hasn‚Äôt helped.

title: Save Job Button Doesn‚Äôt Work
review:
For the past year, the Save button has not being working and doesn‚Äôt allow me to save jobs that I‚Äôm interested in so I can apply at a later time.

The error that appears is ‚ÄúSomething we‚Äôve wrong. Please try again.

If this is a system glitch, it needs to be addressed because it‚Äôs very inconveniencing.

title: Can‚Äôt delete profile due to subscription trap
review: I purchased a Premium subscription through the App Store, but decided I didn‚Äôt want a profile anymore. You have to convert your subscription to Basic before you can delete it, which is ridiculous. When I try to convert to Basic from the App Store, I only have options to renew Premium and am told to contact Apple to cancel or change my account. When I contacted Apple, the advisor told me to contact LinkedIn. Ridiculous.

title: Navigation
review: LinkedIn is my user friendly. I believe a menu format would serve the membership better. Anything not related to business, finding a job, sending a resume directly to a company which usesLinkedIn to garner prospective employees can be made simpler.

title: Best hospitality staffing app that I‚Äôve used or seen
review: Be diligent, pay close attention, especially in the beginning so you don‚Äôt miss appointments or gigs, till you get used to how it works. Once you get the hang of it, it‚Äôs awesome and the best way to bridge the gap to good paying gigs in a convenient and interactive.

title: Overall seamless experience...
review: ...except for the Turn App Lock On? feature.  When I answered yes, I had to manually sign in every time I launch the app as face recognition captures enters my login  as  password but does not automatically sign me.  To resolve this I had to uninstall the app and reinstalled to answer NO to the Turn App Lock On?

title: Isn‚Äôt working
review: The app and the website literally have been logging me out about every minute for over 24 hours. I am wondering if it has something to do with the recent updates they made. Every time I log back in it says that o need to do a security check to make sure I am not a robot.  This is ridiculous!  Also technical support called and said nothing is wrong just give it some time.  That is strange. If nothing was wrong why would I need to give it time?

title: Enough with the ads, suggestions, and random topic suggestions
review: Doesn't seem to be any rhyme or reason to posts sequencing. I see the same content for weeks. Not worth The download. Not to mention most of my feed is not content I subscribed to. It looks something like ad, suggested post, linkedin learning suggested post, random topic suggested post, post fun an actual connection from 3 weeks ago (not even their most recent). Do better.

title: Not sure why but when connecting to articles app closes
review:
When someone comments on my post, iPhone 12 the App closes. IOS 16.3.1

Contacted by developer App and uninstalled/reinstalled and problem seems to be solved

Thank you

title: Doesn‚Äôt open / constantly crashes
review:
Press app, get to the loading screen than it closes. Can not get this to stop even with reinstalling app or restarting phone. Went as far as updating to newest IOS with no luck.

Been a user of the app for years and this has been the most frustrating thing I‚Äôve faced yet. Started a few days ago yet I still get the number of unread notifications on the app symbol. PLEASE FIX THIS.

title: Job search terrible experience after update
review: Before the last update was able to sort jobs by date posted. It's very helpful to avoid having to see the same job over and over. However, now it is all "promoted" jobs that show. Bring back the ability to show those posted most recently.

title: Too much personal data collected
review: While I find LinkedIn very useful, once I looked at the data they are collecting from my phone with this app I decided to delete it and access only from a browser. Look for yourself what they are looking at and collecting from your phone. My personal business should be just that, personal and not subject to data mining.

title: Got a job!
review:
After college I‚Äôve worked in healthcare made ok money. But with rent+inflation continuing to rise there‚Äôs times I‚Äôd never have money left over.

I applied to a jobs on LinkedIn and landing a job with a salary I never thought I would have!

title: Overall Good
review: The app is overall pretty good for its intended purpose of connecting you to the professional world around you. My only qualm is not being able to update my location on my profile for some reason. Upon every attempt, it says ‚Äúfailed to update location‚Äù :( very strange

title: App keeps signing me out and privacy issues
review:
This is the second update within the past year in which the app signs people out every time they close it. Please fix this again. 

Also, looking at all the privacy and visibility toggles, it looks like our LinkedIn profiles can be viewed outside the website and by non-members. Being owned by Microsoft, one would think these security risks would be minimized instead of the current default settings, no?

title: Logout issue + Same canned response for every review
review: I'm experiencing the same extremely annoying logout issue everyone else is, but what's even more disappointing is that while reading through the reviews, I see that LinkedIn is providing the same exact canned response to the complaints. You are too established a company to have this poor of a customer service response. I have been an extreme advocate of LinkedIn, but will now reserve the praise and recommendation I previously gave this company.

title: App Opens and Closes
review: I haven‚Äôt been able to use the app in over a week. I have done updates upon updates and nothing has worked. The web-based version has been great! I have enjoyed connecting with people in my field.

title: App looks great, but
review:
It has all the knobs and switches in the mobile app, they just all don‚Äôt work, or they don‚Äôt work well.
I decided to try replacing my laptop with a tablet for the summer.  I discovered that the jobs profile page won‚Äôt update, and gives a useless error.  After repeated attempts I had to fall back to the web site.

Apps with features that don‚Äôt work, or don‚Äôt work right, are frustrating.  Especially when you trust that the updates you made have actually been made.  It was not obvious, either, that the updates had not ‚Äòtaken‚Äô, even though no error was received at the end.

When features don‚Äôt work in an app it is an embarrassment to the company, a sign of poor software development practices, and insufficient testing.

title: Please solve this issue
review:
I don't know whats wrong with the app because it get stuck and then not responding even though that i have the last version of the app . 

I hope you please solve this issue because I'm using this app a lot .

title: The news feed is garbage
review: I‚Äôm constantly seeing posts and articles and ads I‚Äôve seen a dozen times or more. I shouldn‚Äôt be seeing posts that are 2 weeks old, talking about things that have since passed. Hiding annoying, repetitive ads does nothing to change the feed either, so you‚Äôre stuck looking at the same ad until LinkedIn moves on. LinkedIn itself is great but its app is terrible.

title: Ruined by tabloid trash.
review:
Was a good app until LinkedIn ruined it by adding top stories/ trending that you cannot disable. Last thing I want from a professional app is depressing news of human stupidity. Let us disable it. You are not Facebook. Let me decide what's good for me.
Update Nice form letter from a "developer". Bot  Almost as bad as saying that "your call is very important to us. Please hold" sooo no plans to give me an option to disable ur click bait trash.

title: Strictly Business
review: I love using this app to connect with people in my local business community and also with those whom have the same career interests as I do. User friendly and look forward to some future updates

title: Can‚Äôt see what your typing
review: Whenever I try to type anything, the app itself always scrolls up so I can‚Äôt see what I‚Äôm typing. If I scroll up to try to see what I‚Äôm typing, my keyboard goes away, when I try to type again, it scrolls up so far you can‚Äôt see anything you type. Doesn‚Äôt happen on the website so maybe it‚Äôs time to call it quits on this app.

title: Buggy
review: App is extremely bugged, it constantly freezes and needs restarting every time I use it. When I try to apply more than one filter in the search, it completely resets. The app crashes every time I try to report a scam which btw, there are a lot of scam listings and companies that Linkedin does not take down because it doesn‚Äôt ‚Äúviolate their policy‚Äù.

title: The current state of LinkedIn
review:
LinkedIn slaps. Unlike Instagram, LinkedIn is for winners. LinkedIn doesn't allow losers to sign up, I had my friends try. An Alpha Application at the minimum. Just a reminder kids, winners win. Stay hard.

-Self-Proclaimed LinkedIn ‚ÄúLicensed and Insured‚Äù Hypeman

title: App continues to stink
review: I really like LinkedIn on the pc but the app continues to stink. It‚Äôs been a while since I used to app but it locked up twice today when I when to look at my profile. In the past it was horrible trying to post pictures. I gave up on that long time ago and use the pc only.

title: Best job search/apply platform
review:
You only need Linkedin to find and get any job you want. All centralized there. No need for any other platform, gotten all my jobs thru there including a FAANG. 
It‚Äôs your online resume!!

title: Timeline in need of a major overhaul.
review: Please fix the timeline feed in the mobile app! It‚Äôs been years that the timeline lack the ability to be able to be adjusted and I continue to see posts that are weeks and months old featured in my timeline. I should have the ability to make adjustments and see what I feel is relevant as opposed to having the app make the decision.

title: Waste of time
review: The fact that I had to sign up for a free trial just to message someone but I‚Äôm still unable to because I have to complete five different steps is ridiculous. All I needed to do was get into contact with one individual. I shouldn‚Äôt have to go through a whole marathon of steps and different things just to get two credits so I canceled my subscription service and I‚Äôm deleting the app. Thanks for the waste of time.

title: Slow
review: Ever since I started my LinkedIn Premium free trial, both the app on my phone and the website on my computer have been incredibly slow. It takes five minutes to load a page and in the end it fails to load. I tried submitting an online ticket regarding this issue but even that didn‚Äôt work because the website is so slow, using LinkedIn has become agonizing lately.

title: Issues since I upgraded to iPhone 13
review: Ever since I‚Äôve upgraded my phone to the iPhone 13, the app doesn‚Äôt load and I‚Äôm prompted to try again later or retry. I‚Äôve updated all the updates and restarted multiple times. Sometimes the app doesn‚Äôt load with WiFi capability. Very frustrating.

title: Sometimes works
review: The app mostly works but sometimes there are issues. I know ios13 is buggy but they should have a whole team working on making this app as good as possible. I tried uploading my user profile image from the app and after several attempts had to go to the mobile web version of the app.

title: Absolute hot garbage
review: The search engine is absolutely terrible (searching for ‚Äòanimal control‚Äô pulled up a bunch of manufacturering jobs) the recommended page is absolutely irrelevant and recommends jobs all the way across the country rather than near me or even in my state, the network page is essentially useless‚Ä¶basically only download LinkedIn if you‚Äôre looking for a Facebook thats slow, clunky, and has a horrendous UI.

title: Censorship and Banning of Conservatives
review: Don‚Äôt try to post anything that doesn‚Äôt conform to the left leaning designated programming. You‚Äôll get censored and eventually banned. No explanation besides a vague citation that you violated their community guidelines. They can‚Äôt handle the truth and therefore silence truth-tellers. But hey, post about cute puppy dogs or business subjects and you‚Äôll be fine. Just don‚Äôt post about Liberty being lost or trampled on, and exposing lies. We can‚Äôt have any of that. It‚Äôs against community guidelines.

title: Crashes every time since the last update
review: I enjoy reading professional articles that I find on the app. However, since the last update, the app crashed almost every time. Didn't take much for the app to crash: I just scroll down, the app freezes for several seconds, then it crashes. This makes the app useless, and I hope the developer team fixes it soon.

title: Not even worthy of one star
review: This app is horrible.  I literally had to pass through three security steps to log in each and every time no matter what I did to change my settings.  This was one huge headache and I agree with other users that the interface is inadequately designed, with alerts that are difficult to manage.  Do yourself a favor and use a different app for networking to remove a lot of stress from your job search!

title: Cannot update language in app
review: I have been using LinkedIn for years and I love the strong functions for job searching and connecting. But I don‚Äôt know why I cannot update the language in the app... whenever I write my info in English it still appears to be Chinese.. I hope this could be solved

title: Can make it better
review:
This app is good, can be made better by making it ‚Äòreal‚Äô to the core.
In my opinion people use this app more for personal gains than making overall enrichment, uplifting professional standards. 
I do feel that the app keeps on changing on regular basis and try to improve constantly.

title: Auto renews premium for $60
review: I kept getting pop ups telling me to do the LinkedIn premium trial and I clicked it just to get it to stop since it was free. Repeatedly tried to cancel the subscription and the app kept producing an error instead of taking me to my subscriptions. I ended up going through apple after I was charged $60 to renew for features I did not even use. They don‚Äôt give refunds and don‚Äôt seem to have any customer service number to contact. Terrible.

title: Excellent communication platform
review: Had account since 2009, great informative platform. I select the type of information interested in and from which source. Most importantly, I stay connect with professionals from all branches of business.

title: Still too small to read,,,,
review: I have complained about this issue 5 YEARS ago and it still has not been resolved. I am legally and can still read IF I can enlarge the font. However, I cannot increase the font or use the magnifier when using or trying to use the app on iPad. This app is NOT accessible friendly for me. So, it is apparent to me that this app and the website is for people who have good eyesight only. I will continue to give BAD ratings until this is resolved,

title: Want to manage my company page
review: With companies doing more on LinkedIn it is surprising that I can‚Äôt post things to the corporate page from a Mobil platform. I‚Äôm not saying I want a FB Pages ap because that is rather stupid, but I need to be able to do things on the go from my phone. I don‚Äôt want to have to be at my desk to update things. Add that, you go to 5 stars.

title: LinkedIn - iPhone
review: For some reason, LinkedIn on my iPhone struggles. It shows a notification, but when I click on the app, it won‚Äôt show any updates or that there‚Äôs a flag. I try to update and get a ‚Äúno internet connection‚Äù error message. I have to close and open the app SEVERAL times to get it to update. Makes me less likely to use the app.

title: Getting back in the job market
review: I have been with one of the leading banking industry for 30 years and never tried to look into other fields or industries to brighten my career. LinkedIn gave me the intuition and drive to search at what else is out there for my career interests.

title: LinkedIn Love
review: Love LinkedIn App. Keeps me connected with colleagues, friends, customers and contacts that live overseas. I don‚Äôt even read the news I just look at the news feed on linked in. Always has interesting articles and news.

title: Sir William Wade Jennings Jr
review: Although, I have not used this app at present in past times I have taken advantage of your services rendered.  I find you to be very reputable and resourceful.  Keep doing what you do best and I would not change a thing.

title: Never subscribe for anything because they will rip you off
review:
If you subscribe, you will not know what you subscribed for (not all services are under the subscription page). So you'll end up being charged on a monthly basis and it's not a small amount. 

So I was chatting with friends and they told me that they had the same thing happening to them too. 

Oh, and good luck getting in touch with customer service.

title: quit my day job
review: i quit my day job and LOVE this ap for finding gigs to work whenever i WANT to work easy to use good pay good gig options (and a lot of them) i recommend this app to ALL my friends and family!

title: They‚Äôll take your money and lock you out
review: I was in the job market and (foolishly) paid for Indeed premium. They locked me out for unspecified reasons‚Ä¶ I think because the first name I use in daily life doesn‚Äôt *exactly* match the government-issued ID I use, but that seems pretty common? Anyway, hard to say since they also won‚Äôt communicate with me, but I can say for sure that any money spent on the ‚ÄúPremium Career‚Äù version of this app is money wasted.

title: Still not working right
review: 6 almost 7 months and still doesn‚Äôt work right. Every single time I tap my profile it freezes. Reinstalled it a dozen times, tried everything even LinkedIn  support, nothing. Pretty worthless if you can‚Äôt access any settings or profile or pages you run. Microsoft seems to have not changed their ways for quality since the 90s, as in poor.

title: Invasive and filled with bots
review:
Why LinkedIn needs a ‚Äúfeed‚Äù I‚Äôll never know. Either way it uses invasive means to populate it with ads and stories.

The worst part of the ap is it‚Äôs fake job postings that could be easily screened out. Instead LinkedIn goes out of its way to put them first for the people most likely to apply to them. The result is false hope and a needlessly long job search while you struggle to even pay your bills.

title: Refresh Rate Is Absurd + Removed ‚ÄúCurious‚Äù Reaction
review: Stop refreshing the content / taking me back to the feed every time I leave the app for a second! It‚Äôs impossible to read articles, comments, etc. in the app anymore. At the very least, provide a way to get back to what I was just looking at. Also, they removed the ‚Äúcurious‚Äù reaction to articles / content in the newsfeed, which was one of the best reactions. Stop removing functionality!

title: Buggy
review:
Not sure what is going on with the app 
But the messenger is not working well 
Type a message and it won‚Äôt send or sends the message multiple times and also messages don‚Äôt show up and app shuts down while typing a message. 
Have to use my laptop to work on LinkedIn
Pain in the A

title: Horrible
review: I don‚Äôt write reviews often, but this app does nothing but take forever to load, sending  messages takes forever because it takes to long to think to type and after a minute it‚Äôll just crash. I use this app to talk to people at work‚Ä¶I don‚Äôt have time for it to take forever to load received messages and then crash before I can even reply! Fix your bugs!

title: Algorithmic Catastrophe
review: Meta‚Äôs mobile application for Linkedin almost mirrors Facebook in almost every terrible way - where the algorithm‚Äôs recommended posts show things you have already seen and continue to see for a week or more. The amount of suggested content and lack of relevancy is overwhelming. All culminating in a horrendous waste of time and siloing echo chambers instead of enabling professionals to connect and share thoughts to the network holistically.

title: I‚Äôm not able to listen to audio events from My Network
review: I‚Äôm not able to listen to audio events from my network in the app. All of my network audio events have an error page when I click on the ones that just started 5 minutes ago.

title: Pronouns Not Showing Up
review: Colleagues have recently mentioned LinkedIn add the capability to add pronouns on your profile. I haven‚Äôt been able to find this setting via the app or desktop website. Is this feature still being rolled out?

title: Another social network with spam
review:
Recently I reported posts that were spamming a local professional networking group and the official response was that the posts were not against LinkedIn policies.  If blatant and super repetitive spam is not against LinkedIn policies then it should be.   

To make matters worse, it was not intuitive to leave the group.  Come on LinkedIn.  Do better.

title: Great
review: This app is so easy to use and user friendly. Only negative is that it feels a little too focused on being a social network. But overall it‚Äôs just a ton faster and cleaner than indeed or handshake

title: Ios 12.0 or less
review:
I am using iphone 6 and currently i disconnected from Linkedin application because always asking to update to ios 13 but my iphone 6 could not support it and i could not use this app . so i will be appreciate to keep previous version for all iphone user . 
thanks and reagrdsüôèüèªüå∑

title: Add unsend feature in message
review:
Sometime we send messages to very important peoples and mistake in typing is common problem, so please add ‚Äúunsend message‚Äù feature to make LinkedIn more perfect. 
You can keep Edit history like Facebook to avoid any abuse of this feature.

title: Developers have made the App better than the website!
review: Basically a personalized screen with less clutter than the desktop version. Facebook should copy your designs and functions!

title: Censorship
review: LinkedIn is a powerful business tool. I have used it very successfully to expand my network. BUT they have a tendency to restrict your account with no warning meaning that you have no access to the massive amount of connections and data on the platform. There is NO ONE to talk to when that happens. You are totally at their mercy. You get no warning beforehand either. So definitely keep all important contact information in your own files.

title: Search History Disappeared
review: It used to be really convenient as the job section would maintain like 10 recent searches. Now, that option is gone and it only gives three when you click on the search bar. It was much easier and convenient when the current history was available above the recommended job section. Really disappointed.

title: No benefit at all from this service
review:
First the service is just a place for people to talk but not find true solutions to the ridiculous circus that recruiting and applying has become! don't waste your money!

The software training classes do offer benefits (when the trainer doesn't mess up and misstate things)- but we need that as a separate LinkedIn module all together! and free during Covid would be more reasonable and respectful of the Gates' during this difficult time for millions of Americans!

title: Updates?
review: Like it, but would it be possible to add some fundamental app features like the ability provide feedback or bug reports in-app? That said, the keyboard keeps initiating capitalization when I didn‚Äôt press it, and this doesn‚Äôt happen on my other apps so I know it‚Äôs not an iOS bug. Wanted to send feedback without a review but couldn‚Äôt, sorry!

title: Incoherent feed
review:
I use LinkedIn multiple times daily and the iOS LinkedIn app keeps giving me out of date items on my feed, things that are weeks old. Stuff that I have commented or liked already. At least the desktop version has the Recent option but that's missing on mobile.

The app is garbage and I‚Äôm primarily on the desktop version now. If I had to use it on mobile then I‚Äôm logging in via safari until the devs fix this mess

title: Needs updated but okay
review: I have used this app for years but there is not really a way to hide ads that you don‚Äôt want to see but most importantly when your on the home screen, mine is cut off on my iPhone X and has been for some time. Makes it really hard to view profile, search and use the menu. Please fix this.

title: Retired and not looking
review: LinkedIn seems to be a wonderful way for people to network and share professional skills and knowledge. However, I am not working and not looking for work. I wonder why I have been and continue to be contacted

title: App workflow for password resets is broken
review: If you reset the password through email the app doesn‚Äôt exit you and make you log in again.  You have to uninstall and reinstall and then Choose not to log in with your profile.  Given this is something people need to be doing rather often this is a bad flaw.

title: The app freezes
review: I am using the app on iphone X, iOS 12.0. While using the app, it freezes sometimes at the videos amd sometimes at the picture posts. Have to close and reopen the app. Sometimes it freezes even after that. Would really appreciate if the LinkedIn team resolves this issue at the earliest possible opportunity.

title: It‚Äôs okay, but could be a lot better
review: I enjoy having this app on my phone in order to get updates on messages, news, and possible jobs.  What I find most irritating is that I can‚Äôt sort or even scroll to see what‚Äôs new from the last day.  I have posts that are from more than 3 weeks ago showing up, and have no relevance.  I don‚Äôt need the app showing me what it thinks I want to see.

title: Stop trying to get me to ‚Äúset up a profile‚Äù
review: I don‚Äôt know why LinkedIn, upon every login through the app‚Äù tries to get me to set up my profile by adding interests and friends and what not. My profile is already at an all star level and this is really annoying. I just wanted to check a message or looks someone up, but first I have to hit skip 20 times before I can even get in. Just uninstalled.

title: Must ‚Äì have app for a professional
review: I use LinkedIn when I go to conferences, too quickly and more affectively connect with people that I meet. I love the publishing features, which lets me promote my personal brand both inside and outside of my employer.

title: Business essential tool
review: With so much development and further refining of their model, it is now an ‚Äúessential‚Äù ingredient to have a strong LinkedIn presence for success.  They are to be congratulated (at this moment) for their innovation achievements.  Lots of activity happening in this industry space....stay tuned.

title: Bug - signing me out
review: Generally a good app. Latest version has a bug that keeps signing me out. Like every 10 minutes. And sometime when I log back in I get a "It's not you it's us" error and no content. Also, finding a path to a report a bug on your website is almost impossible, and I'm paying almost $1000 a year for premium.

title: Great! - One annoyance
review:
Good app, helps keep in touch with past and present co-workers and networking for current and future solutions.

One annoyance - Irritating to have a job open, have to change apps for a time and come back to LinkedIn home page. Just stay where I was last if I don‚Äôt close the app please.

title: Needs some love.
review:
LinkedIn leadership needs to use this app! Major annoyances:
- some ineffective process is running somewhere. While just browsing jobs my phone gets super hot. What is happening?
- scrolling views are flawed. I guess the swipe gesture in web view is preventing scroll. My 2 out of 3 slight scroll gestures are not working. Try to slowly scroll to view job listings for example.

title: Auto Refresh
review: I don't really like how every time I open the app, it auto-refreshes & I lose a certain post that I wanted to refer back to. Please create a settings option to turn off this feature! It's a nuisance to have to come back to the main feed & lose an article/ post I'd been reading.

title: Extremely Slow
review: The app is so slow to load menu changes and whatnot‚Äîso slow that it‚Äôs genuinely egregious‚Ä¶ In this day & age especially; truly laughable. I am not able to get any value out of the app & I had to resort to the browser (which on mobile doesn‚Äôt allow certain features); so I ultimately had to pull out my laptop just to do a couple of very simple things. ‚Ä¶Deserves 1/5 stars for this reason alone.

title: LinkedIn
review: My LinkedIn app did not update to the newest version, although I clicked on the option to update. The app looks different than the previewed version on the App Store. Also, the LinkedIn app, which I have now is accessing another app on my phone although I do not allow it access to do so.

title: Bugs not fixed yet?
review:
‚ÄúWhen you‚Äôre in a conversation, speed and stability matter.‚Äù ‚ÄúThis update features bug fixes.‚Äú
They have been posting the exact same thing with every update for the past few years. 
One might think by now the bugs had been fixed and the app was speedy and stable. Apparently it isn‚Äôt.

title: Stop sending me useless notifications
review: No matter what I do the app constantly will show a red 1 for a notification even if I‚Äôve turned everything off. It‚Äôs super annoying I‚Äôm tired of clicking into the app only to clear some nonsense. They are falsely boosting their user engagement by having false and useless notifications. Stick to helping people in their business careers and not promoting political nonsense and false user activity.

title: Annoyed
review: This new update is not good. I keep getting logged off; sometimes it is between sessions or if I leave the app and try to open it again. Luckily, I have my password saved on my device, so logging in isn‚Äôt a big hassle. Hope this is fixed soon, everything was working well before this past weekend!

title: Rollback your update or fix it
review: Come on LinkedIn you need to do better. The app makes me login every time I open it and sometimes it even logs me out while I‚Äôm using it. When I hit the back button it takes me to the login screen. Ridiculous. I didn‚Äôt see anything mind blowing with whatever update you just pushed so you mine as well rollback to whatever you had before since you haven‚Äôt seemed to be able to fix this in a timely manner.

title: Display issues make it unusable on any iPhone with a notch.
review: I have now tested the app on iPhone X and iPhone 12 Pro Max. The full UI does not display on these phones and makes navigation impossible. The back arrow is not accessible, meaning I have to fully kill and restart the app just to get out of certain screens. There is no search bar, and no way to get to Settings. How could Microsoft release this app like this?

title: Applied Jobs don‚Äôt show
review: I‚Äôve applied for two jobs through LinkedIn and neither show in the ‚Äúapplied jobs‚Äù section. This is frustrating Bc it would be a great way to stay organized in one app but it doesn‚Äôt work. Yes I used LinkedIn to apply. All through the app and nothing.

title: Terrible search and filter
review:
Linked in developers:

1) REDUCE CLICKS TO FIND JOBS YOU‚ÄôVE ALREADY SAVED
Why is access to this buried in going through my profile, to ‚Äúsaved items‚Äù, to jobs? Why is there no access front the Jobs page?

2) IMPROVE YOUR FILTERS!!!
Please learn from Zappos‚Äô excellent filter and search functionality and add some of their features, to help users have more appropriate content in their alerts and searches: 

a) ability to exclude results using ‚Äúnot‚Äù or ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want.‚Äù

b) FUNCTIONING filters (for example, your current industry filters do not work properly).

c) more clear and intuitive saved search criteria/editing. For the pro version, please add more criteria for indicating job search parameters to recruiters.

d) ability to create compound search criteria.

title: Password reset
review: I have tried several times to reset my password because the original password I used is invalid. When they sent me a link to reset my password it requested  that  I use my current one. My current one and the only one that I use is somehow invalid. Don‚Äôt you all send a temporary one or a link to just create a new password.

title: Doesn‚Äôt follow modern app standards
review: I‚Äôm constantly confused as to why there aren‚Äôt more swipe gestures implemented in this app. I‚Äôd really like to be able to dismiss profile previews by swiping down. I also don‚Äôt want the connection request confirmation to show at the top of the screen with no way to dismiss. Navigation needs a lot of updating to conform to modern standards.

title: Good app to network
review: Great app to network. It crashes less now than before. One think I would suggest is when there are notifications about someone‚Äôs work anniversary, it would be nice to have the automated message include the number of year of the anniversary also.

title: Jobs feature is crashing
review:
I clicked on the little briefcase icon expecting it to take me to where I can view jobs I've already applied to. After briefly flashing the screen I want, it gives me a sort of error screen "No recommended jobs" and "Add your most recent work experience..."
Any help would be appreciated! I need to track my job searches.
I've also reinstalled the app & everything fyi

title: January 2019 update screwed up the LinkedIn now feed
review:
The recent 2019 January update screwed up the news feed ( the one that comes when you scroll to the left from home screen below the search bar) . Previous it used to show articles related to employment or current employment trends but it now shows local news.

I‚Äôm not using LinkedIn to read local news certainly, please fix this issue and bring back the old ways please.

title: App stucks/hangs on iphone
review: Even though I love the platform but the app stucks/hangs very often in my Iphone with the latest updated iOS and latest linkedin app. When it happens I cant even refresh and fix it. It happens over and over again. It‚Äôs annoying and app becomes unusable. I sometimes move to my mobile browser to use the linkedIn platform when it happens.

title: ‚ÄúFor Professionals Only‚Äù
review: Doesn‚Äôt mean to have a degree or title, this means be a professional, think as a professional and perform as a professional on whatever you do, and this application will be one of the best tool you ever have to say the world who you are and what you do.

title: Phenomenal app
review: I've never experienced an error with this app! It runs smoothly, quickly, and has all the functionality I need when I'm away from a desktop. The news feed is relevant and tailored to what I'm looking for.

title: Only one issue I can find.
review:
On iPhone 11 Pro Max when in the jobs function, if you click on the distance filter, it opens at the bottom of the iPhone in a location where i am unable to adjust the distance filter.

Can provide screenshot upon request.

title: Great networking app
review: This app has been great! Able to connect and network with plenty of professionals. Has led to many job interviews and a full time job after the military! I highly recommend this app for those looking for work.

title: Terrible left wing trash app
review: Never mind this is a far left tech company that frequently deletes posts.  I can‚Äôt tell you how many times I‚Äôve received important responses to my messages without any notification at all.  I cannot put into word how much I hate LinkedIn as a paid user of their recruiter tool.  I‚Äôm not sure what‚Äôs worse, the fact they force their politics on users, or their app being buggy and unreliable.

title: Doesn‚Äôt warn you with any notifications before it starts charging when free trial ends
review:
Doesn‚Äôt warn you with any notifications before it starts charging when free trial ends. 
This is critical because it states that you must cancel the subscription a day before the free trial ends. So cancel at any time does not help you with a refund. And if you want a refund you cannot request a refund on the app and you must login on a desktop. Really?

title: Garbage feed algorithm
review: LinkedIn should be a useful website. But the inability to customize one‚Äôs Feed ‚Äî driven, I suspect, by a desire to push advertising ‚Äî means that I either have to scroll through a garbage algorithm that serves me weeks-old content or switch to most recent and scroll through every single one of my connections‚Äô little emoji reactions and comments. Let us customize what types of posts we see in your feed.

title: Saved Items
review: While the app makes it really simple to save items to read later it feels near impossible to find those in the app itself.  Please update the app to make those easier to find.  The website itself is simple but the app is horrible for that.

title: Can‚Äôt upload profile picture
review: After a recent download can‚Äôt upload a profile picture. Even decided to delete the app and tried again same thing there‚Äôs a little glitch in it it freezes when you try to do so.

title: ios version support
review:
The ridiculous fact is some phones now don‚Äôt support highest ios update versions. And with each update, the apple makes iPhone run much much slower than before so that you‚Äôd have to buy newer phones from them!
And considering all these, the developers of linkedin still decide to publish updates which only supports ios 13.
Making every single older phone or everyone who don‚Äôt want to install ios updates, unable to use the app for good.

i believe this is serious criticism for the devs to face, and i hope they reconsider the policy into a right one.

**Learn a bit from ‚ÄúTelegram‚Äù, they never expire an app version or limit the OS version compatibility at all...!**

title: Easy to use
review:
Enjoy being able to do messaging, add contacts, and read newsfeed.
Only possible improvement I can think of is to change layout to see more of feed to quickly find articles of interest.

title: 2 stars is generous
review: This app is a NIGHTMARE to update your contact and job information! I tried to update my city and it only let me select cities I‚Äôve previously listed...5 years ago. I got rid of my Facebook for a reason but this feels exactly like it, but much laggier. I couldn‚Äôt even update my credentials because the pages kept freezing from trying to bring up too many suggestions! Why???

title: Can't update-caught in loop
review: When I open the LinkedIn app, there is a smallish pop up telling me to update to the latest version with no yes/no option. Click on the Update button and it takes me to the App Store. With no delay, I get the Open button which takes me back to the program where the Update button again appears. Lather, rinse, repeat. It never updates and I never get an opt out choice. The LinkedIn app is no longer functional on my iPad.

title: Really bad idea
review:
App worked fine.  Now, it's forcing me to update, but the new version isn't compatible.  Oooops!  Your bad!  You should have checked beforehand.  Oooops!  Now I can't use the current version that works just fine because your forced upgrade message won't go away.  Oooops.  You've irritated a paying customer.  Ooooops, you made a bad business decision.

I will cancel my premium membership.  Don't wish to fund such a bad idea.  Free is a good price for this level of incompetence.

Blaine

title: Great resource
review: It‚Äôs really nice having a place that integrates networking with job searches and interesting links. This is to a professional what reddit is to a young adult. The biggest issue is the overwhelming reality of how many companies are looking for people with your skill set.

title: Miss the old LinkedIn jobs app
review:
The now discontinued jobs app was very efficient and labeled jobs you viewed as ‚Äúviewed‚Äù so you could quickly see which jobs were new.  

With the now forced usage on the regular LinkedIn app, you can‚Äôt tell which jobs you have already viewed and when you do save a job the saved notification wades time as it blocks the icon for previous page. 

Jobs functionality needs to mimic the previous jobs app.

title: Slow and no split screen on iPad Pro
review: The app is slower than the website on my iPad Pro. It also hijacks the entire screen and doesn‚Äôt support the split screen view. Other apps work just fine. It would be nice that instead of just updating the app to ‚Äúbe more reliable than ever‚Äù you update it to support modern workflow features to improve the time it takes for us to get work done.

title: No new requests. Fix the app!
review:
Dear Linked In,

For the last month or so the red app badge icon says I have a new follower; and I go to the app, and it has a red circle on the followers icon at the bottom; but when I click on it there are no new followers or requests. This is very annoying, and I‚Äôm turning off notifications all together. This isn‚Äôt what you want!

title: Restricted account
review:
I am deleting the app. After only a week my account was restricted for ‚Äúviewing a lot of pages‚Äù.  Well, I just recently became unemployed and have been searching for something new in a lot of job apps. Isn‚Äôt your app for ‚Äúnetworking‚Äù?? 
It‚Äôs a scam. They want u to pay $60 a month to do so. My account was the free version and I guess I used it too much. 
 So because of that, my account with Linkedin has been restricted longer than I even had the app!

title: Messages not sending on ipad
review: The last two times I utilized the app to read and respond to a recruiter the app failed to send my response message and attachment. Even more frustrating, it would not allow me to copy the message to paste it into a normal email. In both instances It required me to completely retype some rather detailed information into email. Please fix this folks! Ugh, what a pain.

title: Too many notifications
review:
The push notifications about trivial topics got out of hand. I eventually turned off all notifications, but still receive them regularly. I‚Äôve ended up uninstalling the app.
Other than that, the app does a good job of scaling desktop functionality into a mobile screen.

title: App freezing issues
review: My app get freeze when i click on any picture. I have complained about this issue before too. Previously you asked me for app reinstallation. But the problem still persists. Previously I thought that this problem is due to my old phone but now i upgraded my phone to iPhone 14 pro max but the problem is still there. Appreciate if you guys reslove this issue for me.

title: Only wifi
review: Well , you‚Äôve probably already tried this, but just in case go to cellular in settings and turn on cell data, then scroll down to LinkedIn ap icon and verify cell data is turned on . Well

title: LinkedIn error
review:
LinkedIn was working fine for me. But for the past couple of days I‚Äôve been getting this message 
Your LinkedIn Network Will Be Back Soon

We‚Äôve notified our operations staff that you are having a problem reaching LinkedIn.  We‚Äôll get you reconnected soon.

You can leave this window open and we‚Äôll automatically take you back to your LinkedIn home page in a few minutes.

We apologize for the interruption.

I‚Äôm not able to login to my profile from any of my systems. I tried contacting LinkedIn support but I need to login to so that. Is there a way we can resolve this issue? It would be really helpful.

title: List required work hours!
review: Finding a job is very time consuming but when you spend hours filling out applications, only to find out that you cannot work the required work hours because they are not listed is very frustrating. Indeed used to list the required work hours. Morning shift could mean a variety of hours. Have employers list what hours they need to fill!

title: Does not help you get employed
review: I‚Äôve tried the premium and regular basic package for finding top jobs and after months of searching and applying nothing has happened. Also this app will tell you your profile matches a front desk greeter when you are way overqualified for a job like that. Not sure why I still have this app since nothing has happened. Most useless tool ever

title: Worst notification settings
review: This app probably has the worst notification settings. You have to manually choose a notifications group, then select a suboption before you can untick the push notifications button. You have to do this each time just to disable each push notification. Why???

title: Job Scams
review:
I like LinkedIn, but the amount of fake jobs on here is getting ridiculous, are you guys not doing any type background checks for the people actually posting ‚Äújobs‚Äù especially in the ‚Äúvideo editing‚Äù and ‚Äúremote‚Äù jobs. 

If I wasn‚Äôt as tech savvy as I am I would‚Äôve probably would‚Äôve got scammed or got my identity stolen.

So please do something about that.

title: Swipe keyboard not working well with the app
review: The default iOS swipe keyboard is not working well with the app. I tried it while commenting on a post, but after aword, it doesn‚Äôt type the next word using the swipe action. You have to type individual characters for forming sentences.

title: Terrible
review: I downloaded the app. Not even 4 days of having it, the app flagged my account saying I needed to ‚Äúverify my identity.‚Äù After submitting photos of my id. The app still didnt accept it and locked me out. Stating suspicious activity. I barely starting making a profile and adding people I‚Äôve seen as suggestions that I‚Äôve worked with in the past or currently work with. Made no kind of sense how any of that was suspicious.

title: Added premium and premium does not work
review: Tried to add premium to see what the features were like. Took me to the page and said ‚Äúpage could not be loaded‚Äù. Figured it was an app error and did not check back again. Page never was able to be loaded for premium features. Now I was charged $27 and apple says I cannot be refunded for premium features I never received‚Ä¶ wow

title: LinkedIn- Business
review:
Great app, super easy to keep in touch.
I am not sure how to manage my LinkedIn business account from this app or if there is a different app for small businesses.
I can‚Äôt seem to find a way to add a logo to my business account through the app.
Pleased assist, thank you:)

title: Notifications are uncontrollable
review:
The notifications system is TERRIBLE, there‚Äôs no way to turn them off, you check them and then close the app and new ones pop up, there‚Äôs no way to just see comment replies or post likes without seeing ALL the posts, Jon search recommendations, they are also global you can‚Äôt just see jobs related to your actual field but ALL posts by a college / company. It‚Äôs ridiculous.

And the ones you can supposedly control don‚Äôt actually ‚Äústick‚Äù, so you still get notifications you‚Äôve asked not to get... 

So then I just turn them all off and never use the app at all.

It‚Äôs 2020 and you can‚Äôt get simple notifications under control?...

title: New  Connection Problems
review:
Ever since the new update, I‚Äôve had problems with the app losing connectivity. I can connect if I open LinkedIn on Safari, but not the app. 

I‚Äôve restarted both the app and the phone, switched from WiFi to cellular and back again. Won‚Äôt connect. 

I‚Äôm in the midst of a job hunt, so LinkedIn is super important! Please fix it!

title: Fake notifications
review: Kept triggering fake or false notifications and showing a red badge. When I‚Äôd go to clear it there would be nothing there except for some news story updates. As there was no way to fix this annoying bug I just deleted the app. Or it wasn‚Äôt a big but just an attempt to get users who disabled other types of notifications to reengage in the app.

title: No thanks, same ‚Äòol crap as FB
review:
Why have the exact same platform in multiple places?
No thank you.
It is no longer business and networking as it has become a social site as well.
And if you are getting the notifications via email, you can click on it from the email and it freezes if you don‚Äôt download the app.
Your only route to view the notification is to go to a PC or laptop. Antiquated system for sure üòü

title: Lack of UI organization
review: The organization of all the buttons and icons for profile setup are literally everywhere. It‚Äôs so difficult to Change your interest, and thing like education because there are different settings for each tab instead of how the app and your profile functions as a whole. I‚Äôd like to see that changed in future updates please.

title: Same problem as the person who wrote the last review
review: I have repeatedly wrote to your company that the the jobs they send to me have nothing to do with the services I offer . I own a cabinet / woodworking shop and solicit for jobs for people to hire my established company to make custom items for people to order. All I get from LinkedIn are offers to work for other company‚Äôs that have nothing to do with the jobs and business I‚Äôm already offering.

title: False Notifications???
review: Ever since I stopped reading and stopped the notifications for the worthless Daily News updates, I‚Äôve been receiving false notifications on the app. For example, everyday, I get a notification icon on the app saying I have a notification; but when I go into the app, and into my notifications, I don‚Äôt have any new notifications. Quite frustrating...

title: App stuck on blank home screen
review:
App launches and displays empty home screen with no content and doesn‚Äôt let me navigate to any other screen as well. Basically it‚Äôs useless at the moment. Bug? Server side issue? please fix it

Updating the review as the issue has been resolved.

title: User friendly
review: The LinkedIn APP is very useful for those who benefit from social sight. It is easy to navigate and find what you want. The app also makes it easy to apply for employment right from your mobile device. I love it.

title: Accesses contacts without permission
review:
Apple, please remove this app until these corrupt and greedy developers fix their app so they don‚Äôt go into a person‚Äôs contact list without permission!

I never allowed LI to sync or access my contacts, yet, I just got an email from LI saying one of my contacts just joined!

*Updated.   Developer gave instructions on how to remove the imported contacts that LI took without my permission.  Thanks for that, you still get one star for being unethical.

title: Trying to download app
review: Why can‚Äôt I download the app without adding an updated credit card? Is linked in charging for the app? I‚Äôm not sure if this is my phones issue or an app issue but I can‚Äôt download app unless I put in card credentials

title: More aggressive ads and suggested content than social media apps
review:
This app displays by percentage more ads and suggested content than Instagram, Ticktok, Facebook, and other social media apps. The worst part is the content and ads are not even remotely relevant to anything.

The feed section of this app is an actual joke and goes out of it‚Äôs way to make it difficult to view content by the people you actually follow.

title: Something is off
review: Since the latest update whenever I check in the app it won‚Äôt show anything new but if I go to another tab it shows I have new posts to read and then when I go back it won‚Äôt show them. It is annoying.

title: Hacked account with no help from customer service
review: It‚Äôs been over seven days since my account was hacked, and I keep getting the same answer from their customer service team that the Safety and Trust team will ‚Äúbe with me soon.‚Äù I use LinkedIN for marketing, business development, and networking. I‚Äôm shocked that my account was compromised so easily and even more disappointed at the terrible customer experience.

title: Make it make sense.
review: Gets email about job. Clicks link in email to apply for job. Gets sent to the web browser. Not the app. Clicks easily apply. Gets sent to another page and is told that it can‚Äôt be done on the browser. Only the app. Click to go to the app. Gets sent to the App Store instead. Already have the app so I click open. It take me to the app and the job has to be searched. Make it make sense.

title: Account restricted for no reason
review: Couldn‚Äôt log in in my normal personal account. Got a message saying: your account has been temporarily restricted as a precaution. Submitted a copy of a valid ID to verify my identity and then received a message that my account was restricted definitively. Is it spam? Is it not? There is no way to contact LinkedIn to show that I‚Äôm an actual human being which did nothing wrong! I just lost all my contacts‚Ä¶!?

title: Latest downgrade
review:
Two key dislikes: 
1. Timeline is not in chronological order. I see posts from weeks ago, that I‚Äôve already seen, we‚Äôll before the posts of today?
2. The search function on help is useless. I type in ‚Äòtimeline‚Äô for instance, and all the suggestions are totally unrelated.

title: Needs a recent button on the home page
review: This app is really good and works just like the webpage, although there is no recent option to the home page so you just see the same posts over and over again

title: App crashes when viewing followers of company page
review: After the most recent update, the app crashes when I got to my company‚Äôs LinkedIn page and click on followers. The app does not crash when viewing followers of other pages. iPhone 11 Pro on the latest version of iOS and of LinkedIn.

title: Terrible app, worthless at networking.
review:
Can‚Äôt add friends I went to high school or college with because we‚Äôre ‚Äúnot in the same network‚Äù, despite sharing a school and hometown.  Took 4 hours to cancel premium - which was worthless - because it had to be done through iTunes, but wouldn‚Äôt show the cancel option, until I finally went on a computer to do it.  

Pretty much Facebook with jobs, except people still use Facebook.

title: The app is functional
review: It‚Äôs a bit difficult to review posts you have personally made. Also not sure if no one tested this but it‚Äôs really annoying trying to react to posts on an iPhone since the reaction is so far to the left, it reads as a swipe hard press and tries to change apps. Can this be made better?

title: Good App Done Right
review: Am enjoying the app. It‚Äôs gives me the information I need and makes it easy to use. I do not explore LinkedIn here. Just consume information that is pushed to me. The exploring the research and the list building I do off my Desktop.

title: Hidden posts don't stay hidden
review:
I try to hide posts so that I don't needlessly scroll through stuff I've already seen. Hidden posts pop back up all the time, just in a different order. 

The easy solution is to allow users to sort the feed by the most recent activity, then if I don't have to waste time trying to figure out what's new. 

The obvious counter to that is "then you wouldn't scroll through all our sponsored ads". Which leads to my next issue...

Feed is overrun with sponsored posts. 

The app is very useful for researching who works on a team I may be interviewing with, or gathering background info on an interviewer so that I can ask insightful questions.

title: Horrible Customer Support!!!
review: I have been restricted from my account with no explanation. I have tried help center, verified my information as directed and I still have not been able to communicate with anyone about the platform. No email addresses and the number given is a looping message, telling me for the address to LinkedIn press 1. Hangs up on me. Very disappointed! I have used this platform for years and had many contacts, all lost now.

title: Mobile App is lacking
review:
The LinkedIn mobile app is lacking in functionality. You can‚Äôt sort your feed by most recent, so every time you open the app you‚Äôre forced to scroll through three week old nonsense. This is basic stuff...

Also, the app sometimes stops giving you notifications about activity on your posts, with no explanation whatsoever.

title: Cannot change primary language
review: It‚Äôs very annoying that I cannot choose my primary language or delete old primary language. I applied for my account in China but I mainly use LinkedIn in US. Every time I log in my account I see my Chinese version of profile and I have to switch to English version to check my profile.

title: Got hired, now can‚Äôt unsubscribe ;(
review: While I found the app to be user friendly and helpful in terms of putting me in front of recruiters, now that I‚Äôve been hired I feel frustrated that I can‚Äôt seem to find a way to unsubscribe... Meanwhile my credit card is getting charged $30 a month. Please help! I‚Äôd be *happy* to change my rating to five stars if I could only figure out how to stop my subscription.

title: Buggy
review: It seems fairly buggy and often isn‚Äôt able to display messages, new information etc. It also keeps showing new notifications for old information (as much as 6 days+ ago for which there were already notifications multiple times). I‚Äôd get rid of it completely if I weren‚Äôt in the middle of a job search.

title: Constant crashing
review: This app would be fantastic if it didn‚Äôt keep crashing, so you have to sign in, and do the captcha over and over after being logged in just 20-40sec. I‚Äôve restarted my phone.l several times. Uninstalled, reinstalled, restarted my phone again. Nothing works. Guess I‚Äôll stick to a web browser.

title: Great for business!
review: This app is great to meet people. To find new jobs or even just expand on your current job. You can talk to people who work at the same place as you or even people who have a related job. Very good app!

title: Nice app but please fix the invite button
review:
I enjoy the app very much.

However, please fix the invitation to connect button so that it allows you to send a personalised invite too. This is possible on web but not on app (I‚Äôm using apple).

Thank you

title: Nice to have chance of networking and messaging on LinkedIn on the phone
review: Networking and messaging on LinkedIn by the phone is fastest and most convenient way to get in touch with colleagues and other people working in the same area

title: Exactly the professional platform I expected!
review:
Exactly the professional platform I expected!

From the posts to the talent, this is where real people share their ideas and concepts with open minded individuals, so nothing like Facebook.

title: Great way to connect with professional people
review: One of the best experience I‚Äôve had on this app, basically a Facebook for the professional people and helpful people. Definitely would recommend!

title: Great Tool
review: LinkedIn is the perfect app to network. You have the chance to connect with people in your field, search and apply for jobs. And even better, stay connected with all your industry colleagues.

title: Annoying.
review: Works well for its main purpose, but the app is constantly coming up with ways to send me new notifications even though I have them all disabled. It‚Äôs a huge turnoff and makes me want to delete the app and just use their desktop version.

title: Please add iPhone swipe right
review: I like the latest update. I wish you would add a swipe right to return to a previous screen rather than have to use the back arrow at the top left of the page.

title: Algorithm is terrible
review:
It‚Äôs almost useless to check you feed on the app as most of what they push is a week or more old. It‚Äôs befuddling that you don‚Äôt have the option of displaying Recent posts.
As a company LinkedIn seems to have made no improvements or updates for years (certainly not since Microsoft acquired it).

title: Delete the Discover button
review: The app replaces the ‚ÄúConnections‚Äù button with a ‚ÄúDiscover‚Äù button and now I cannot easily access my connections. When I deleted the app and reinstalled it I had access to my connections for about a day and then I was stuck with the Discover button again. Please delete the Discover button.

title: Changes in New Version Annoying
review: Recent update now requires you to put in the month for you your work start and end dates.  I used to just put in the years, which worked well. Plus, I don‚Äôt remember what month I started 20 years+ ago! And I shouldn‚Äôt be forced to put the exact date on a social profile. Can you PLEASE put things back the way they were before? Thank you.

title: Not friendly
review:
1. Not working in iOS12. It is not a rocket science and there is no any high-load technology as video streaming or anything else inside. This basic functionality could be running on a brick
2. Not working in Russia unless you use VPN. While every single app already implement very basic ways to overcome restrictions and censorship, this developers just choose the easiest track: not working- not our problem.

title: New Update is a Headache
review: For the past week or so I have to log in every time I open the app. My post reactions and comments aren‚Äôt working and I can‚Äôt click on people/company profiles from posts. My search and save features work sporadically. As someone who uses LI a ton for work, this is frustrating. So far, the web app works just fine, but I‚Äôm not always on my laptop and accessing LI from my phone via chrome or safari is not a great experience.

title: Dark mode?
review: Hey LinkedIn developers, I never leave reviews but I greatly appreciate the app and how it‚Äôs helped me further my career. Could you guys add dark mode capability? I think it would help our eyes, especially with being on tech 24/7 right now.

title: Pairis and Sons heating and Air Conditioning
review: Ryan Pairis is honest and knows his business inside and out. He is always there for us and my clients when he is needed and will go anywhere in Hampton Roads! I‚Äôve been working with him for years and can‚Äôt imagine working with anyone else!

title: Functions like Feed Sort not available
review: App functionality compared to web version is lacking. For example, I would like to be able to sort my feed by date instead of having stale posts appear on top. Please allow this function on the app, not just online.

title: Big Issues with the Colors of the profile pictures
review: Consistent issues with colors of the profile pictures changing. And then certain ones won‚Äôt have the issue but since this is a business platform, I am limited on what pictures to use. Needs an immediate fix.

title: Great idea terrible platform
review: I like the idea and connection of Linked In but the platform feels archaic. It‚Äôs terribly hard to navigate around on and the messaging system feels like dial up. How can you view your own profile as others do? Time to invest into building the site for more users. Users who are use to instant connection and don‚Äôt have to pay 50 bucks a month for it.

title: Want to Upload All Your Contacts???
review:
The LinkedIn app is a minefield of prompts to upload all your contacts. Sorry, but I don‚Äôt want to see what my exes, telemarketers and all the other contacts in my phone are up to. Today I opened the app to connect with someone and was promoted twice, in two different ways, to upload all my contacts. There‚Äôs no way to turn it off and it‚Äôs really annoying.

If it weren‚Äôt for that, I‚Äôd give the app 4 or 5 stars.

title: Can‚Äôt attach a file
review: It‚Äôs kind of ridiculous that I can‚Äôt attach a file at all in the messages. It only gives me the option for photos and to mention other LinkedIn users. Then when I try to go to the site on safari because I can actually send files on the desktop site it just directs me to the app. I have literally use the hotspot on my phone to then connect my laptop so I can send a resume. Great website awful app!!

title: Beware!!!!!
review:
After a long hiatus from this App I reloaded it and updated my account.

After allowing LinkedIn to share my information (hoping to find a new job in my field) I have been getting 6-10 robocalls a day from shady companies not even close to my field. One even was trying to claim I had debt with him (outright lies)!

So if you want an unending stream of sales calls go ahead and let LinkedIn make money off you by selling your info to the highest bidder.

title: App update idea
review: Just a thought, LinkedIn could add a feature of like but not like exactly, but more like an option for cfbr instead of cfbr.. like you would react to the post but not like it, instead react for better reach kinda thing

title: Let's see if it helps me land a job!
review: I've been taking NACE classes. I should be a NACE level three by monday. Since I'm new to the field I'm opening several different doors trying to get my foot in the door. Hopefully this door has that door open for me soon‚ò∫Ô∏è

title: Premium is web only
review: Giving this app only 2 stars because you cannot manage or even view your Premium subscription information from the app. It‚Äôll tell you that it is optimized for Desktop but in reality is because LinkedIn doesn‚Äôt want to share any fees with Apple. Ok, so I‚Äôll go CANCEL this overpriced membership on the web.

title: Locked Out
review: The new security feature created some issues for a couple of days but between customer service and googling what to do I was able to login again.

title: LinkedIn is the worst
review: I purchased a new phone and I wanted to log into my LinkedIn account but it keeps telling me that my account is suspended. I sent a message to LinkedIn to do an investigation they came back with it have suspended my account because of my activities and now I am unable to log in. The only thing I use the app for is to look for job and congratulations some of my friends.

title: Does this app even work properly?!
review:
I have found that for awhile now I can‚Äôt seem to view my own profile. When I press on my icon a side menu slides out from the left. But non of the buttons work. I can‚Äôt access my own profile, pages, groups, events and settings.
Am I the only one!?
What is happening here?
Please fix. Thank you!

title: Constant refreshing
review: I could be midway through an application and need to get off of the screen for a second to get some information. When I come back, LinkedIn refreshes and I lose the application and basically everything. I‚Äôve decided not to apply for jobs on LinkedIn anymore.. just use it to find out what jobs are hiring, then go directly to their career website.

title: Version challenges
review:
When using the app or logging in from an iPhone does not allow me to publish articles. That‚Äôs frustrating because, like right now, I have one copied to my memory, and can‚Äôt post it to my community.

At least my FB network got a copy. Please fix so I can publish.

title: Headline won‚Äôt save
review: No matter how many times I try, the app will not save my headline that reflects my new employer! Keeps having a pop up that says ‚Äúsomething went wrong. Please try again‚Äù. Both my current and former employers are not liking this. Who can fix this for me? The Help section just shows how it is supposed to work. Frustrated!!!

title: Another Facebook
review: They have taken away all the analytics in the last two months.  It is not even worth posting as you can only see 100 users information on a 40k post!  You can‚Äôt see people, employers, etc.  They charge premium for services they now have a work around!  They haven‚Äôt grown other than to be more like Facebook and as Serina would say I‚Äôm evolving away from LinkedIn!

title: Updates all the timeeeeeee
review: There‚Äôs an update every other day and for what? That‚Äôs why it‚Äôs crashing on ppl. You open it and it says ‚Äúsomething went wrong‚Äù and the only reason it‚Äôs doing that is becausssssse there‚Äôs an update. It would be nice if an update lasted longer than a week.

title: Personalized invite is never an option
review: Personalized invite is never an option on my phone, after networking with people, I feel guilty at being mannerless because I used the app to connect with that individual. I can invite only from laptop, not from the app.

title: Finding saved content is a nightmare
review: It is entirely way too difficult to find saved posts (same is true in the web actually). Saved items should be accessible from the menu that appears when clicking on our profile photos.

title: Don‚Äôt Force the Updates
review: I have no problem if you want to send a reminder pop up that there‚Äôs an update available. However, when I click on a notification I don‚Äôt want to be stuck on a screen that forces me to update before I can do anything. This was not a convenient time for me to update. I should be able to update at my convenience not be forced into it.

title: Bait & switch app
review: Tried to reach out to a contact not in my contact list. In order to send them a message a pop-up window indicated I needed to download the LinkedIn app, which I then did. When I then tried to send them a message another pop up window came up and said I could only do it with their premium functionality for $59. This is a ridiculous app not worth your time or effort

title: Constantly Logged Out
review: The LinkedIn app provides me with the info needed on a daily basis to continually improve my career. However, whatever recent updates made now automatically sign me out in between sessions. This now happens up to 5 times a day.  Please fix this issue or provide instructions to prevent this from occurring ASAP.

title: No value provided - harvests too much personal data
review:
Ready to delete because it is so manipulative and doesn‚Äôt help with anything. I only got this because of airBnB but otherwise it‚Äôs worthless. It tries to coerce you into opening it, downloading worthless updates. 

With the release of iOS 14, it is clear that LinkedIn is collecting way too much data. They don‚Äôt need this info to provide their so-called service. What a dishonest, disgusting organization.

title: Business purpose; not Facebook
review: Please do some content moderating.  Lately my feed looks like Facebook with posts about people‚Äôs political preference, happy anniversary to my wife, prayers, pictures of kids and pets.  No recipes yet, but I‚Äôm sure that‚Äôs next!  LinkedIn was a place for business, with business related posts.  Could we please get back to that?

title: December IPhone App Performance Issues
