review: It‚Äôs obvious that their are severe performance issues with the App since the most recent update including getting logged out repeatedly and App failing to load new content. Yet LinkedIn is not providing any useful communication to user community about how to resolve this or when it will be resolved. Very frustrating and App is virtually unusable. UAT on this update must have been non-existent. Better should be expected of Microsoft for sure.

title: The banner does not show while using app
review: Working on this for quite a while with LinkedIn customer service. They are not able to fix it. I dont want to write everything down here. They already know. I really wish there was an alternative app which would let professionals and companies connect efficiently. Thanks.

title: Limited app - can‚Äôt change certain settings
review: Why can‚Äôt you access settings in the app?  I took myself out of private mode with the app.  But there was no way to access settings to turn it back on.  I have to log on to the webpage to do that.  So stupid!

title: Bad for job application
review: I use the website when I‚Äôm on the computer and LinkedIn in fairly easy to use. However the app is totally different; while it caries over the information form my profile, when I attempt to apply to a posted job all the app does is go to an unrelated page and doesn‚Äôt allow you to app. The only work around is to save the job then get on the computer when you can to apply.

title: Link !
review: You app is involved with harassing me bulling cursing and discrimination so I going turn you just like Mixer and Reddit and how the used your app and Microsoft‚Äôs products threaten my Family I‚Äôm going sue all of you ! Disrespectful to me and I‚Äôll help anyone it‚Äôs sad your involvement with hackers !

title: Rearranging Certifications
review: For some reason LinkedIn has taken away the users ability to rearrange their certifications. The way LinkedIn displays them may not always align with which certifications are the best/most useful/most relevant for a specific user. I feel like it should give you the option to decide which initial 3 are displayed.

title: This app used to be good. It is the worst now.
review:
Pop ups all the time after every single action in the app. And annoying users by showing a pop up to buy linkedin premium every time after you ‚Äúeasy apply‚Äù for a job  is just cheap. If we wanted the premium, we would get the premium.

In my eyes, LinkedIn is literally trying to bully people into buying the premium by annoying users with the pop ups. Shame on you.

title: Uploading Resume
review: Before the update, you were able to upload your resume to your profile by the command to upload media. Now when you choose it (to upload it) it only allows you to do a photo. Does that mean I have to screenshot my resume? I used to be able to upload a Word doc.

title: Videos & Images Don‚Äôt Load
review: The last two updates have botched this app.  I can see images and videos for a split second while I‚Äôm scrolling, but as soon as I stop to watch a video it goes black.  If I open the post I just get a spinning wheel.  I know it‚Äôs not my WiFi or cellular connections.  Has to be the app.  I haven‚Äôt bothered opening other than to see if it‚Äôs corrected.  Not a real loss because LinkedIn is less about business now anyway.

title: App freezes
review:
For such a big name you have the worst application I‚Äôve ever seen, it has been so long and you guys haven‚Äôt fixed this issue. Every time i open the application it would freeze after scrolling couple of posts. It‚Äôs not like it happens once in a while, it would do the same all day long. 
If you guys don‚Äôt have efficient developers then use your own platform to find some one who can fix this issue.

title: STOP with the Sponsored Inbox posts!!
review: This app was okay but now it's taken a completely scummy turn! I noticed a notification in my inbox on LinkedIn and when I went to check I found it was a "sponsored" message. The message was some trash article I don't care about and in order to get rid of that notification I had to open the message and go in to delete t. Talk about a waste of time and an invasion of ads into my inbox, what a new low!!

title: New Update?
review:
I‚Äôve used Linkedin happily for awhile but as of a few days ago, its been quite glitchy. It keeps signing me out every so often, asking me to prove that I‚Äôm not a bot-both on my ipad and iphone. Another, some links aren‚Äôt responsive when clicked. 

It‚Äôs quite frustrating especially since there were times I had a lengthy note typed out, only to disappear after being signed out... Poor user experience. Please fix.

title: Customer service
review:
You have created a fine product and successfully taken it to market through crowd funding but you have not supported your customers. This is not a good long term strategy. If you are unaware just look at any of you social media comments. I was a fan now I‚Äôm just another disappointed customer. 
Regard,

title: Good function but annoying UI
review: I am using an IPhone X and still find the top news, search bar, and share bar at the top annoying whenever I scroll up it pulls down blocking the top 25% of the screen. Also, some of the app utilized swipe to go back while other parts require hitting a back button. Small details, but the inconsistency is detracting from the content.

title: Because it‚Äôs not professional
review:
I‚Äôm writing this review because Linkedin has started asking users to review their site internally and not show it to the public through the App Store. 

This mobile site is the more of a Facebook page then actually wanting to network with professionals.  I‚Äôm surprised I don‚Äôt have to watch a commercial before I access the site. The premium site is little to useless giving data that isn‚Äôt needed. Why don‚Äôt I have the same options on the mobile site as the desktop, how long has it been?

Stick to the basics. Show who is in your network. That‚Äôs it. Stop asking for my contacts and my Facebook. 

Thank you,

Brent

title: Can't live without it.
review: Professional opportunities abound on LinkedIn. Having this app is critical to being notified immediately when they pop up so you're not responding days or week later.

title: Social Media 101
review: You know I love Facebook and it definitely has its place but the people on my LinkedIn community are fantastic. They seem to be very helpful for the most part and are always business professional.

title: Smooth interface
review: The user experience is great, the app directly correlates with the desktop version (no overtly glaring differences between mobile and computer) and the richness of graphics and article loads is great. Love the app and the service.

title: By far the best app for professionals
review: I can't emphasize the importance and I got my present job because of your platform I will never forget it because of the numerous connections and opportunities LinkedIn has provided to me in every level or my career.

title: LI app won't stay open
review: This started happening about two weeks ago, at the end of Sept '17... Every time I open the App on my iPad (2nd gen), before I can scroll, click or refresh, the app closes. If I relaunch, it seems to take longer now to initialize. Would appreciate any ideas to solve this on my own or hoping for a bug fix!

title: Hate the new update which shows only few open jobs in the company relevant to profilr
review: Recently, there seem to be an update on LinkedIn due to which whenever I go  to a company page, I see just a dew job openings that are relevant to my profile. But, I liked the previous version where I could see ehat all jobs are open in any company. I would like to go back to that version

title: App Unstable
review: App will not stay open. As soon as the app is opened, it goes to the background and cannot be brought back to the forefront.  Looking at all open apps it appears, but clicking on it brings the same failure that opening it does.  Have downloaded and reinstalled twice; same issue. After the reinstall, it opened and allowed sign in, but quickly returned to the same failing state.

title: Solid with one major flaw
review: The app is great but it‚Äôs difficult to scroll the jobs feed.  70% of the time it scrolls fine, but then will not scroll for some reason. It will then take several attempts to scroll.

title: Most annoying and nonsensical notification award
review: These emails from linked, wow man just tell me what‚Äôs in the notification and quit begging me to login with pathetic notifications for nonsensical items. I deleted the app because of notifications for nonsensical items that never stop. Make one button called the don‚Äôt annoy me with trash quality notifications for nothing. Become more like Truth Social, and less like darpa fbook.

title: LinkedIn access
review: I have an iPhone 6S and am very satisfied with it. Linked in newest version requires 13.0 and my antique won‚Äôt accept that version. So when I open the app from my on screen icon I am asked to download this 13.0 but mine won‚Äôt I can‚Äôt access LinkedIn. I guess the only option I have is to delete linked in and explore other options. Shame. I used to really enjoy this platform. üëéüèº

title: Not Working
review: For the past few months, LinkedIn has consistently failed to load correctly. I end up having to delete the app and reinstall to get it to work. This lasts for 1-3 days, then I have to do it again. Please fix! Others than this issue, I love LinkedIn. Thanks!

title: Feature request
review: The app needs the ability to view LinkedIn news items. Currently there is no way to see these articles.

title: The constant notifications are super annoying
review: I‚Äôve tried going through every setting I can find and have turned off notifications for every pointless thing on here that I don‚Äôt care to be notified about yet they just keep coming. I obviously don‚Äôt mind being notified of some things like comments, follows, etc. but all the other junk is very annoying

title: Slow, crappy platform
review: The app is so glitchy and the filters don‚Äôt even work. I filtered on entry level jobs and was getting jobs for managers. It seems companies manipulate the filters and it‚Äôs not like you can report them accurately. You can report a job posting but there are no options for ‚Äúinaccurate information.‚Äù They need to revamp the entire platform and sped it up.

title: App is freezing upon opening
review: The app is freezing at home/feed screen and controls are not working. No data on the feed screen and It is completely unresponsive. I deleted the app and reinstalled, still the same issue.

title: Version issue
review:
Suddenly, I started getting message that the version I have is not compatible and I have to download the latest. When I try to download the new version it says I need 13 iOS, but I can download the latest compatible version. And when I try to download it, I get message that I need iOS 13.
This is a of headache which started recently. Can you please suggest the fix for it.

title: iOS 13
review: If you don‚Äôt have iOS 13 then the app doesn‚Äôt work but in the app center they offer you the option to download a compatible version.  However when I choose that option (download) the same error message keeps popping up instead of downloading the compatible option.  Do we need to completely remove and try to reinstall the app?

title: Video streaming bug
review: When i click a link to watch a video, when i exit the video it continues to play in the background. In order to get the video to stop i have to go back and hit pause. It‚Äôs extremely annoying that the exit function does not exit out the video itself as well as the browser page.

title: Nissan of Newnan
review:
I‚Äôve tried 3 times to connect with (Dave) finance manager at Nissan of Newnan to no avail. I purchased a new car January 31, 2021 last night. 
I need to receive my loan installment information.  It is easier to go to combat than to receive my information.  My credit score is over 800 and this idiot Dave is just an arrogant worthless customer service cheap employee.  
Whatever ever happened to customer service?  I‚Äôll wouldn‚Äôt buy anything from Nissan of Newnan ever again.

title: Mr David p Turner
review: I‚Äôm the underdog so I am just one man and I just want to work and chase the American dream I won‚Äôt change my views or what I think  so if you work hard and have a dream it might come true if not you never quit trying

title: Need to be able to sort better !!!
review: The app would be better if you could sort newest to oldest. tired of seeing the same post, and missing out on possible jobs because they are hiding amongst all the the other junk!!!!

title: The app shuts down (crashes) when I open the messages
review:
I‚Äôve been facing this issue for a while now. Whenever I get messages on LinkedIn and try to respond to them using the app, the apps shuts me down.  Every time I need. To respond to someone on linked in, I have to use my laptop. 
I looked for an update, my app is already updated.  My phone, is updated.
This issue becoming frustrating.

My phone is updated, the app is updated, yet the problem still exist. 
And I found out that I am not the only one according the reviewer on App Store.  So I would suggest that you update the App and solve this issue for everyone instead of having us all come here to write about it, and you suggest solutions that don‚Äôt work.

title: one problem
review: I‚Äôm mostly enjoying the app but have one problem - while scrolling through my feed I tend to accidentally like a post. This never happens with other similar social apps but happened a few times with linked in. It makes me less comfortable using the app to browse my feed.

title: Update makes invitations difficult
review: After the latest update, I have to restart the app after I invite somebody to connect, which is rather annoying.  Hitting the X to go back after submitting gives me the option to either cancel invite, or continue writing.  No other options!

title: Latest update - 3 Days ago - Crash
review:
This is a great app no doubts. I have a bit of difficulty accessing messages, specifically if I open a message thread with any of my contacts, the application crashes. 

I‚Äôm on iPhone 8, IOS 12.1.2

Regards.

title: Stats not up to date
review: The stats are a week behind  for some reason. I am running the most recent version of the IOS beta software along with the most recent update of Linkefin.

title: Project Updates won‚Äôt save Edits
review: I‚Äôve tried unsuccessfully to save any edits I make to my projects. I‚Äôm trying to put end dates on projects that have completed and it won‚Äôt apply them.  Its keeps it as an active open project... This is misleading to potential customers as they think 1.) I am lazy and not updating my projects 2.) The project is in trouble because its taking so long to complete.... either way its bad and needs to get the bug fixed asap!

title: Can‚Äôt sync contacts anymore
review: Not sure when it started but I cannot sync contacts to my phone book anymore. When I go to settings and try to sync contacts I keep an error trying to access to my phone book.

title: Best Professional Networking Platform Around
review: Super impressed with the many connections and opportunities that I‚Äôve made from being actively engaged on LinkedIn. I highly recommend it for any start up business.

title: Love linkedin premium
review: Very easy it keep up on news and trends in industries, great way to see stats on companies or people making news, and easy way to search for opportunities. Very user friendly!

title: Informative
review: LinkedIn does a great job allowing its users to stay informed by placing so much at their fingertips. From networking to key articles about job searches, resum√© writing, and interview preparation, LinkedIn pulls so much meaningful information together in one place.

title: Scammy
review:
There is something suspicious about this app. Why am I being asked to submit an ID all of a sudden? No way to contact customer service without logging in but I can not log in because my account is banned for no reason. Don‚Äôt use this app.

Submitted my id and now they are saying it‚Äôs invalid. Then they sent a link to their help center but I have to log it to access it. Unbelievable! I CANNOT LOG IN.

title: Why does it want to login for no reason at all, every day?
review:
The last week it‚Äôs been popping up a login request everyday when I am in different apps, and not doing anything related to LinkedIn. I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôve ever run it from this device. I don‚Äôt use the app, so I finally just deleted it because I was sick of it interrupting me.  

What personal data are you trying to steal from me anyway?

title: Does not allow comments
review: I‚Äôve been using this app for years, but this latest build does not allow me to comment on any post. The links to comments are there, but when I click it, the keyboard screen pops in and the comments box just vanishes!! I am using an iPhone SE2, with the latest iOS. Please fix this!

title: App, especially messaging, is super buggy
review: Messaging often freezes and terminates for no reason. Difficult to use. My guess is they want to push customers to use web based, but I‚Äôm on my phone 80-90% of the time. Really frustrating, especially when I‚Äôm paying a lot to use the platform. Rethinking that.

title: Algorithm is busted - can‚Äôt search for my role.
review:
This site is becoming increasingly useless. I look for a specific finance role and get everything but. I search for remote and get recommended for on-site work in a completely different state. Horrifying this is now the industry standard.

The dev response isn‚Äôt helpful - I reached out to tech support on this and it was acknowledged to be broken. Filters make it worse for some roles.

title: No real support
review:
If for some reason your account is ever suspended, you have no way of getting support to find out why? 
It‚Äôs really bad business for a site, doesn‚Äôt give its members any avenue to get control of their account and speak to a LinkedIn employee. You have no live chat no phone number and you have to go through so much red tape to contact anyone at LinkedIn. Please get an updated site.

title: Please fix the header on the mobile app
review: The header in the mobile app will show education/work experience despite it not being selected to show in the header. The header shows correctly on the website but on the mobile app it will show education/work even if you choose to hide that from the header. Please fix this in the app.

title: Got me my internship!
review: Not only is it social, but it‚Äôs also beneficial for my career. I was playing around and just happened to apply to an internship. It got me my summer internship and now I have a job offer!!

title: Crashes within seconds of opening the app
review:
Recently, I‚Äôve found I suddenly can‚Äôt scroll through the app after a couple seconds. Everything freezes up, then after a moment, LinkedIn crashes.

It‚Äôs gotten so bad that restarting my phone and deleting and reinstalling the app achieves nothing. It loads up to the same post I got stuck on days ago then crashes right after.

Literally unusable.

title: APP Having MAJOR Issues
review: If you plan on doing work on indeed mobile don't. It doesn't not work. Find a different software. Otherwise always enjoyed indeed.

title: Horrible this is like a dating app from HELL
review: I joined premium as a trial so I could connect with out of state employers. Well that didn‚Äôt work out so well. Turns out no one really wants to hire out of state. I can see that. In the mean time my ‚Äúprofile‚Äù is being searched alright by a bunch of guys wanting to ‚Äúconnect‚Äù WHAT??? No just no. I‚Äôm trying to cancel and hibernate but I can‚Äôt! Because I went through APPLE! Oh goodness this is a trap from hell to get out of don‚Äôt do just don‚Äôt do it

title: Notification issues and spam messages
review: Notifications are slow to appear when you aren‚Äôt using the app despite background refresh on.  Notifications appear days after the original comment, profile view, or activity actually happens.  Similar to Indeed, I get irrelevant jobs sent to me out of my area, industry, and qualifications.

title: Necessary app for all employees
review: It‚Äôs essential to stay connected to your colleagues and coworkers.  It‚Äôs also important to stay informed about the latest news in your industry.  No other app combines all of these things in one.

title: Request a subscription cancellation
review:
Hello Linkedin, I would like to cancel the premium service subscription but I cannot find where I can do it on the phone. 
Can you please cancel the service for me. 
Thank you!!

title: Unwelcomed control to access my account
review:
I am and have been receiving information about job opportunities that I cannot access because I do not want to subscribe to all the advertisements and unnecessary information.

I have to rate at least 1 star or this won‚Äôt allow me to proceed! Do you understand how manipulative this is? I have to choose at least 1 star but please understand that I would prefer to choose a NEGATIVE 10.

title: Charged me unnecessarily
review: I had canceled my subscription prior tot he deadline still I have been charged, also they don‚Äôt even send the reminder that free subscription is expiring to let me know if I have not canceled my subscription. This is very unprofessional. I would not recommend even getting a free trial. I have also reported for getting my refund, but I again didn‚Äôt get any confirmation message for the complaint. This is why I had to write a review.

title: Won't let me create an account
review:
I cannot add my phone number without getting the error "you cannot use that phone number, please try another one". Until this is resolved, I give this one star.

EDIT
I have revisited this app and I can now create an account.

title: Saved Jobs no longer works
review: The app is nice overall but some functionality has inexplicably quit working. Saved Jobs is an example, if you bring up your list of saved Jobs you can no longer click them to go to the jobs, they are useless list entries.

title: Notifications
review: Since the last update I am unable to see my notifications. It tells me how many I have but then when I click on it says there are none.

title: Crash
review:
I have no problem giving a 5 star edit, but for the last couple of days the app has crashed every time I select apply. It takes me to the specific listing then it stops working and force closes. I thought it might be the sites I‚Äôm redirected to, but I went on their career sites, logged in and everything worked fine.

Update: it has crashed one froze on every site I have been to.

title: Virtually useless
review:
Links in email open on the web - transferring to app loses all info, as every tine the app opens I have to hit ‚Äúskip‚Äù ‚Äúnot now‚Äù ‚Äúyes, I‚Äôm done‚Äù and other buttons to prevent the app from spamming everyone in my contact list. Then it forgets what was supposed to open (the web content) and I land on a useless home page with labels and options that don‚Äôt logically correspond to anything the app does. 

Not sure how or why anyone actually uses this app.

title: Customized invitation not working on mobile
review: To add a connection on my movile, When I do a customized invite on my mobile , the send invitation button is hidden under thw keyboard and there is no way to reach the button. It is very annoying.

title: LinkedIn superior business app
review: This app lets you connect to people in a professional and well organized manner. Everything that I have seen and done on this app can be categorized as relentless productivity.

title: Don‚Äôt waste your time
review: Created an account, spent a few hours developing my page with photo and adding contacts, only to be kicked out of the system two days later. All attempts to sign in were futile. Password change was invasive. I will NOT upload personal documents/I.D‚Äôs to a website I have no access to. No thanks. There are other fine ways to network.

title: Cluttered, confusing, and alerts everywhere.
review: LinkedIn is no longer usable and provides no value. There are like 8 different places where alerts show up, 4 feeds, endless useless requests to subscribe to this or to that thing, which then takes you to an article with a pay wall, and on and on. The only time I use it anymore is to clear all the alerts!

title: Pay to Play, Woke Onslaught
review: LinkedIn used to be good several years ago when it was actually a useful job site. The social platform posting features, extremely expensive Premium membership, and constant reminders to add your pronouns (lol) have turned it into a toxic environment. It‚Äôs become useless without paying for Premium.

title: BUG IN APP and Website
review: I switched on Open to Job only for recruiters but now I am unable to turn it off, for recruiters it still shows that I am open to work, even though I have switched it off multiple times and I am not looking for opportunities

title: LinkedIn overrides the Cellular Data setting in iOS
review: In the latest official version of iOS (16.5.1) LinkedIn somehow overrides the Cellular Data setting where I explicitly said that this app should not use my Data plan, and somehow it doesn‚Äôt care and uses my data.  This will be reported to Apple.  I hate when companies are not transparent, like LinkedIn in this case.  If they do this, what else could be happening underneath?

title: Great app so long as you are not hacked
review:
Overall until recently had an amazing experience with LinkedIn for like 3-5 years, until I got hacked.

The person who hacked me put their phone number and it has been a crap show from LinkedIn Help Center‚Ä¶ They have told me my ID doesn‚Äôt match, have simply attempted the two factor authorization, legit send me an email to delete the account which requires access that I do not have‚Ä¶ you get the drift.

At this point someone on LinkedIn has my identity (photo, resume, etc) but changed their name and added their phone number to ensure no access.

LinkedIn..be better, do better on the identity theft side because it‚Äôs not up to par..

title: What‚Äôs Going On?
review: I‚Äôm getting so many spam accounts viewing my page and women from different continents that have tenuous ties to my country asking to link up!  They all start saying that my pic is intriguing and they want to get personal with me.  When did LinkdIn become Grindr?   The algorithm wont let me report these accounts as spam and their spam filter obviously does not work.  I‚Äôm out of here for now.  BEWARE!!!

title: Why does it reset so often?
review: I need to switch between apps when using LinkedIn - LinkedIn simply does not have all the information I need so I switch to other apps to enter info into LinkedIn. The app refreshes and restarts too frequently to make the app useful. I find myself getting annoyed with the app, as the frequent resets are unnecessary. It‚Äôs a career oriented app, why do I need to be abreast of the latest info?

title: Please Fix!
review: Don‚Äôt know if the developer is aware but the search and chat function that is at the very top of the screen is covered up by the OS time and battery bar on my  iPhone XR. I can‚Äôt check any chat notifications without having to go to a desktop. And please don‚Äôt tell me I need to get a bigger phone. That‚Äôs not a valid response.

title: I like the app, but prefer viewing on the web better.
review:
Why? Because at least on the web version we can filter our feed by recent posts instead of missing so much by being forced to only view top posts.
If Facebook can figure it out for the apps, why not LinkedIn?

title: iOS Dark Mode
review: It‚Äôs been 2 years since this app has come out and still no dark mode for iOS. This is a very underappreciated feature that should have been added last year. STOP COPY PASTING YOUR UPDATE HISTORY. This is what a lazy development team with poor management does. The lack of transparency and professionalism from an app that is supposed to link people together is very concerning regarding updates. Please fix.

title: Useful Information After the Fact
review: I‚Äôm not going to need the iOS app until they add the basic functionality of sorting by date. I see things that I might have found useful the date it was posted days/ weeks after it was posted and see the same information that was posted again later in browsing for no apparent reason. It‚Äôs not a useful source of news right now.

title: Just another Facebook
review: This app is full of people posting memes, arguing in comments about politics, and is now notifying of posts about how everything is racist in America. I was fairly certain when I downloaded the app that it was supposed to be professional, and in the couple years I‚Äôve had it I have been shown otherwise. You might as well connect with other people in any other social media.

title: Job Requirements
review:
This app is fantastic for networking, and can really give anyone seeking employment the opportunity to score a career. But, I believe if you implemented a search filter that singled out job requirements then job-seekers would have the opportunity to find all jobs they are qualified to work. 

I‚Äôd love to see the option to look up something like ‚Äúbachelor‚Äôs of science in chemistry‚Äù or whatever relevant coursework and then find jobs that specifically require that. 

Anyone seeking a job would find opportunities they didn‚Äôt consider before. 
Try it out.

title: New update app crashes have been fixed
review: This was a good app until the update. Now it crashes every time I try and open the app. Update: LinkedIn responded and fixed the problem, the app doesn't crash and opens normally.

title: What have you done?
review: My app on an old iPad kept asking me to install an update of the app.  Now it won't let me use the app without the update. The only problem is that there is no update in the App Store to update to.  I uninstalled the app and reinstalled it to the app version compatible with my device.  Still won't allow me to use the app without an update (I experience the most ridiculous do loop).  Do you guys test your scrips?  This is pathetic.

title: Worst app ever
review:
Exactly what is the point of this App?? It doesn‚Äôt correlate at all to what is saved in my profile on actual website. I have 10 jobs ‚Äúsaved‚Äù and only 1 of them shows up in the App. WTH?! Try to refresh....nothing. 
Also doesn‚Äôt sync with changes to jobs applied to, updates on resume etc. And the search engine is also ineffective...doesn‚Äôt show same openings as website!!!
Absolutely pointless.

title: Biggest mistake was to reinstall it again
review: Have been a user of linkedin app but instead of getting better this app is touching the lowest of levels everyday. Keeps freezing and crashing on scrolling. Tried everything from reinstalling it to updating my iOS but nothing worked. If you can‚Äôt make it work please shut it down because we‚Äôll be happy using the website version only.

title: Keep Getting Too Many Emails
review: Such a trash app that doesn‚Äôt seem professional and too complicated to use. Even though I closed my account I‚Äôm still being harassed with emails from random people, I did not ask for my email to be seen by everyone. This app should have never existed and is very pointless. DO NOT DOWNLOAD THIS APP!!! You will be bombarded with emails even if you wanted your email address to be private. Delete your pointless app

title: Bug
review:
Dear Developers,

LinkedIn is a fantastic platform, but over the past two months or so, the iOS app is freezing after opening for couple of seconds. Several updates have been released, and every time I hope this nightmare gets over but the problem persists. 

Please take the feedback seriously as the app is not good at the moment because of this issue and it‚Äôs rendering the app next to useless.

title: Needs Improvement
review: Works well for basic functions, but crashes far too often when viewing videos, reading articles via user links, etc. I‚Äôm sure the LI team is working on these issues, but until they make the app more stable, a higher rating is unwarranted.

title: Latest version does not work
review:
Loved LinkedIn until this latest version. Now it can‚Äôt remember who I am and when I try to log in, it takes me through the security parameters and then tells me I have the wrong password. Which I know isn‚Äôt true as I‚Äôm currently logged into my computer with the same credentials. 

Froze up my phone and had to take off and reinstall and it still doesn‚Äôt work. Using Apple I-phone 8 w/ IOS11.3

title: Bug
review: After I got the new iphone xs max, when i scroll through videos and play them it will just randomly pause and not resume even when exited and retrying.

title: Not so sure anymore
review: Some of the new stuff is okay, but you are doing a bunch of nonsense. And old basics functionality like briefcase with saved jobs and articles are broken. And have been. Thinks disappear. It is impossible to delete other things. Please go back and fix basic functionality...

title: So many glitches.
review: The app is good due to the network of people on it, though the platform has many glitches when it comes to updating your info and/or managing followers. The same task has to be repeated several times before the update goes through... This app is great, but it has been falling behind most likely due to cost cutting which has affected its QA/QC Standards. What a wast... what a shame!

title: Ugh... worse account management ever.
review:
I get this isn‚Äôt app support. But anyway, 
I cannot close my account because I am still a premium member. Even though I didn‚Äôt pay for it pass the trial. 

So either premium profiles are actually free so you don‚Äôt need to pay for them. 
 
Of course since I got and cancelled the trial via iTunes subscription, I can‚Äôt cancel my account. Any time I try I get to a page to cancel an already cancelled subscription. 

Why do I want to delete my account? I get far too many ‚Äújobs you may be interested in‚Äù emails. Jobs that I‚Äôm not even qualified for. Medical Assistant ‚â† Registered Nurse or Emergency Medical Tech. I unsubscribed from the mail and changed the settings.  

Geez your website together.

title: Improvements
review:
Let me change my cover photo in mobile as well not just in Pc

Make buttons for profile a bit more obvious

Other than that this is perfect

title: App Needs Help
review: This app needs some help.  It lists jobs that meet my criteria in the feed but then I click on see more and it says no jobs for my criteria.  Also I have adjusted the settings 1,000 times but I still get some very odd notifications - Richard Branson posted an update.  I don‚Äôt care.  Two stars for getting the important things right, but definitely need to iron out the wrinkles.

title: Great app
review: I appreciate LinkedIn as a networking and business tool. Great way to improve your communication network, share ideas and locate groups that may share your thoughts and passions. Industry specific networking and global outreach. Just awesome.

title: Keep track of all your important business connections.
review: Linked In is the only choice to Keep track of all your business connections and make new ones.

title: Fast and Easy to Use
review: Works better for quick updates and engagement than the desktop. Well done, can‚Äôt live without the information flow.

title: I am a human! Just use your laptop
review: This app used to be very convenient. Unfortunately, the amount of tests I must ‚Äúpass‚Äù and codes I must retrieve to login make it a waste of time to use. I gave up after going 3 rounds (of both). This happened for 2 days. Initially I thought there was a glitch or error. Nope! I never write reviews but had to submit one because this app has essentially become unusable

title: This is not for people looking to get employed
review: This is for the egotistical corporate higher ups showing how important they are in this society‚Ä¶. I do not suggest looking for a job in this application, it is not worth it and it makes no difference at all. Why would you also charge for people to network? It just seems to feed off people who are looking for a job to actually work.

title: Less riff raff, lol‚Ä¶
review: I like TicTok‚Ä¶I like twitter‚Ä¶quota gets weird, but linked in seems more professional and seems more of a realistic way to network, I believe‚Ä¶but I have joined only recently‚Ä¶so far it‚Äôs been nice.

title: Most recent feed on mobile app
review:
For the love of god, please fix the app to where it shows the most recent feed on the homepage. 
It‚Äôs sooo frustrating seeing stuff posted 3 weeks ago or 16hrs ago. I can only see the most recent feed on homepage if I use the website instead of the mobile app. 
Fix it! Fix it! Fix it!!!

title: Not functional
review: Horrible app. I have to sign in each time I open the app and it tells me I can‚Äôt due to a two point verification issue even though I verify correctly. Once I get in, the app does not fit my screen and I‚Äôm unable to click any of my account information at the top, switch to my work account or use the search bar. It‚Äôs completely unusable for me.

title: App is impossible to use for applying for jobs
review: When I apply for a job through the app, I usually need to leave it to check my resume or write a cover letter. However, if I leave the app (not close it, just switch applications), it resets and I lose my place and all my progress. Please make it to where it stays in place and doesn‚Äôt reset when switching apps or leaving it idle.

title: Can‚Äôt access Inbox
review: I am unable to access my inbox messages. When I tap the Inbox icon, nothing happens. This is inconvenient since I won‚Äôt be able to check them until I am in front of a computer, which isn‚Äôt always the case.

title: Cant even let you upload your pdf resume
review: Makes you retype resume content and it has to be prefilled from it limited generated fields. Certifications aren't shown for my field. Overall this is a waste of time. Most companies dont bother to use it and you limit your exposure by relying on it. Wont recommend to anyone. After typing in resume info it looks like a butchered layout.

title: Stealing Info
review: I put in all my info to create an account to do like 3 things on it and my account gets restricted after i put in all my info like can you not? Is this what you guys enjoy doing? If not then please make restrictions very low. I literally signed in with all the correct information and plus you guys don't support every country so that makes it impossible for me to sign in. Scammers.

title: Issues with the app
review: I wanted to share that recently the app will only work on my phone when connected to wifi. When using cellular it says no I termed connection. Not having the issue with any other apps that require a connection.

title: Basic functionality no longer work
review: The ability to save job profiles you‚Äôre interested in no longer works. I keep getting an error. I‚Äôd imagine this is one of the most important features of this app. There‚Äôs also no clear path to reporting this issue and getting help.

title: Premium
review: The app started a premium account without my permission and does not provide a way to stop it. I never asked for premium or did I want it but I‚Äôve been forced to pay and finally had to keep funds low enough in my account that they are going to shut premium off for non-payment which works for me. Sure wish I could get my money back though

title: So disappointed
review: I purposely do not use social media apps but felt I had to use this one when hunting for a new job. The amount of political and religious posting is disappointing. I didn‚Äôt join a job networking site to endure these posts. That‚Äôs what Facebook, Instagram and Twitter are for. Why can‚Äôt there be a platform for companies and job seekers?  I will cancel my account as soon as I find a new opportunity.

title: Designs
review: Periodically their is a change in the design to LinkedIn. I noticed a different hue or tone of blue every now and then. It makes me ‚ÄúTingly‚Äù I wish they would expand on Who‚Äôs Viewed your profile and Search appearances

title: Search Needs Improvement
review: Need more filters for searching, specifically the ability to remove staffing agencies or ability to hide based on company. More vetting needs to be on job postings and the organizations. Becoming more like Facebook and less about the workplace topics.

title: Linkin Forces You Off Their Site
review:
Linkin forces you off their if you don‚Äôt join their premium package. This the only social media I have because it‚Äôs present a clean social environment. I‚Äôm not ready for the premium package and you shouldn‚Äôt force me to. I deleted Linkin app don‚Äôt do that others joined your site. I lived in 28 places around the world and I know a lot of people. Know your customer before you run them away. 

Dr. Michael L. Maeweathers

title: App isn‚Äôt working right now
review: Regular user of the app, today after several years of use, the app suddenly required me to log in. It gave me an option to log in with Face ID so I enabled it; Face ID worked one time, now I have to enter my user ID and password every time I switch to the app, even if I don‚Äôt close it such as when I select a notification...garbage.

title: No longer loads. Doesn‚Äôt refresh. What happened?
review: The app is no longer functioning. Doesn‚Äôt refresh. Connections and messages pages won‚Äôt load either. iPhone 7Plus.

title: Not using any more
review: I deleted this app after at least 15 years after reading about the clipboard data stealing ‚Äòbug‚Äô. Right. That doubles the insult. You are untrustworthy. I notice no news on the app being fixed, just ‚Äòwe will fix‚Äô. When? Why not publicize? Why such generic comments on new updates, how about a little transparency with your customers? Shameful dishonest behavior. Own up and fix it if you want any credibility at all.

title: Being a Premium member is not worth your money
review: I've been a premium member for almost a month now and I see absolutely no benefit to this. There are no jobs contacting me, no "better searches", no "better communication", no "transparency". It was a complete waste of my time. There is no need for a premium membership, even if you're simply looking for a better company to work for and want a better opportunity. I saw no value in this at all.

title: Security verification issue
review: When I try to login using the app it keeps me stuck on this screen clicking the same "I am not a robot" box over and over and never allowing me to login. When attempting to use the online portion it says "security verification" and just never loads anything up for me to VERIFY! Very frustrating not being able to login to my account.

title: Mandatory update
review: You really shouldn‚Äôt stop people from using your app unless they update the app. I hardly ever use the Linked in app and when I do, I wish you would just let me use it in peace. Instead, the second I get in, I‚Äôm served messaging requiring me to update. What about people who are out of space on their device, but still need a tool like Linkedin to look for a job? Y‚Äôall gotta be more inclusive in your product decisions.

title: I Stand Corrected
review: Dark mode exists in Linkedin (thank you) however the default setting is light and not ‚Äúdevice setting‚Äù. Perhaps changing the default to ‚Äúdevice setting‚Äù would be helpful.

title: 100% Broken App, So Long So Ridiculous
review: I've tried this app for well over 100 times over the last couple of years or more. It NEVER worked, always gave the "no internet connection" error even when on fully working fast wifi, fully updated iOS, brand new iPhone . I kept hoping they'd update the app with a fix. Never happened . Finally deleting it today. So ridiculous for major networking app.

title: Used to work...
review: Bummer, with the latest update release the app stopped working for me. It opens, loads for about three seconds, then closes. I've since removed it and just use the website. Too bad because it was really convenient. They are probably also phasing out old IOS platforms.

title: Great way...
review: Great way to make a network, this days every move you do is linked to technology and this is a great way to present yourself to the world and to others with your same interest in what you do...

title: Horrible user interface update
review:
I don‚Äôt know why they had to 
‚Äúfix ‚Äúanything because I  used to be able to press a persons email and that would be a hyperlink now you can‚Äôt do that any longer which makes it much more cumbersome... now you have to copy and paste
Additionally with almost 3000 connections it‚Äôs amazing to me that nobody actually ever replies to my postings

title: My Jobs-Not Functional
review:
There is NO way to edit ‚ÄúMy Jobs‚Äù that have been applied. There should be an ‚ÄúEdit‚Äù or ‚Äú‚Ä¶‚Äù button at the top of the page by My Jobs. NOT THERE.

I am so disappointed in an app of this magnitude with so little ability to assist with managing job saved, applied, and archived. 

Tried Chrome & Edge. Mobile & Desktop! Ghrrrrr!

title: iPhone 15 Pro bug issues
review:
The app needs an update! Scrolling on my new iPhone isn‚Äôt smooth and needs a quick fix!!

Thanks

title: Subscription Never Activated
review: It‚Äôs LinkedIn. Nothing else to say, but if you purchase anything via the iPhone, it doesn‚Äôt activate or change your account. I ended up canceling it. I don‚Äôt recommend paying unless you do it through their website üòí

title: Game changer
review: LinkedIn helps me be reached by recruiters. The news feature keeps me posted on the news about my company that I can have small talks to management.

title: Stop Giving Me Useless Notifications
review: The app is fine. However, I am really tired of constantly getting ‚Äúnew‚Äù notifications for completely useless features. When I‚Äôve TURNED OFF all notifications except messages and new connections. Like ‚Äúmessage this new connection,‚Äù ‚Äúsee these jobs.‚Äù It‚Äôs very infuriating.

title: Creates great connectivity
review: The LinkedIn platform allows me to connect with other professionals, bypassing most commercial attempts to self promote. I would rather see and read suggestions and samples of educational improvements.

title: Can‚Äôt even set up an account cause of a glitch
review: I am trying to set up an account and in the portion where you select five Job titles you would be interested in I keep going to click add but all the job titles keep disappearing and I can‚Äôt continue making an account without selecting job titles but it won‚Äôt let me select any job titles, extremely frustrating.

title: ‚ÄòNo internet connection‚Äô error
review: I always get a no internet connection while using the app. My internet is fine with everything else. This is purely a LinkedIn app issue. Update your copy and give us the real reason so I can update and use the app without this frustrating dead end.

title: Deleted after nearly 6 years
review:
Reading clipboard data is not okay. This is the reason LinkedIn‚Äôs lost its real estate on my phone. Contacts first, now data they should NEVER have need for whatsoever in copy/paste. Goodbye. 

As someone not on any social networking tool, I felt okay believing LinkedIn and now msft would keep this just about professional networking. Privacy issues this app has turned into complete garbage content.

title: User experience is awful
review: The app experience has really gone down hill. Consistently pages don‚Äôt load and searches don‚Äôt load. I can‚Äôt click through to see any of my notifications because it just spins and times out. Going to delete and just use on my desktop, which will seriously negatively impact my overall usage of LinkedIn.

title: They won‚Äôt stop charging us
review: My husband had a premium account for his business but canceled it. Since that time they continue to charge for the service. We have canceled this several times and it keeps happening. This needs to stop. We can‚Äôt afford to keep having money unexpectedly taken from our account. I would recommend anyone be VERY careful about signing up for their additional services.

title: LINKEDIN PIRATED MY CONTACT LIST
review: I just received a very unhappy email from my father-in-law saying he was tired of me inviting him to join me on LinkedIn. I had no idea he was getting those emails. Linkedin must have pirated my contact email addresses and started sending emails to all my contacts. Or maybe they have a trick question or trick button that I didn‚Äôt realize what it was. I would never have given them permission to send emails to all my contacts. I AM VERY UPSET ABOUT THIS!!!!

title: Should be way better
review: How come a job and career centric social platform doesn't have a "share through private message" option? Refreshing your timeline can basically update everything that you won't see that post you want to read. Save to read later sometimes works sometimes not even available.

title: Happy medium
review: LinkedIn in my opinion is a more adult communications. Business but a area where creative knowledge is presented. Can be liberal in content. But restrained in personal pity stuff. Good balance. LinkedIn is evolving. With the spiritual surrounding of the earth. All kinds of info. Void of stupid commercials.

title: Great app
review: I use this app every day. Consider moving even more functionality from the full version to the app. Also, make search function results more intuitive.

title: REVIEW
review:
LinkedIn is just the best App for Great Mind, Information, Knowledge and Connections. 

I should suggest the App Developers should focus on making the app to be faster enough and also work when there is poor network connection.

title: Search results needs some work
review: Generally this app is dependable, and meets users‚Äô expectations‚Ä¶ except search results. When I enter explicit criteria for filters and search I still get unexpected results, like jobs not within the selected city, or users not with the name I searched.

title: LinkedIn disabled the ‚ÄòReport this Ad‚Äô function
review:
You can no longer report/block advertisements. How dou‚Äî-bag of them. 

LinkedIn ads are bad to start with. They just keep showing you the same ones over and over even if you did report them. But now when you tap the feature it freezes. 
Unprofessional, misleading and costly for advertisers and consumers

title: Easy Apply = Hard Apply
review:
Worked on multiple open-ended questions in their Easy Apply portal.

After I finished, the portal had an error and deleted all my work. Furthermore, the job apparently wasn‚Äôt even open while LinkedIn‚Äôs UI said it was open.

Hey LinkedIn, there‚Äôs something called ‚ÄúQuality Assurance‚Ä¶‚Äù don‚Äôt think you guys have heard of it, I‚Äôd recommend you actually use it

title: Notifications
review:
Since last update LinkedIn doesn‚Äôt  send notifications anymore while I have a new message, although the notification part is on.
Please fix this problem 
Regards

title: Lacks Page Admin Options
review: Unable to change cover photo of page as admin when using mobile app. Why would this only be allowed on a desktop browser? Somewhat frustrating.

title: Unsatisfied Customer
review: I am trying to turn notifications off & can‚Äôt! I‚Äôm beyond frustrated! I‚Äôm not looking for a job anymore & I deleted the app! I keep receiving job postings, I turned off all notifications so why am I continuing to get job postings? Take me off this app now! This is beyond ridiculous! Never again will I use this app ESPECIALLY since there‚Äôs no way to stop receiving notifications! üôÑ WORST JOB APP EVER!!!

title: Job search major problem
review: What is wrong with your app the past few days? For all the job alerts I‚Äôve set up, your app no longer allows me to view jobs just from the past 24 hours. I don‚Äôt want to go through hundreds or more of job posts every day from the past month! You need to fix this otherwise LinkedIn is worthless to me.

title: Bad Customer Service - Poor Story Quality
review: LinkedIn The quality of the stories (images and videos) is terrible when they are posted. Unlike Instagram and Twitter, when you post a story, it looks just like you downloaded it in high quality. And what's worse, the service provider does not meet your expectations and ignores your problem by not responding to your e-mails.

title: The app needs notes when connecting with people.
review: Adding notes when reaching out to a potential connection is a very important aspect of the LinkedIn website. My peers and I would like to see that added to the app as well.

title: Notifications Frenzy
review: I tried to unselect most ways to get LinkedIn notifications, because almost all of them were irrelevant. Then I was still getting all of them. Then I turned off notifications from LinkedIn entirely, only to still get all of them afterward. I finally deleted the app and I‚Äôm still not totally confident that I won‚Äôt get notifications.

title: Just shows jobs you match, not the ones you search for or want
review:
I constantly have employers asking me to apply for their jobs but the application is no where to be found on the site, and when I search for the company that sent the email, the application AND company still dont show in a search. Worst job finding app ever! 
AND I JUST UPDATED AND THE APP IS %1000 WORSE! I want to find a job, NOT SOCIALIZE!!! Indeed is absolutely ruined now

title: Doesn‚Äôt really work
review: I‚Äôm in the process of trying to update my profile after a while, and most every option I‚Äôm trying to use is telling me it doesn‚Äôt work without providing me any reason. I‚Äôve tried both data and WiFi (both are fine, restarting my device, and everything else I can think of. Doesn‚Äôt matter if the service is good if the app doesn‚Äôt let you use it.

title: Invitation notifications do not turn off on iOS
review: Anytime I receive a connection request or someone accepts my request, the motivation does not turn off and it keeps looking like I have a request I am yet to view. This started recently and I‚Äôve turned off all my notifications. Why is it so?

title: Dissatisfied with the Premium subscription
review: Too disappointed using the premium services. Not helpful at all for job search. I was looking for a new job option and paid for at least more then 8 months for premium membership I feel it‚Äôs useless either the job posts I see so far no body either gives a response or I won‚Äôt even get a call back for any recruiters. It‚Äôs like gathering dust on shelves.

title: Best Career App
review: Surprised at some of the low star ratings that exist.  LinkedIn has come a long way and makes managing your career communication and network not only easy but enjoyable. Keep doing what you‚Äôre doing. Thank you.

title: Real estate rental short term 6 months
review: Dana was a pleasure to work with as she secured a rental for my son who will be doing a 6 month training at the police academy. I highly recommend her real estate services as she got us hooked up very quickly! Thank you Dana!!üôÇ Frank G

title: A joke gets worse
review:
I have been trying to access my account for months now. Each time it says update to the APP and it will work better. Good luck with that and why do I need to update to a ‚Äúfree‚Äù service. Goodbye LinkedIn!

Gut a email from the Apple support. They asked me to go to an address that was not a link but one you had to enter in manually. For such a HIGH tech company they are still working in the dark ages. PLEASE TELL ME HOW I GET RID OF MY LINKEDIN ACCOUNT THIS IS A JOKE!!!!!

title: LinkedIn Rocks
review: This is a site where you can connect will all kinds of people and companis. It is the number site for connections. Learn about current and past events at the tip of your fingers.

title: Not Effective Platform
review: These apps were so much better separated. First of all, the app doesn‚Äôt recognize any interests and won‚Äôt save them. Hence, my feed is NOTHING what I like. Filled with sponsors and suggestions. The jobs suggested are nothing if my interests and completely off base. This linked thing needs lots improvement to be helpful.

title: Useful and necessary
review: LinkedIn has created a platform and social network which has transformed how people get and offer employment. The amount of money, people and creativity is evident. Please continue to make your services better and more affordable.

title: Useless and you can do without it
review:
Honestly my frustration is two fold:
First, the way LinkedIn forced this option made me uncomfortable. They offered a free trial then i went to explore my subscription with the intention to cancel it (it was already active but the free trail) it automatically charged $63 to my account!!!!
I don‚Äôt recall seeing a confirmation screen or payment authorization and of course apple refused to refund me.

Second, the premium option itself is of ZERO added value. I can still see who (from my connections viewed my profile) but not recruiters (which I‚Äôm more interested in) 
The rest of the features are very superficial 

I felt that they just wanted to make money for no added value

title: Privacy concern
review: Even though I will not and do not grant access to my contacts on my iPhone, the Linkedin app pulled my contacts into the application and is asking if I would like to send invitations to add these contacts into my network. I appreciate that the application works as advertised; what I do not appreciate is the invasion of privacy. Apple should remove this app until Linkedin chooses to abide by the privacy guidelines conveyed to software developers.

title: trash UX
review:
this is rly feedback for my experience on the website, but idk how else to get it to y‚Äôall...

#1) stop incessantly prompting me to download this app when im using linked in through my browser. if i wanted it, i would have it. the pop up is infinite deal breaker

#2) when im using the search function, why would i want u to refresh the page and shoot me back to the top?! and lose my place / progress as a result?! no sense at all

title: Issue
review: The app block automatically when I open messages after last update today

title: Is it just me??
review: So I have my profile geared towards health and fitness. I have my personal training, FMT, coaching , etc. Certs. My education is clearly exercise science based. I could go on and on, but for some reason I get shown recommended jobs of positions that have nothing to do with my background. My job interests are all set up under health, fitness,  personal trainer, sports coach, etc. Too...this app blows.

title: Editing skills
review: Possibly the most tedious thing in the world. The app tells you that you must pin your three top skills. After you pin those top skills, you can‚Äôt delete them or move them down because the app literally won‚Äôt let you. You try to pin something to the top but it tells you there are three skills already chosen.

title: Kind of pointless
review: So this app functions good, doesn‚Äôt crash... So you sign up for a free account. You upload your resume.  Then when you apply for a job you have to create an account, upload your resume... it‚Äôs no different than if you just google ‚Äújob‚Äù or find a job on Facebook or wherever. There is no advantage or disadvantage to using this app.

title: Incessant crashing since the last iOS update
review: I have no issues with the app normally, be t the most recent iOS update has cratered this app. It takes forever to open, crashes regularly when it does open, and actually has frozen my entire phone when it does crash. If it‚Äôs not fixed soon I‚Äôll just delete and use the mobile site. It‚Äôs borderline unusable at this point.

title: LinkedIn continues to Exceed my Expectations!!
review: I don‚Äôt face book. LinkedIn is basically Facebook for adults. I really enjoy articles others have written pertaining to my area of expertise. Bravo LinkedIn just don‚Äôt get political on me and I am yours for life!!

title: Redownloaded several times, still no luck
review: This app used to work just fine, I don‚Äôt know what they did but it keeps crashing, certain tabs won‚Äôt open up and hard to navigate. Won‚Äôt let me login after logging itself out, absolutely horrible. I just use the web page from my Safari browser. Really wish they would fix this app to make networking easier again

title: Decent platform but...
review: I‚Äôve noticed family members and people I have done retail business with (as a regular consumer) showing up on the ‚Äúpeople you may know‚Äù feature. Why does LinkedIn know I once bought a Mother‚Äôs Day gift from a shop 2 years ago and shows the shop owner in this feature? Is this the next Facebook? How does it know my relatives? Creepy!

title: LinkedIn The Professional Network
review:
Easy to use App Augments to remember important dates events that are meaningful
Also helps to connect and seek help or provide help 
All from the ease of a car or plane ride
Keep it up

title: Best way to network
review: With this app you get the best of both worlds, you're able to socialize and network at the same time! Not to mention all the information available to you to help you with your career.

title: Great social media for professionals
review: Just like my title says this is a great social media tool for professionals. I highly recommend building a profile as I see this having longevity and will prove useful now as well as in the future.

title: Most used app
review: I love using this to keep up to date on professional life matters. I am using this app multiple times a day. It‚Äôs easy to use and never has given me issues. Keep up the great work!

title: Brilliant. Better. Faster!
review: Since Facebook has turned into the Yellow Pages (which just so happens to have pictures of your family and friends, ha ha) - Linkedin has become a vital tool in business acceleration.

title: A Must-Have Social App
review: You may have small things you dislike about the usability of the Linked-In App, (and say what you will), but to reach the professional world through social media, this is not "an" App - this is "THE" App. üëç

title: App scrolling performance on 14/15 pro needs improvement
review: App is overall good but scrolling in feed and in profile in the latest 120hz iphones is very jittery and not smooth at all for some reason. The developer team needs to look at this.

title: The ads and the bots are driving me batty!
review: Seems like about a month ago the ads and the bots (with fake accounts) started on strong. Every time I open the app I see the same ads, sometimes multiple times a session, even after ‚ÄòTeporting‚Äô the ad that ‚ÄòI‚Äôve seen too often‚Äô.. Maddening‚Ä¶ Also constant pressure to upgrade to Premium- why would I pay for this?

title: I will so agree.
review:
When I joined linked in I thought I was going into a professional site with integrity and honesty .
No matter it has become FB.  
People think they can say what they want to whomever they want. 
It seems that lots of people realize why life has gotten so antagannistic but do not contain themselves what is said on these sites. 
It is a shame life, our democracy and what is to come until some control is put out and the money for these sites takes a back seat. 

My first ever and last ever statement in this environment

title: Verification
review: Your method of verifying is really dumb. The only way I verified on an salt was not using a puzzle I can‚Äôt figure out what your questionable process is, I‚Äôve done bunches of verification puzzles not waiting a half hour to complete. So I guess I need to quit! I‚Äôll visit with Bill another time.

title: Account locked
review: My account was locket spit of the blue, several users are facing the same issue and we don‚Äôt know if LinkedIn accounts were hacked, I sent my ID and personal data like you asked in the support platform but I‚Äôm still out, and I already paying a premium plan but can‚Äôt use my account

title: Job search filter doesn‚Äôt work
review: I don‚Äôt understand why I type in a certain language in the job search and the results are nothing (absolutely nothing) related to the language that I‚Äôm searching for. And it‚Äôs not for lack of openings with that language as requirement. I just don‚Äôt understand.

title: I don't need another social app
review: I already have many apps used for social, they do pretty good job so I don‚Äôt need another one. I don‚Äôt need the whole world to know my background, my occupation etc because that‚Äôs my privacy!! Whoever can view my profile should be under the authorization of me!! This app should serve my job searching purpose well. Improve it or I will throw away this garbage!

title: Let me copy text from a job description
review: Some of these employers bury the pay range in links, of course there is no easy way to access this since It will not let me copy the url.  If the description text urls wont let me tap on them, at least make it easy for me to long press and copy and paste it myself.

title: Constantly have to redownload
review: LinkedIn is great when it actually works. However, there has been multiple times I have to delete and redownload the app because nothing will refresh and it says ‚Äúno internet connection‚Äù when I am connected to wifi or have good cellular data. It is very frustrating and I haven‚Äôt found a solution.

title: App constantly having issues!!!!
review: Every time I try to login, it says something went wrong and I can‚Äôt access anything within the app. There have been many updates recently but none have solved the problem. Where‚Äôs quality control at because this app is created for professionals and it‚Äôs quickly losing confidence among them.

title: Please FIX remove connection!  Its not working!
review:
It was good up to a point.

Politics is ruining this tool.  It is not meant for politics.  This is for jobs, recruiting, and networking.

Also, remove connections is not working.  I can‚Äôt get rid of annoying sales people and certain recruiters that waste people‚Äôs time with dead end offers.

title: Bugs in new version
review: With the latest app version I‚Äôm being asked to login every time I open the app, and sometimes when I‚Äôm switching between areas of the app. Also frequently unable to load content. These are new issues, previous versions worked fine. Hope they get it all sorted out quickly.

title: Job isn't working for me
review: I'm trying to search for a job on your sight. I  put in job title and location. Once I hit search the location information disappears and we can't find your location. I've tried it several times with the same results. I use an iPhone 10s Max on 13.3 firmware

title: Locking my phone up
review: Not sure if you guys sent an update out recently, but the last few weeks I have not opened the app because everytime I do, my phone freezes.. I‚Äôve never had that problem before... please let me know when the problem is fixed!

title: Mobile app routinely does not load pages
review: 80 to 90% of the time, when I click a link in email or even just try navigating around within in the app, the app is unable to load the page. I either get a ‚Äúno internet connection,‚Äù which isn‚Äôt true, or an ‚Äúoops it‚Äôs us not you, try again‚Äù (trying again is no help). This has been happening for at least a year.

title: Capp is not iPhone XR compatible
review: I just started using LinkedIn and was excited to find that they had an official iOS app, however when I open the app on my iPhone XR, it is not formatted right and up at the top where my speaker is is where the dashboard buttons are and my time and network status icon overlay the other function buttons making this app useless unless you have an iPhone 8 or previous model. PLEASE UPDATE!!!

title: Non-Functional
review: When uploading my photo, whenever I‚Äôd click to save, nothing would happen. Then it glitched and kept saying that the photo upload had failed over and over in a notification. After trying to add more background to my profile, the same thing happened with the save button.

title: No professional operating system
review:
I have had the exact same problem as a review posted on Friday and have tried to gain access to a previous account I kid you, not for years!!! 
The lack of access to customer service is your downfall. I had over 500 contacts carefully culled as one of your first subscriptions... All lost! Please take this issue seriously or it will be your downfall. Thanks for listening!

title: Fine for commending others.
review:
I look through app to commend others on their promotions or their years of service. As far as my advancement from the site, Companies won‚Äôt hire me for what I‚Äôm worth, and I won‚Äôt get promoted because of department politics.
Otherwise, it‚Äôs a nice site for information and congratulating others.

title: Disappointing
review:
I cannot read and write my direct messages. Whenever I wanna to open my messages It jumps out of app completely! 
First it jumped out during my typing but now it doesn‚Äôt even open it!
Also it can not open the pdf attachment which is sent to me! 
I uninstalled and downloaded the app again but still it doesn‚Äôt fix!

title: News Feed Sorting A Drawback
review: The inability to sort my feed chronologically makes the app not as useful as it could be. I don‚Äôt want to see something from three weeks ago over and over again. I don‚Äôt want you trying to anticipate what‚Äôs important to me. If I‚Äôm following a page, it‚Äôs important to me. Give me the option to see what‚Äôs going on as it‚Äôs going on.

title: Too slow and laggy
review:
In general LinkedIn is very slow. But the app makes the experience more horrible. 

The app shows banners for notifications, but takes forever to show the updated notifications when I open the app (this is in fast internet connection).  Overall the app feels really heavy and very slow. 
I am
Using it on iPhone Xs. So there should be no reason for it have low performance.

title: No more swipe to clear notifications
review: The latest update no longer allows me to swipe to clear garbage from notifications. Who thought this is a good idea? Now I have to tap twice on the dots. Bring back the swipe!

title: Bugs
review:
New update has a major bug. When someone sends you a connection request, you cannot see their profile in the mobile app by clicking on the request, it‚Äôs getting frustrating.
Overall, love the app but it‚Äôs be great if developers can fix this.

title: Love but...
review:
Great app. Really user friendly and I‚Äôm happy with it. 

***Wish this app had the Groups function. Also wish this app allowed group moderators to be able to do so instead of only being able to do so from the website***

title: Needs Update
review: App works great for the most part. However, it crashes A LOT, especially whenever I am in the middle of applying for a job. This has occurred countless times and is just time consuming. I‚Äôve had to simply open the job applications via my browser. Please work on this lag.

title: Needs Dark Mode
review: Other than my feed being littered with recommendation, promoted posts and shared videos of pets...this app really needs a nice UI/UX redesign, this on top of including a dark mode for those who peruse during after hours.

title: Catch up notifications are annoying!
review:
How can we turn off catch up notifications under my network tab?

Note: Please give users ability to activate/deactivate new features when those are launched.

title: DEVELOPER PLEASE READ
review: Great app but they decided to lock me out of my account permanently for no reason. I did nothing wrong. Has no phone number to call and no accessible support team. I don‚Äôt know how LinkedIn has managed to design such a bad customer service system. You must log in to the account to get customer service which no one who is locked out of the account can do.

title: App glitch
review: App not working whenever i try to open the side bar to navigate through menu

title: won‚Äôt stop crashing
review: I can‚Äôt open the app it just crashes. it has been doing this for a while but the new update made it crash even faster. pls fix this i would love to look at linkedin on my phone

title: Love the app
review: Lots of good stuff to learn from this platform. I do see that scroll view scrolls and hangs at the status bar when I use iOS app. UI need to be fixed o. iOS 15 iPhone Xr.

title: Direct Messaging it getting worse
review: Having the direct messaging is great, but when it is as glitchy as it has gotten over the past week it becomes extremely annoying.  I have to type messages 3 times for them to come out correctly.  So frustrating‚Ä¶

title: Stop rebooting the app!
review: If I am writing a message or filling out a job application when I go away from the app to google search a questions or spelling and return to LinkedIn it erases and reboots my screen. I have to type my messages off the app and copy/paste them in. lame.

title: Not worth it
review:
After using this app for almost a week, I have only received calls back from fake employers, or pyramid scam type people. 
When urgently looking for a job it‚Äôs very frustrating to have to go through multiple fake or useless contacts.
Maybe try to screen the people who are submitting these jobs? Beacuse this experience was unprofessional.

title: update is causing issues
review: The News Feed page is now super sensitive to touch. Since the last update‚Ä¶ my screen swipes right without barely a touch while in the middle of reading. Also, the right border of the page is cut off and text disappears off-screen. please fix asap.

title: Not bad, can be better
review:
There are minor improvements I would like to see in the app:
- Likes of posts and comments should be present in a chronological order
- App font size should be adjustable like in Twitter
Thanks

title: Notifications bug
review: After the recent update the notifications tab is blank. New notifications are not received or displayed.

title: My Network Notification Bug
review: My notification badge is constantly appearing even though there isn‚Äôt anything to be notified about. When I check on the notification, there isn‚Äôt anything. The badge just keeps appearing throughout the day for no reason.

title: Simple feature to add
review:
Hi Guys,
Can you please add a simple feature to mark jobs that I‚Äôve already applied for on an external site in the same way you have it to ‚Äúeasy apply‚Äù job posts. It will be even better to add a filter to the search.
Thanks!!

title: Cannot Sort Posts
review: On the desktop there is a way to sort by recent posts, which helps when new jobs are posted as I‚Äôm looking for work. On mobile there is no way to sort the posts, so the ones that come up on top of the feed are weeks old and lead to job links that have already expired. Not very helpful.

title: App seems to be losing capabilities
review: I have always accessed LinkedIn via this app. But over the last year or so key capabilities are disappearing. I can no longer print a post. Groups and companies post events and I used to print that information. And I have lost some of the profile items that are still available on the web.

title: Profile background/banner photo not showing on App
review: Can‚Äôt see background photos for individual profiles on mobile app. It‚Äôs been over a month having this issue, please fix.

title: Lack of ability to sort by recent vs. top content
review: I like the app overall, but find it very frustrating that I cannot sort my feed so the newest content appears at the top. I miss so many things this way. Please consider adding this functionality to the iOS app. Thank you!

title: LinkedIn app version no longer support
review: When I open the LinkedIn app on my iPad I've been getting the message"We're sorry, the version of the LinkedIn app you're using is no longer supported. Instead, pease visit us on our mobile sire". I go to the App Store to download the current version, but the app says "open" not download.  This app on my iPhone works fine. This has been going for some time and is irritating.

title: Spying on users now?
review: This company was just caught stealing all the data from your iOS and linked Mac clipboards. How low do you have to go to spy on users? And before you state that it‚Äôs a bug, what kind of bug testing do you do? How did it take a user calling you out on the issue? For this to happen, you have to intentionally call the API for this. It‚Äôs not a bug, it‚Äôs a convenient LinkedIn data harvesting feature!

title: Got to have the app!
review: Having the app creates frequent opportunities to do what LinkedIn is designed to do - get connected fast, to a vast network of professionals. Easy to use and navigate even on my small iPhone.

title: App Crashes
review:
I have been having this issue for so long. Whenever I try to write a post the application crashes and I didn‚Äôt able to write a sentence or even copy and paste anything in the post. 
Kindly fix this bug as I use the app frequently more than the website.

title: Very slow
review: Why does this app take so long to load updates?  It‚Äôs very frustrating knowing that I have an update and can‚Äôt see it.  It‚Äôs not because of poor connection.  It‚Äôs because of poor application service by LinkedIn.  I had to delete the app from my phone due to the constant frustration of their slow service.

title: Optimize for Tablet
review: Almost every major platform out there has versions of their mobile apps optimized for phones and one for tablets. I am an avid user and fan, but cannot believe LinkedIn has not optimized their mobile app for tablets. You get the phone app stretched to full screen with all activity in the center and a lot of dead space on either side.

title: More updated more bugs?
review:
I literally found bugs every single time i use this app after updating it
I don‚Äôt know if they update it to get new features in and bugs out or the opposite 
This update the app just freezes when I try to apply for job 
Like no this job I won‚Äôt let you apply for it using the browser

title: Not easy to use
review: You can‚Äôt do too much on the app. The upgrade is expensive and I doubt it would be worth it. It‚Äôs not easy to apply for jobs unless you can apply directly through LinkedIn but most jobs don‚Äôt allow you to do that. You get tons of notifications for people‚Äôs birthdays. This isn‚Äôt Facebook; I don‚Äôt care when it‚Äôs a connection‚Äôs birthday or when they have a job anniversary.

title: Love it!
review: From the very beginning I have been a fan and can clearly see the advantages of having a LinkedIn account on any level! If you are a professional it is a must have !!!

title: App was fine but not anymore...
review: The app started out great... I was able to use it without a problem but for the last week or so whenever I‚Äôm using it it always ends up freezing. I have to close out the app and open it back up and then the same problem keeps happening so now I have to use my browser in order to utilize the site. Very disappointing and very frustrating!!

title: New Feature request
review: Categories saved items and add search bar to it.

title: Notifications
