review: I keep getting a badge notification for things I‚Äôve already looked at. For example, I got one early today with a comment on a new job I had posted. Then just now, I got two new notifications, one for something actually new, and one for the comment I mentioned.

title: Buggy
review: If you click outside of a message you are writing to someone, the message goes off the bottom of the screen and you will not be able to click back into it.

title: Screw incareer
review: I try to use LinkedIn in China via browser, it redirects me to incareer with exclusively jobs in China, most of which require knowing Chinese, but I‚Äôm a foreigner and don‚Äôt speak Chinese. When I try to use the app, it only says oops something went wrong every time I try to do anything at all. It‚Äôs extremely frustrating and it looks like I won‚Äôt be able to use LinkedIn at all

title: Annoying notifications
review: Too many annoying notifications and irrelevant content. Hard to tailor notifications to my needs. Plus these irrelevant notifications have started to make a sound. App is distracting and no longer feels like a professional networking app.

title: Too EZ to Accidentally Follow/Connect
review: ..That I accidentally send requests! Please add a "Are you sure you want to..." button! I'm scrolling down the Home feed and hit "Follow" on someone's profile by accident. I find that I'm connected to someone and have no idea how we got connected. ü§¶üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Aside from my butterfingers, please add a safeguard against these little mishaps!

title: Indeed is 10x better
review: I‚Äôve had linkedin for the better half of a year and have not had any luck finding a job through it. I downloaded Indeed last week and I‚Äôm already starting a new job. This isn‚Äôt an ad or a paid promotion, just want people to save their time and get their money up ASAP. It‚Äôs also a lot easier to manage. good luck folks :‚Ä¢)

title: Does not work
review: I spoken to customer support logged out deletes the app signed in on a computer and it still tells me to try again and doesn‚Äôt want to work! It‚Äôs insanely frustrating then I try to log in on safari from my phone and it just constantly wants to open the app which‚Ä¶doesn‚Äôt work! So I can‚Äôt communicate with people I can‚Äôt use it at all.

title: The app glitches and it‚Äôs slow
review: The app is slow and glitches all the time, especially when I enter a page and examine their posts and try to save them

title: Dark Mode option missing
review: Been waiting every update to see the option for Dark Mode and it isn‚Äôt there. Says it‚Äôs by region but other people I know have it.

title: Company verification settings.
review:
Companies should have the option to approve staff affiliations, add or remove LinkedIn users who no longer work with/for the organization. 

LinkedIn users can send requests to add a company to their profile ( e.g CEO at XYZ Limited but must  be subject to verification). Companies should have control over approving or declining requests to list an affiliation/designation. 

Some of my former colleagues who no longer work within the company are still listed as staff with the company profile as their ‚Äòpresent‚Äô employment. 

Very misleading.

title: Same job posting but 50 times for every city
review: Now that remote is more popular, you end up getting job posting for same job, same company appearing in your search 20-50 times, one for each major cities in each state in the continental US. I don't need to see your software engineer II repeated 50 times

title: App Freezes
review: Whenever open the LinkedIn app its open but no content shows on a screen and most of the time it get freezes after couple of swipes and touch also not working iam on a very latest iOS and the app is also updated this issue iam facing from last many many months and this is third complaint.

title: Feed needs to have ‚ÄúMost Recent‚Äù feature rather than ‚Äútop‚Äù
review: This is possible on the desktop version but not mobile.  I see posts from 3 weeks ago constantly.  In a job market where job openings open and close in days, that is entirely unhelpful (doesn‚Äôt matter how many ‚Äúlikes‚Äù a recruiter post gets if it‚Äôs 3 weeks old)

title: Profile Picture
review: Every time I go to update my profile picture, it turns dark and is completely unusable. This is weird.

title: As a successful professional at 75 years now having some short term memory issues I have tr
review:
After writing a review I was told it was too long , since it was in the untitled subject line. This adds to my frustration level which as a very successful professional I do not need. I have failed to sign in to their convoluted security system so I can‚Äôt even 
Resign and eliminate my data.

title: What is this company doing if they aren‚Äôt actually getting people jobs
review: The website is full of robots and scammers trying to charge you for everything. The site costs an arm and a leg to be on premium . Sometimes I feel like the site isn‚Äôt out here helping people get jobs but making the situation worse. I say people need to stop paying premium plans if it‚Äôs not actually helping their career.

title: Nice but crashing after latest update
review:
The app is really nice and worked well till last update. 
However, whenever am opening message tab, it simply crashes. 
Please look into it.

title: Profile photo troubles
review: I have tried 15 times to upload my professionally taken photo as my profile pic, and each time, LinkedIn distorts the colors of my photo making it oversaturated, nearly all black. I‚Äôve look for a way to contact customer service about this but also could not find anything except basic search arrived. Oh well, looks like no profile photo for me.

title: Lack of help, never responds, lost hope.
review: I made the mistake of thinking this was a ‚Äúhelpful‚Äù site. I‚Äôve been on LinkedIn almost a week now, & with no friends it‚Äôs kind of difficult to maneuver, as if that‚Äôs not bad enough tagging LinkedIn to ask em questions directly gets you nowhere, no response, none at at all. Even some of their members seem oblivious. If anyone has a better site/app anything, pls comment it I‚Äôd appreciate it.

title: Update for iPad Pro?
review: The app looks terrible on my new iPad Pro. I‚Äôm kind of surprised that something so simple has not been addressed. Otherwise this is a decent app but you have to rely on the desktop (browser version) until they fix the large ‚Äúblack borders‚Äù. This version looks like it has not been updated since like the 9.7 inch iPad or something.

title: Freezes every now and then
review: Anything that goes to Microsoft becomes worse. Same applies to linkedin. It has become soo bad! On a pretty good phone It freezes every freakin time i try to open a post or a job posting or anything! So, anything you have entered/edited/updated goes away when it freezes. And when you try to do it again it freezes again in the middle. #stupidLinkedin #Hateit

title: Crashes when trying to post photos
review: Crashes on iOS 12 / iPhone 7 when trying to upload photos. Please fix. Otherwise a great app and UI.

title: Crashes in built in browser when applying for jobs
review: This is a serious problem that needs to be addressed and fixed asap. I lost my place and couldn't find the job posting after it had crashed when applying for a position.

title: Restaurant Entrepreneur
review: After a hiatus from this application, finding resumption of activity to be of incredible value, going forward, with future and current ventures. Anticipate that most investors will emanate from your service!!

title: Too many emails
review: One thing that annoys the heck out of me is that I‚Äôm being subscribed to other job posting sites when submitting an application on LinkedIn. I‚Äôve had to unsubscribe from these other sites because I kept getting spam. I wish they could fix this but I doubt they will.

title: App keeps closing/crashing
review: In the last 24hr‚Äôs the App has closed or crashed for me over 50 Times.  I‚Äôm not sure what‚Äôs going on with it and that‚Äôs why I am giving it 3 stars. Other then that when it‚Äôs working it‚Äôs great. I love that I can connect with employers and recruiters and even connect with people that I know.

title: Post-Microsoft acquisition = total garbage
review:
I woke up last January to find out that LinkedIn was ‚Äúchanged‚Äù. 
What a nightmare it‚Äôs been ever since. 
Today I awoke to see new problems with my LinkedIn (daily now days) and i go to send a report and low and behold, they‚Äôve REMOVED THE CONTACT US BUTTON.
LinkedIn went from a Great business site to complete garbage. What a disappointment. 
Oh and I could and have given dozens of details so don‚Äôt ask for any more.

title: Very helpful and grateful
review: I love all the information you sent me, but in my job profile, it says I live in New Jersey. I‚Äôm not willing to relocate to another state. That‚Äôs all other than that I can‚Äôt say a bad word about you guys. You guys are AMAZING!!! ü§óü§ó

title: My review
review: I really enjoy the dialogue that goes on LinkedIn. I am also about to take development classes and hear from different professionals in my field or the field in which I am studying.

title: ‚ÄúShow me less of this‚Äù feature does NOT work
review:
The swipe left feature for postings, ‚ÄúShow me less of this‚Äù does not really work. After I close the app and open it back app, those same postings still pop up on my feed.

So, what‚Äôs the point of offering this feature then?

title: Super helpful
review: I find the Linked In app easy to use and very useful.  It keeps up to date with other professionals in my field both near and far.  It introduces me to new ideas.  Best of all it‚Äôs on the go.....

title: Awesome!!!!!
review: LinkedIn does all the hard work and has opened doors for myself and thousands of talented professionals!!!! All you have to do is walk through and leave the door open for others!!!!!

title: Current Bugs
review: The app on my iPhone continues to log me out numerous times a day even when I‚Äôm interacting within it. Could it be a bug from a recent update?

title: Needs dark mode, notifications commingle lots of spam with realMessages
review:
Blinding when opening at night. Needs a dark more desperately.

Also the notification system is really abusing itself. Lots of spam mixed with legitimate conversations but unfortunately I cannot rely on LinkedIn to properly manage the app

title: Why take away download image feature?

title: Issues with rendering on 12 in ipad pro
review: I hate to leave a star rating but there is no other way I can see to report bugs. The way the app renders in comments, I cannot leave a reply. The ‚Äúsend‚Äù button is inaccessable. I have a screen shot, but no way to attach it to this review. Hopefully my decription is enough.

title: Messaging feature almost unusable
review: Messaging feature within app is constantly lagging, will double send messages, painfully slow to load messages, and will randomly crash in the middle of typing messages. All of this, plus the battery drain that the app is, makes the app almost not even worth having.

title: Paying Customer, Can‚Äôt Connect
review: It‚Äôs been almost a week now and I can‚Äôt connect to my account. I have tried emailing support, speaking to LI on Facebook and have done everything they have asked. Still nothing. A huge part of my professional life is wrapped up on LinkedIn and I can‚Äôt get in. Not only that but my network can‚Äôt see me on the system. Please help.

title: Not sure why LinkedIn exists
review: I‚Äôm honestly not sure why LinkedIn exists. It‚Äôs either people bragging about their accomplishments, or people sending you unsolicited spam messages all day long. That‚Äôs really the only two things that ever seem to happen on LinkedIn. And of course, now people have political arguments on there too. No thanks. I get enough spam messages already.

title: Does not respect your privacy
review: I got my account restricted after setting it up. I know the only reason it got restricted was because I use a VPN. I know this because I didn‚Äôt have LinkedIn long enough to do anything else to violate their ‚Äúrules‚Äù. The fact that I got restricted for using a VPN tells me that this company does not respect your right to privacy. I will not be appealing to come back.

title: I‚Äôma Premium Member and I want my money back
review: This app never works. I don‚Äôt know what changes you made to your developer team but the app constantly says it‚Äôs having issues loading pages. Doesn‚Äôt matter whether it‚Äôs on WIFI or 5G and I have the latest iPhone. Give me a refund because I can‚Äôt use this piece of crap. Hire better developers your membership isn‚Äôt cheap!!

title: Unable to upload pictures
review: I‚Äôm having trouble uploading my profile picture on my profile. I have tried multiple times to load pictures on there.

title: Should allow users to select which region they would like be part of.
review: Being in the globalization era, talents world wide connect to each other for exchange of ideas and information, that motivates the forward moving of global economy. Please allow users to decide which market they are in, in case important functionalities are disabled in a region he or she is traveling in.

title: The app won‚Äôt load on mobile internet
review:
I‚Äôve been struggling with this for over a year. LinkedIn is the only app that doesn‚Äôt work with my mobile internet! It simply won‚Äôt load and there‚Äôs no way to reach out to someone in tech department.
My iOS is updated and the app is the latest version. Re-installing the app doesn‚Äôt help. So beyond annoying

title: ‚ÄúNo Internet Connection‚Äù
review: This app constantly disconnects itself from the internet. At home, in a WiFi setting, if I exit the app to look at email then go back to it, I get the error. It takes forever to reconnect. I wind up viewing LinkedIn via webpage. Good thing I don‚Äôt pay for this app, it would be pointless.

title: Almost satisfying
review: Hi LinkedIn support, I created my account and used it for about a month and then I was restricted and I can‚Äôt seem to figure out why. Is there a way I can find out what went wrong and possibly get my account back? I don‚Äôt mind having the account reviewed for possible return, thanks...

title: Annoying Interruptions
review: I have intentionally disabled the ability of apps to request reviews in the App Store because I dislike the interruption they cause. LinkedIn has decided that in order to work around this, they ask for feedback in-app that doesn‚Äôt make it into App Store reviews, which is every bit as disruptive and annoying. So, here is your review, LinkedIn. You get one star for ignoring user intent and preferences.

title: Freezes a lot
review: Good app but freezes up a lot while I‚Äôm trying to fill out applications. End up having to try at least 4 times and still may not work so some jobs I just can‚Äôt apply for ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

title: Fake jobs
review:
Reported HUNDREDS of fake jobs to LinkedIn staff via email.

They ignore my reports and appear to be fine that fake jobs are posted (unpaid ‚Äújobs‚Äù from Kenya that require your social security number to apply, for example).

This app also contains THOUSANDS of fake profiles pretending to be legit American citizens adding connections randomly and attempting to scam and/or phish. They are unsurprisingly all from India or China. LinkedIn intentionally harbors them to make it seem like more people use their app. You can read multiple reports by the FBI and other intelligence agencies.

This is a copy/paste review due to LinkedIn frequently flagging my review for deletion. Checked and updated daily! :)

title: Major Profile Picture Bug
review: There is a major bug with uploading a picture in the iPhone app. It makes the picture way too dark, and there is no way to change it! I had to log in on the desktop site to upload my profile picture without it being darkened.

title: One app multiple work for professional
review: One app multiple work for professional connection, job , massenger etc amusing, but sometimes spamming disturb in massenger can‚Äôt block it need effective Sulotion

title: Basic
review: Provides the most basic LinkedIn functionality. Annoying that it doesn‚Äôt connect/merge with my recruiter account. Ridiculous having to go back and forth between apps which are all part of the same provider

title: No functionality for company pages
review: It‚Äôs disappointing there‚Äôs no support for mobile updates. What‚Äôs the point of a mobile app for businesses without that functionality? The inability to update company pages on mobile browsers is also a drawback. If the only way to update a company page is on a desktop browser you are missing many opportunities to be responsive.

title: Auto playing audio is stopping my music and podcasts
review: I can‚Äôt browse the app because every time I scroll past a video my music or podcast stops playing.

title: Wish I didn‚Äôt have to use
review: Half the time when I click on a job or recommended link it either fails to load or so job not found. Half of the posts I see are spammy ads for degrees or colleges I don‚Äôt care about. Really wish I didn‚Äôt have to use the app for connecting

title: Crashes in the middle of reading article
review: Every time I click to read an article that takes me away from the news feed, I get about 30 seconds before the app crashes. This is EVERY TIME I‚Äôm trying to read an article. I won‚Äôt continue to use the app, it‚Äôs too aggravating and time wasting to crash and then try to find the article you wanted to read in the first place.

title: Wonderful!
review: I love the idea of LinkedIn. It brings people professionally closer. There could be something‚Äôs if they would be added, it would be great. I would be more than happy to be contacted by the developers.

title: Great App!!   Very up to date information and news.
review: I really am amazed at the way the app has news, jobs, and up to date information.  Fantastic and powerful app.

title: Amazing Network
review: LinkedIn is in my opinion what Facebook should have been. The team there really has made an amazing effort to create an app that is useful, provides great info and t serves its consumers. Great job LinkedIn.

title: Love this app!
review: So many apps are not good compared to their desktop platform, but Linkedin has done a remarkable job at making it simple and easy to use on the mobile format. Great job!

title: Hard to get working.
review: Setting up this app and making a profile was difficult. I confirmed my email address 5 times and it still wants me to confirm it and won't let me log in properly. Would of been nice to use this resource to find a job. Guess they need to fix some problems with how this app functions. Disappointed.

title: Messages bot opening
review:
Hi Team,

When I tap on messages it does not open. Tries multiple times and i had kill the app on background closing completely. The phone I am currently using is iphone 14 pro max. Not sure if others experienced this?

title: Job Search function broken
review: The job search function is not working correctly. It no longer searches on key words so I am getting all kinds of jobs without these key words and are not relevant. Makes job searching pretty much useless right now. Please fix.

title: Major bug
review: Does not calculate time spent idle on the mobile app. Shows that you‚Äôre idle for 30-45 minutes and then shows you‚Äôre active again even though you may not have used the app for days

title: Promoted Job Search Results
review: The ‚ÄúPromoted‚Äù jobs have totally ruined the job searching experience on LinkedIn. I just want the results based on my search sorted newest to oldest. I keep seeing the same ‚ÄúPromoted‚Äù jobs over and over again.

title: Attempted force download!!
review: I am a Linkedin subscriber. Someone sent me a link via linkedin. I tried to view it on my phone.  However the internet is not an acceptable use for Linkedin. They would not let me use it via my phone, even though I could see it, because they wanted me to download their app. No choice. Either download the app or no access. No thanks.

title: Be careful with the unfollow option
review: Apparently they put remove connection right under the unfollow option in LinkedIn mobile later versions. It‚Äôs very easy to remove people you didn‚Äôt intend to

title: Great app one suggestion
review: Love the app but please get rid of the ‚Äòyour invitation is on its way‚Äô banner that appears after you send a request to connect. If a user taps on connect or the plus sign, they already know they have sent an invitation to connect.

title: Pages not showing in app but fine on browser
review: One of the I am admin for is not showing in the app when I select it. The other two pages are fine but one won‚Äôt show. Is this a know bug in the new release. It won‚Äôt even show when I search for the page in the search menu.  Can someone let me know how to fix the issue?

title: Turns a blind eye against racism
review: Someone basically wrote in a comment that people in Africa are not suitable to procreate and I reported it but apparently this racist comment does not go against LinkedIn Policy. Very disappointed in what I used to think was a great app! They should really take a hard look at their policy.

title: Status updates
review: Would it be possible to add a specific page or a sort feature to isolate job updates? I feel they often get lost in the ongoing feed update of other posts. Thanks!

title: Webviews!
review:
I lost important data 10+ times.

Ex: I am applying to a job from LinkedIn webview, then I opened safari to search for and copy my LinkedIn profile link. When I click on my profile from the search results, it opens the App and close the webview! I think alert here will be perfect.

title: conversation problem in this version
review: Linked in is the best and I spend most of my time with it but in this version I‚Äôve faced sudden quitting error during a chat writing.

title: No internet but I have internet
review:
On my iPad, that works with this app, it says no internet and refuses to work. Even the website won‚Äôt load.

Yet all my other apps load, all other webpages load? I have a 5 bar WiFi connection...

As a graduating student I need access to LinkedIn for job searching now, on every device possible, and it‚Äôs odd that everything linked in refuses to work on my iPad.

title: Crash when Posting new Content
review: Why this app makes the device hot and crashes every time I want to post something new? It's been like this for multiple months now and I think developers should fix this issue. It's so frustrating to write a caption and fix everything and then the app crashes. This is not a good app.

title: Be cautious of spam
review: I downloaded this app and created a profile specifically for the purpose of job seeking. Their job ads take you to links that will spam up your email making you think you are applying for a job. I was able to avoid most but apparently I signed up for one and now I constantly get blown up with spam mail. This really needs to be addressed. Job postings should be vetted.

title: Love/Hate Relationship with the App
review: I love the platform...even as they push getting a paid option. My spat is with the app. It crashes way too much. At least three times a day, it‚Äôll close the app to a black screen. Sometimes as I scroll, and others while I‚Äôm creating a post.

title: Crashes during job application
review: Having trouble to apply jobs with this application. Especially when the app dodges me a website to create an account to finish the application process. The app is freezing and non-responsive and it crashes! Totally annoying!! It only works 1-tap apply jobs.. please solve this problem.

title: Fix the constant crashing
review: I‚Äôm tired of being in the middle of an application and then the app freezes and crashes on me. I don‚Äôt even know how to continue an application after the crash. I hate looking for the job again since the search is so confusing giving you too many options.

title: Selfish and self-serving
review: As any other big corporation before they, LinkedIn has become smug and egoistic. Their app is their worst ever, made to service them first and their users last. They think they are beyond reach because they are without any competitors.....yet. But even Facebook learnt that they ultimately serve their users and hurting their users‚Äô interest will hurt them in the long run. LinkedIn will learn the same lesson....eventually.

title: TURN OFF AUTO-PLAY IN VIDEOS (fixed)
review:
I can't use linkedin while listening to music anymore because videos will start playing automatically. Very stupid.

Edit: fixed

title: I'm with leaders
review: Finally i am with amazing world wide linked in, it's what i was looking for, I‚Äôve learned a lot from learning courses I keeps updating my self on the new Ideas, vacancies , self development and much more.

title: So many new features it's getting better
review: Truly evolving into more of a social network. Like is so far, especially the video feature.

title: Daily run down
review: Great way to start a day to get the mind up and running in a business frame of mind, daily run down and other informative articles.

title: Notifications repeating
review: Viewing a new item clears the notification then it comes back. Two, three, four times for the same post. Turning off all notifications until they fix this mess.

title: Last update it crashed immediately after open
review: Last update it crashed immediately after open

title: Language Stuck in Chinese
review: LinkedIn does not give you access to change language settings. My account was hacked and the language was changed to Chinese despite my device settings obviously being in English. So I‚Äôm getting tons of Chinese emails and not to mention my photo was changed to an Asian woman. Then I was locked out of my account. Please fix

title: It works alright, but photos have a weird little bug
review: Sending a photo on the phone, it appears to rotate any portrait shots to landscape rotating the photo.

title: Too expensive and too many bugs
review:
Ever since signing up, i get two of the same  exact notifications and emails daily. 

I do not need two emails and two in-push notifications for with the same exact infornation. 

thats 4 of the same thing. 

This bug is still present even after the last update or two. 

I will be turning off email notifications in the app and uninstalling linkedin from my iphone because this is ridiclous, because as software developer this notification issue that hundreds of users have been experiencing is a bug that can be easily resolved.

title: Crashing and lagging
review: For the past few weeks I‚Äôve been experiencing a lot of lagging and crashing with my LinkedIn app on my iPhone 13. It happens whenever I send a message it lags and eventually crashes. This has been very annoying for me it hasn‚Äôt stopped since it started.

title: You got a message!
review: How on earth do you think I will ever respond positively to a push notification for a message that is actually just an ad. Now I‚Äôm angry enough to a) scream into the void and write this review and b) turn off all notifications forever. You absolute buffoons, you‚Äôve achieved the increased engagement from you desired, but I don‚Äôt think this is what you had in mind.

title: What is LinkedIn‚Äôs purpose?
review:
I clicked on a job link and was redirected through a nesting doll of sign-in pages before losing the trail.

Going back to my feed, the link was long gone, but I did see inspirational posts from two people I knew in college, and Emma celebrating Dennis reposting Christina‚Äôs link to a screenshot from Twitter, which is almost as good.

title: Doesn‚Äôt work
review: Loads and then immediately shows an error message saying that it can‚Äôt load.  After updating, now I can see my notifications, but can‚Äôt do anything with them.  Works fine on my laptop, but that doesn‚Äôt really work for my use case.  Mobile site just redirects me to the app.  iPhone X, latest version of iOS.

title: Job Sort Functionality
review: Jobs that require 5+ years of experience should not be listed as ‚ÄúEntry Level‚Äù. This is a very common problem and makes it hard to search effectively for jobs.

title: Nothing but dark patterns
review: When opening the app I received a full page ‚Äúperiodically sync your calendar to LinkedIn prompt‚Äù which was impossible to close. The only options presented to the user was to accept this gross privacy violation or ‚Äúlearn more‚Äù which flowed back into the initial prompt. Completely gross and shameful that Apple reviews allow this behavior from large apps.

title: Bad UX design
review: Unfortunately when I want to type a comment for a post, I can‚Äôt see the next line and cursor stays on same line!!!! Next line hides for typing.

title: Could be better
review: Subscription is too high for small entrepreneurs so this app can only help large businesses that can afford expensive subscriptions.

title: Free premium trial is NOT free
review:
I tried to test out their free premium trial but decided to cancel it a few weeks before the trial was set to expire in November. Was still charged for that trial and unable to receive a refund despite requesting one. 

They should tell users that their free trial is not really free, because they will still charge you even if you cancel during your month trial.

title: Always remember what Steve Jobs said...
review:
If it‚Äôs free then YOU are the product. So, I‚Äôm not sure why anyone would be surprised that this app would be tracking users just as much as something like Facebook does. üòÇ
UPDATE: I received a copy and pasted dev response (probably a bot lol) explaining to me why they read our clipboard contents... I never asked about or made any mention of that BUT now that you‚Äôve brought it up...
Trackers trackers everywhere.

title: Location
review: I keep changing my location to where I want to look for jobs and it never shows any in my area. I‚Äôm constantly getting notifications and emails for places I‚Äôve never even heard of while it completely ignore my area that I need a job in

title: Infuriating networking gauntlet
review: Every time I launch the app it requires me to answer a succession of questions about whether I want it to go through all my contacts for possible connections, consider an assortment of other connections, etc. etc., when I just want to get to my home screen. And if I‚Äôve got a poor signal, my phone will time out before it even loads! There needs to be a shortcut!

title: Not backward compatible
review:
App won't work on my older iPad4. Had to delete app. 
Now I can only use on my newer devices. Are the developers not smart enough to make it backward compatible?
A notice appears on the screen to update to the latest version (which won't work on this device), but you can't delete the notice and continue on with the version that works, so it is now useless.

title: LinkedIn is #1 in my opinion
review:
Top notch people making deep connections and friendships. Great people everywhere you turn. I have made lasting friendships here on LinkedIn and wouldn‚Äôt miss a day of sharing the love with my friends. 
Chef Sully
Jill sullivan

title: LinkedIn acct lost, no help from LinkedIn
review: My acct was hacked.  Then my acct duplicated.  I tried unsuccessfully for 5 months to get assistance from LinkedIN to restore my original acct and delete the duplicate acct, while fixing the hack.   Nothing.  LinkedIN did nothing.  It is very difficult to submit request for help, and there are no actual help desk people to contact.  LinkedIN is alwYs wanting to sell an upgraded acct but does nothing to support those with long term accts.

title: Find Nearby is gone
review: With the latest upgrade this option had suddenly disappeared. Extremely frustrating as that was one of the app's best features for connecting with people at conferences. Update your support materials to reflect this change.

title: Application Problem
review: I would like to ask if anyone else is having problems while using linkedIn on iphone 7 plus? It‚Äôs hanging and not responding every time I am using this app. Developers please look into it please. I reinstalled app multiple times but its still having problems. I am having worst ever experience with this app. No action yet taken by team despite multiple escalations.

title: Bug on my app
review: I have over a month with a bug on my app. There‚Äôs always a notification on my pending invitation tab even though there are no invitations pending. I tried deleting it and downloading it again and it didn‚Äôt work. Always check for updates that hasn‚Äôt helped either. Please fix this. Thanks!

title: Crashes in messages
review:
Thanks for the app. The latest version crashes when opening a new message.
There is no issue with existing old messages and they can be opened easily.

title: Hang Problem in IPhone 8+
review: When ever I scroll 10 to 11 post in my news feed linkdin hangs after that even when I reopen the app it stays in that condition I dont know why. I‚Äôm using it from a year it was always doing that now I‚Äôm totally feed up with this bug I‚Äôm using it in Iphone 8+.

title: Provide option of GOING BACK
review:
When sending connection requests to people from a specific company after applying filters, when we add a personalized note to them and send them a request there‚Äôs no option to go back to the search results
There is a ‚ÄòX‚Äô on the top left of screen and if we press that the personalized note gets cancelled even after sending it

title: LinkedIn review
review: I believe LinkedIn will be a great source for starting my online business because it will let me connect to many other business entrepreneurs.

title: So annoying
review: I don‚Äôt like how this app forces users to update while in use. I‚Äôm in the middle of typing and the app will quit, then request an update, I can‚Äôt get back to my comment and loose my thought process. Also, cannot find whether you have mutual connections with someone easily anymore. That was one of the best parts of linked in.

title: Good but glitchy
review: This app is great with the format and options just everything! But it makes my phone freeze every time I use it for more than two minutes. It glitches and will not load properly after awhile.

title: Great platform - needs some intuitive tweaks
review:
The platform is great. Works as advertised. Layout is intuitive. 

Frustrating that you can‚Äôt switch between mentor and mentee. Could better recommend jobs. ‚ÄúSkills‚Äù are useless.

title: Too many updates
review: I removed 1 Star due to them pumping out so many updates. Something's not right with that in my opinion, and if yet another update comes out in less than 7-days, I'm deleting this app.

title: Suggestions
review:
This application deserves 5 stars. It‚Äôs really useful. But I hope that in volunteering part that‚Äôs be more flexible by have choice in days , cuz sometimes I volunteer for 2 days. 
Thank you

title: Frustrated LinkedIn User
review:
I am attempting to log in the app and even on the site. I‚Äôve updated my password, but because of the ridiculous two step verification I can‚Äôt log in to update my new phone number.

I have tried researching for a phone number or email to reach out to LinkedIn (lack of) Customer Service with no luck. Any suggestions would greatly be appreciated. Thank you.

title: To many screens explaining how the app works
review: LinkedIn is amazing the app is terrible! It is difficult to navigate and every time it updates you have to go through the stupid tutorial again and even when you say skip there are four more screens of ya did you know it can do this, enough already! I know how to use an app, I don‚Äôt need my hand held through every single feature!

title: Will not allow me to cancel Premium Subscription
review: I‚Äôve used the free version for years with no problem but now that I upgraded to Premium I have a major issue. After a couple of weeks I realized I don‚Äôt need it and tried to cancel, which I have been unable to do. Both LinkedIn and Apple have directed me to a ‚Äúcancel subscription ‚Äú button that doesn‚Äôt exist. I am now about to be charged and I am FURIOUS.

title: Great connecting tool
review: I love this app. Linked In has helped me to find a new job even when I didn‚Äôt know I was looking. It‚Äôs a great way to connect and keep in touch with other professionals.

title: Works well
review: Works as expected, although I still prefer using desktop this app works well to see the information I need on the go

title: Best place to make connections and friends
review: This is mainly a business contact site, however I find that I have become great friends with many of my connections!

title: LinkedIn review
review: LinkedIn is a great business networking tool and also gives you the opportunity to see what others are accomplishing in their fields through successful habits and tested principals.

title: App crashes since last update
review: I regularly use this app, but have grown frustrated since the last update. I keep having to log in twice. The first time I log in the app crashes. ?!?! If I log in a second time it opens normally & works fine. Please fix this.

title: Unable to login - BROKEN AGAIN
review:
For the past couple of months I have to reinstall the app in order to login. The app keeps asking me to try again and I can only resolve this by removing and reinstalling.

Update: looks like the problem has been resolved. Thank you!

28-Sep-2017: I'm having the same problem again, had to uninstall and reinstall .... :(

title: Convenient way to stay connected
review: This app makes it so easy to keep track of as well as stay connected your connections.

title: Crashing
review: App crashes after a couple seconds

title: Ok but some technical issues
review: Like a password works on the web site but isn‚Äôt treated properly by the mobile app so you can‚Äôt login using the mobile app.   Hint, it‚Äôs the @ sign.

title: Please fix the app!
review:
LinkedIn has done a lot for me, but the app crashes several times a day on my iPhone. I have to restart my phone to use the app. I have tried deleting the app and reinstalling it to no avail. I run iOS 16.3.1. 

The LinkedIn app needs updating and debugging.

title: Huge Bug
review: There‚Äôs an annoying bug that has existed for sometime. If you‚Äôre looking at jobs for any given company, and then try to filter it down by city, it will reset the company filter. This is very annoying!

title: Instawork
review: I have recently started working through Instawork and I found it has been very helpful for me to attain employment short term and possibly long term. An excellent app!

title: Nextdoor meets Facebook
review: LinkedIn really needs to figure out what it wants to be because the majority of content you see now is either completely irrelevant to work or an attempt to sell you something. Hard to see the value if you‚Äôre not a recruiter or sales professional.

title: "Job Type" glitch + rife with scammers
review:
The "job type" filter keeps disappearing when I'm looking for jobs. I can only work part-time so this is a giant hassle.
I am contacted by scammers from LinkedIn multiple times per week. I see and report multiple fake jobs every time I use the search function. No other job site has this many scammers.

title: App is great, reliability is terrible
review: I love the app; good interface and usability. But I can‚Äôt tell you how many times I‚Äôve opened the app and it says I have no internet connection. I‚Äôd say 90% of the time. It‚Äôs not a terrible problem because I just go to the mobile website, but as far as the app is concerned, it‚Äôs pretty bad.

title: Moving towards Facebook content
review: LinkedIn is still the only game in town for professional networking and communications.  The move towards non-work related personal content (personal politics, hobbies, family) belong on other platforms.  No easy way to discourage this except to block a lot of people.

title: Buggy
review: How am I supposed to upload a resume from mobile if there is no option to download it? Why would you even add a job section on mobile if it doesn‚Äôt work?

title: Something went wrong
review: Lately this message keeps popping up on iOS, mostly on timeline and jobs. I can guarantee that it is not an issue with my network connectivity. Sometimes killing and restarting don't fix it. Not sure what's wrong, the message is not helpful at all.

title: Another Facebook...
review:
Another Facebook, or Twitter posing as a social media site for career professionals and job seekers. 
Standard political, ideological, and  just basic inflammatory posts with brain dead comments back and forth.   
This app might be useful for connecting with recruiters.  
Other than that, it‚Äôs just more of the same social media crap.

title: No dark mode option
review: I have the latest version of the app on my IPhone 12 Pro Max and the latest IOS. I don‚Äôt see the option for dark mode under settings while my wife has that option and is able to enable dark mode. Why this difference?

title: Feature idea
review: Would be awesome if there‚Äôs a filter where we can sort/search our job application history üôèüèª. Both app and website

title: Job search is now unusable
review: After the most recent update, the job search function is now basically useless.  Saved searches in specific geographic areas revert to ‚Äúworldwide‚Äù.  Trying to narrow the search to last 24 hours or last week works less than half the time.  Nice job making an average app terrible!

title: Used to be good
review: This used to be a decent app for connecting with business but now it is nothing more than Facebook, nothing on there but political crap and people pushing their own agendas, have reported several posts, some offensive and I get an auto response but nothing is ever taken down or addressed.

title: Excellent feedback - got a job through them!
review:
Thank you for leaving a feedback. It worked. And now it‚Äôs running smoothly. 

It‚Äôs not a perfect system. None are. However it‚Äôs helped me reach out to jobs. Employee offers and more. 

Plus I don‚Äôt feel the social need to post unnecessary things or pictures. 

Just as long as I update once in a while my picture to show my changes. And my personal growth on my profile. I know I will be contacted now and then with opportunities

title: Horrible experience
review: The most obvious thing they can do is to make it easy for costumers to pay then. I. Fact it‚Äôs impossible . It‚Äôs a odyssey to FIND WHERE TO ACTUALLY PAY. When you find it they say that this can‚Äôt be done on the app, then you move to mobile web browser and they say you should use a desktop computer. Lame. I will just quit being a premium user and save some money.

title: Ruins Profile Pictures
review: In my experience, you can‚Äôt upload any photos from your phone into your profile with this app with them alternating the picture (especially making it very dark).  There are editing tools, but you can never edit the photo enough to make it look like the original unedited version.  Very annoying (and completely unnecessary)

title: Why not 5 stars?
review:
I love linkedin but
 If I‚Äôm applying from my phone, I switch screens and go to my notes to copy some info, I come back the app refreshes and I‚Äôm back to home page. That is soooooo annoying.
If you guys can work on that please. 
Thank you.

title: Unnecessary Notifications that Provide Zero Value Outside of Irritation
review: The notifications for this app are rampant and frankly, worthless. I‚Äôm tired of getting a notification for something I‚Äôve *already* checked, and then having to be harangued with the stupid ‚Äúsee who else you know‚Äù pop up every time I launch the app is obnoxious. Please fix ASAP.

title: My shared post doesn‚Äôt show up on news feed.
review: I shared somebody‚Äôs post, but the post doesn‚Äôt show up on my activity feeds. I ‚Äúliked‚Äù somebody‚Äôs post, and that post doesn‚Äôt show on my news feed neither. Please tell me how can I fix that?

title: LinkedIn premium charge
review: I tried using LinkedIn premium free trial for a month, was on a weekend trip with family, phone battery was dead so didn‚Äôt checked the subscription end date. I cancelled my subscription ASAP and contacted both LinkedIn, Apple unfortunately none of them says they are responsible. Didn‚Äôt refunded the charge contacted which I cancelled within a day. I have to waste around 3 hours of my time just to find out what is going on. How can a company this big do that. The message they send to their customers is not very clear. Please baware of this app before doing anything on it.

title: Saved articles aren‚Äôt saving

review: I love the app, use it very often, would be so helpful if the developers can add biometric authentication for logging in via either Face ID or fingerprint ‚Äî Can this please be added?

title: App is horrible
review: You can do everything except for update your profile, request anything, send any messages, and/or make posts. What‚Äôs the point of having the app that doesn‚Äôt allow you to ‚Äúsave‚Äù or ‚Äúsubmit‚Äù anything. Might as well use Instagram to look at pictures & google for articles.

title: My account got restricted at in a sudden
review: Come on, what is going on here, my account was restricted while I‚Äôm applying a job which I saved 10 minutes before. And now I have to provide the copy of my driver license with pc. The LinkedIn website said it could be because I violate the teams of service. What da...!

title: Doesn‚Äôt work properly

It constantly says I do not have internet access when every other app works fine. The only thing this is good for is letting me know when I need to go to the website to check my messages and alerts.

title: Application Crashing

An app is supposed to be convenient because it‚Äôs with you everywhere you go. But now if I want to apply somewhere, I have to go get my laptop.

title: Needs More Fun!
review: I love the LinkedIn app, I use it all the time to search for jobs and connect with professionals. I thought you guys maybe could add some fun emojis or sound effects so I don‚Äôt get too bored.

title: Latest update problem
review: The screen goes to black when I open the app since the latest update. Sometimes I get in but most of my attempts show Linked In at top like I‚Äôm in the app but it‚Äôs black screen and I can‚Äôt click anything. Please fix with a new update.

title: Quality app for professionals

title: Bringing all Proffessional people together
review: This app brings all professionals under one roof we they can meet collaborate help each other get motivated and find jobs in your desired field.

title: Can‚Äôt unsave articles!

review: It used to be strictly professional network, but lately its been plagued with Facebook style clown humor posts, the classical Virtue Signalling show offs, and the sponsored ads. But today, I saw the Marijuana promotion ad on my feed! Are you serious LinkedIn?

review: Please correct your authentication doom loop. It is impossible to open the Linkedin App to authenticate your login when you‚Äôre in the middle of logging in to LinkedIn. This is a great application, but the recent changes to both authentication in memory have made an unstable and a huge problem to use.

This needs to be tuned Linkedin team.

title: Excellent for job searching

title: Unable to redownload the app

Ive taken screen shot of the issue and need to shared it with your team

title: Won‚Äôt open

review: I was looking for non-union jobs in film and the search keep showing me receptionist jobs for companies that have nothing to do with film. Not to mention how you can‚Äôt search by locations in the filter, they do give you a short list, but instead you have to put it in the search engine. This app is a mess.

title: It‚Äôs good...

title: Beware of scammers
review: Ever since I posted my resume on this app, I have been bombarded with scam emails, texts and phone calls. To the point where I had to change my number. Jobs shouldn‚Äôt text asking for banking info. Aside from the obvious risk factors, the job search engine is super archaic. Not very user friendly. More of a social media popularity contest than a job board.

title: App not working
review: The app hasn‚Äôt worked properly in over a week, new feeds are not loading at all; I deleted it and downloaded the app again, but still having the same problem. Also there was no way to send you guys a message about it so letting you know here. Hope it gets fixed soon

title: Frustrated

App freezes as soon as i open it

I applaud you guys for your honesty, but it‚Äôs time to either clean up your site or just quit the business.

title: Excellent app but‚Ä¶

title: Frustrating

review: I like the format, content tends to keep pretty tight, but that may be based on who I choose to follow. Awesome way to get an inside look into business greats! My favorite follow is Richard Branson.

title: Great product, great company, keep up!
review: I can always see improvements of the products and the expansion of product lines, great product, keep up!

review: It‚Äôs good to have professional outlook and connections, however LinkedIn job search absolutely incorrect and barely help for job seekers find job or employees find candidates. title: Social media for grown ups

title: Great Networking App
review: LinkedIn is an amazing way to connect with people in your industry. It‚Äôs all business. Great way to get your info to people that have the same interest.

title: LinkedIn free trial scam.
review: I have been trying to cancel my premium free trial premium linked subscription and there is no way to do it through Apple or LinkedIn.  It‚Äôs a scam you cannot cancel the free trial.  You cannot contact LinkedIn or Apple and speak someone to get it cancelled.  They send you to the same cancellation instructions which do not work.  Don‚Äôt get suckered into the free really premium.  You cannot get out.  It‚Äôs a total scam.

title: App freeze when clicked on the push notification

title: Doesn‚Äôt Fit Small Screens

title: Latest update
review: New update makes it hard to search by a specific company and location. Also always has ‚ÄúWorldwide‚Äù as default location, instead of profile location.

title: App ran without issue earlier this year 2022
review:

Running on iphone XR 
ios 13.6.1

title: Header Photo Editing
review: Please let us have the ability to add or edit a header photo. The stock image isn‚Äôt bad. I want to show that I‚Äôm actively working on my profile and engaged with all of the features to possible employers.

title: Awful hack

Will not let me look up or apply to any other job outside of caregiving & it gives of Twitter vibes not work . I rather look on snagajob then continue with this app .

review: This is a great app. I use it a lot. But this last update came with a pretty annoying bug- every single time I leave the app, I am signed out and need to login again. title: Always crashes when writing messages
review:
Hi 
I really like this app and use it often, but one annoying problem, when I am writing messages to a friend suddenly app crashes and I have to start again and write from the beginning

title: New Posts should work like Twitter app

title: Disgusted -unprofessional ‚ÄúBlack Voices to follow‚Äù suggestions
review: LinkedIn is supposed to be professional, but no, you guys now are indulging in politics and putting ‚ÄúBlack voices to follow‚Äù suggestions in my feed. Did you ever do ‚ÄúJewish voices to follow‚Äù or ‚ÄúTibetan voices to follow‚Äù, ‚ÄúNative American voices to follow‚Äù, no right? title: Recent Update Doesn‚Äôt Open on iPhone 7

title: Leading the Online Professional Network Space
review: LinkedIn continues to improve its ease of use and relevancy in the age of professional digital networking.  As a decade user it‚Äôs been vital in connecting to people within my industry and fostering new relationships.

review: For the past several months, LinkedIn via IOS is unresponsive, slow etc. I continue do updates, but ha e yet to see any change, though the fixes claim to responsiveness. Still getting errors trying to search for companies, open Job descriptions...

title: Font & Window Size
review: The messaging within LI is awful experience. Can‚Äôt the window be larger and provide a better view of what I‚Äôm writing. I now use another program and then copy and paste so I can visibly see what I‚Äôm communicating. It‚Äôs about 4 pt type as is. And the window is 1/2‚Äù. Come on!

review: The browser user control freezes often, making it completely useless. Facing this issue across platforms on multiple latest devices. Wasn‚Äôt a pleasant experience.

title: Linked in review
review: I have been impressed with what I‚Äôve seen from your site. I think you are keeping up with the times and staying innovative.

title: Great App

title: Good

title: Stay engaged professionally

title: App Issues

review: Tying to look for a job within 5 miles of my house but they removed the feature where you could search within a certain distance of you, now I‚Äôm getting random jobs for 50 + miles away. And they don‚Äôt have a contact us feature

title: Bad Bug
review: LinkedIn has been around for a while. What is going on with this app? There is not a single day when the app is not working ‚Äúsomething went wrong‚Äù. What could go wrong? review:

Also, more and more my feed reminds me of Facebook before I ditched it: political opinions about insane things.

title: disappointed
review: No matter how many times i try to edit they positions they populate for suggested jobs, they keep giving me senior positions. I am a new graduate and Linkedin makes it so much harder to find a job on their site since everything they want to make viewable to me is a senior position or requires a minimum of 3 years experience!

title: It works.
review:
The app does a good job by keeping an individual's information where it needs to be. And available when that is needed, too.

With all of the changes and updates that the writers are doing, it makes me wonder about the current and prior editions and how well they were written and how much danger I'm in by using the site.

Still, the same old, worn out, excuse for an application iteration after iteration.

title: Pathetic data gathering app
review: Unable to change settings to stop sharing all my data with LinkedIn. Once you get to settings and start removing all the permissions, the app crashes, and funny enough all the privacy settings already changed go back to their original ‚Äúshare everything.‚Äù

upd: disappears the next day

title: Used to be a decent app

Frankly, I don‚Äôt need nor want their advice on getting recognized or advancing my career. It used to be a networking app. I really have no idea what it is now.

Great app! I‚Äôm enjoying it a lot, and I‚Äôve been learning a lot from my experiences.

The only flaw I see in it, is that I‚Äôm not allowed to change my cover photo from a mobile device. 

It would be amazing if that were the case. Very useful, and convenient for everyone wanting a great cover photo, but are not at a computer to do so.

LinkedIn, please allow us users to change the cover photo from a mobile device/phone.

title: Almost useless!

Just awful...I‚Äôm doneü§¶‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

title: Thank you this app is very helpful and inspiring
review: Works quite well with the update. So much useful information and wonderful connection. Thank you for this üôèüèª

title: App stopped loading
review:
I‚Äôm only commenting about the app literally not functioning (as opposed to the myriad user experience issues beyond this).

The app stopped loading out of nowhere a couple days ago. I‚Äôve tried logging in both manually and through Touch ID, closing the app, checking for updates, and deleting and reinstalling the app. Nothing will work. The app will not load. 

It‚Äôs incredibly frustrating because I primarily use the app, and I now have to wait until the end of the day when I get home to get to my personal computer and respond to messages and what not.

title: Bug in connection tab...

It's my reasonable choice to continue using my iPhone 5. In any case, the time has come to delete the app from my device...

Maybe another time.

title: Search options
review: After the new update I can not type in a search. It only lets me view suggested searches. Other than that I love the app, but if someone isn‚Äôt suggested to me I can‚Äôt find them.

review: I tried using the app to apply to a job (1/9/18) and it freezes every time I get to the demographics section of the application and I lose all my previous work.

title: Notifications need work
review: The app is good overall, but the notifications are so hard to configure. The selections are not clear and the menus are awful. I‚Äôm so tired of seeing notifications on my phone and going to the app to find some meaningless updates.

title: Recent changes
review:
I really liked when you changed splash screen from traditional blue to white. Now it‚Äôs back. I guess somebody didn‚Äôt like it. 

Why the app takes so long on the splash screen anyway? If it‚Äôs 3-5 seconds then maybe it would be good to introduce an animated spinning LinkedIn logo to ‚Äúappear as data is refreshed‚Äù?

Just a hint :-)

By the way. It would be good to add a button to submit feedback directly from iOS app. All help articles reflect desktop PC version - shame.

title: A Place of Unlimited Opportunity
review: LinkedIn is amazing. If you‚Äôre looking to just connect with people or to get your name out there for a new position, LinkedIn is your place.

review: This app is terrible. It refreshes your page sporadically, and gives error messages for virtually any action you try to complete. It fails to update your inbox. I routinely can view previously deleted conversations through the app, but cannot read newly sent messages. This app is frustrating, and a waste of the data required to download it.

title: Easy, intuitive, straightforward
review: LinkedIn a regular go-to for my professional network, as well as quick daily digests to start the day.

title: Great professional tool.
review: Perfect for staying up to date with your professional field, stay in touch with former colleagues, and for finding a new job!

title: The best networking site on the web
review: Linkedin has created an online community that allows expression of all positions. The suggested connections are relevant . The platform is easily navigated and edits are easily accomolished

title: Helpful but could be more
review: Enjoy the app. I‚Äôve just had a difficult time finding information on feature to allow a person to manage and post to a company profile from the mobile app.

title: Latest update
review: The latest update doesn‚Äôt allow you to report repetitive or annoying ads. I keep getting an ad for a dating service. Thank you but I‚Äôm happily married.

title: Current version does not open keyboard in text inputs
review: I just redownloaded linkedin temporarily to send a DM on it and when I clicked into any text fields (search, post, message), my keyboard didn‚Äôt open. I had to type out who I wanted to search for in Notes and paste it in, then type my message in Notes and paste that in. ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

title: Keeps crashing down
review: What‚Äôs going on with the latest updates of the LinkedIn app? Keeps crashing down and it is super slow while trying to send messages.

title: Premium Charging Card, LinkedIn is a Scam
review: Absolute scam. No way to navigate easily to help center for a support ticket. Account is locked from unsubscribing to premium. Card is charged 44$ even though there are no payments saved on my account. Absolutely a terrible app, with no way out of being charged. I demand an explanation to why LinkedIn is committing this fraud.

title: Can't disable notifications! Push ads?!?
review:
The app has unwanted badges, and even when I'm not in the app at all, pop-up ads get in my face tell me to check out LinkedIn features!

Even worse, you get push notifications for irrelevant ADS that third parties have paid LinkedIn for. I literally get push notifications from Chinese game companies.

You can't just throw ads on people's phones like that. These notifications are non-optional: the app doesn't even list itself in Settings>Notifications, so there's no control you can turn off!

Deleted to stop the unwanted popups.

title: No Support - Prime not worth it!
review: No support when emailing for follow up. Stop pretending to support military spouses and veterans when you ignore emails. I‚Äôve sent two now with no response. Paying to see ‚Äúwho viewed your profile‚Äù is not worth what you are charging. Make it easier for people to see value in what you are offering! This is ridiculous!

title: BUGGY
review: If you don‚Äôt have an absolutely exquisite internet connection, or your phone or app isn‚Äôt up to date, you‚Äôre screwed. C‚Äômon developers this thing is crashing on me constantly and won‚Äôt allow me to make edits on posts without freezing up.  I‚Äôm constantly restarting the app.  I love the service but hate using the app.

title: Messed up search feature in your network
review: Whenever I now tap on a person in my network, it opens up an entirely different person in my network. For example, I want to see Bob from IBM I tap his photo‚Äîup comes Jane from Dell. Makes no sense. Please fix your tech issue.

title: Home page is not smoothly scrolling

title: Signing in each time?

title: Messed up

title: Garbage

Random and consistent security checks that are there to waist time, and you‚Äôll still be locked out. garbage I legit hope y‚Äôall die from covid

title: Massive spam identity theft machine usleless garbage
review: Sea of lowballing foreign recruiters.  mobile site demands using the app. The app and site will spam everyone you‚Äôve ever sent an email to. It‚Äôs been hacked repeatedly. LinkedIn is Facebook for working adults. All the same chatter and noise on Facebook is duplicated in LinkedIn. I don‚Äôt know anyone that has got a job , contract, client or money by using LinkedIn.

title: Disaster
review:
I use LinkedIn regularly on my mobile device. . Well, I used to. As of yesterday I‚Äôm forced to accept the ‚Äúnew application‚Äù as the prompt appeas on my screen and offers no option other than to download it. But no matter what I do it does not download. So now LinkedIn no longer works on my phone. Maybe it‚Äôs me but I doubt it. 

Oh well.

title: Not very user friendly

review: When you‚Äôre viewing comments for a post, the keyboard remains open, blocking most of the view. Even when you scroll the comments down, the keyboard remains open.

title: Notifications are unmanageable
review: I‚Äôve tried pairing down notifications to only get what I care about but there are just too many categories and settings. If find this easy to manage in other apps but it‚Äôs a mess in LinkedIn. This makes me just turn notifications off for the entire app, a constant stream of notifications for stuff I don‚Äôt want is abuse.

title: Glitch
review: I haven‚Äôt been able to open the app on my iPhone 8 Plus for over a week now. I‚Äôve tried to open from the App Store and from the app itself and it‚Äôs not working.

title: Can‚Äôt sort by most recent
review: It seems absolutely ridiculous to me that there is no option to sort your feed by most recent. The app only sorts it by top news. I hardly ever use the app for this reason and only open it whenever I have a notification. Otherwise, I use my computer. At least that has a most recent function.

title: Written by morons, tested by idiots
review:
If I hide a post in the browser of my desktop computer why does it reappear in the iOS app? If I hide it in the app also why does it reappear?

I started my software career in QA likely before most of the app team at LinkedIn were born. This is level one testing stuff, dudes!

Time to lay off the Whiteclaw, Netflix and pr0n to do your jobs.

title: It‚Äôs decent but needs some updates
review: I can‚Äôt upload my resume or copy and paste recruiters email directly from my phone onto another app. Those are my only issues I have. It‚Äôs decent though but I rely on the desktop version on my MacBook more.

title: Horrible first use
review: I wanted to start using LinkedIn and while I was setting up my profile, I started facing difficulties! I tried setting up my profile picture, and when I click ‚Äúuse‚Äù it would turn my picture dark! No matter what i did it would turn any picture dark and wouldn‚Äôt adjust. I‚Äôm extremely frustrated, never using this app.

title: Can I use the app please?
review: Every time I open the app, I have about 17 screens to click through that ask me whether I want to connect with these people, or add these people, or these contacts that I have, and maybe I‚Äôd like to follow these companies... I have to press ‚Äúskip for now‚Äù on like 12 concurrent screens before using the app to do whatever it is I was going to look at.

title: Unable to Use..
review:
Upon opening I get a pop-up that asks me to update the app. This takes me to to the App Store where there is no update?!
I'm unable to clear the update request making the app useless. Why force users to update? Guess it's time to delete it...

title: I agree
review: Hey furniture I agree work should be kept a lot more professional and not be allowed to have so much of the nonsense that has to or comes along with all the FB S***!!

title: Phenomenal!
review: LinkedIn is a life-saver. Seriously. Not just for folks looking for work, but also for folks trying to keep their jobs, excel at their jobs, or climb the ladder in their careers. Can‚Äôt think of a better platform for career development.

title: Poor quality and limited functions for folks that have a Recruiter Seat
review: The messaging function in Recruiter is a joke.  Also, you can‚Äôt even see your job postings or check on applications to those jobs.  For what LI charges this is really unacceptable.  I would re-review if those issues were addressed.

title: It‚Äôs useless for actually getting a job and miserable to cancel
review: The premium subscription is useless and definitely not worth the money. Once you‚Äôre a subscriber it‚Äôs impossible to cancel. I‚Äôve tried several times and been unsuccessful. Contacted LinkedIN support and they refer me to Apple. Apple refers me back to LinkedIN. This service is not worth the money. Only good for maki g and keeping contacts.

title: App keeps lagging for 10-20 seconds at a time
review: The app used to be much more responsive, now it jams up my brand new iPhone X. Had to delete the app to get the OS to run better. They‚Äôve always had UI that didn‚Äôt quite work well for promoted images and other bugs, but this is affecting the performance of my phone.

title: Useful
review: I appreciate that linked in helps me to connect with potential jobs and with colleagues. It is well designed and easy to use.

title: Best Social Media App Out!
review: This is the best social media platform out, for those that like to keep things simple and professional. My career has benefited greatly from LinkedIn and this app.

title: Love the app
review: Great user friendly app! I'm kind of addicted to LinkedIn so having an app makes it so easy for me to view new job opportunities, research companies, and connect with industry professionals.

title: Full of Bug and  operating very slow on my iPhone 11
review: The app tends to lag and run slow on my phone

title: Useless
review: A glorified job board that‚Äôs useless, even if you do pay. The jobs are often out-of-date revealing how few standards or protocols there are for employers to act ethically or accountably. Likewise, I‚Äôve been spammed a few times also through LinkedIn and previous coworkers looking for jobs have also been lured in by phishing schemes.

title: The best place to see content

title: Performance degraded
review: Since past few weeks , linkedIn‚Äôs performance has severely degraded. Opening accounts continuously caused the profile to load at least after 5 seconds!!! Which is horrible! It should have been in milli seconds!

title: Worse than not having a job.
review: It‚Äôs the used car lot experience in app form. Worst service and not able to even close the account until the stupid subscription runs out. I was hired in a day using the better alternatives out there. Avoid this data mining, spam filled, Ad packed app at the cost of $330 USD/year? Hahahahaa no.

title: Linked in is a professional site- not a social site!
review:
Please do not post social information, recipes, dating soliciting information of this Linked in site!
Only professional information please

title: What‚Äôs going on?
review: I could sign on to this app one minute the next it tells me something is wrong. It‚Äôs not my internet I‚Äôm very savvy all of my other apps work just fine. Very disappointed especially when I need to connect with recruiters. I don‚Äôt have time to spend refreshing the app reinstalling powering down my phone.

title: Lose place when app switching
review: When you switch to a different app and then come back, your feed reloads and you lose your place. Very annoying.

title: Job search seems to be getting worse
review: Keyword search for a particular role doesn‚Äôt return results to what I search for but instead returns results for different jobs.

title: Hostile to Women and Minorities
review:
Their ‚Äúprofessional behavior standards‚Äù are never applied fairly or consistently. If you are female, disabled, POC, LGBT+, or working class, you will be severely punished if you ever speak out against anyone more privileged. Especially the rich. 

Meanwhile, they‚Äôll be allowed to continuously threaten you and behave unprofessionally without ever being held accountable.

Linked In is not worth anyone‚Äôs time or money!

title: Version support
review:
Please try to support ios version 12.5.4 application.

Thanks.

review:

Also cannot automatically login after the new version was updated. Have to login every time. Horrible customer experience since the last app update.

title: Suggestion

title: Have to keep logging in
review: This recent update constantly requires me to have to log back in each time. Super annoying. In all prior versions, once I logged in the app stayed logged in. I can‚Äôt even find a setting that will allow me to select the option to stay logged in.üòï

title: Too many Ads
review:
Cluttered with ads.
Original content seems to be pushed down in favor of companies pushing their agenda. Almost becoming like Facebook. Quality needs to rise to keep users on the platform for longer.

title: The worst app ever
review:
Iphone 11. This app just doesn‚Äôt work at all. All the time you open it and it get stuck. This is the fourth time I am reinstalling it. 
So this means each time it stuck, which is every time, I would have to uninstall and reinstall. 
Just to see a notification you have to reinstall it. What is this. 

I can‚Äôt expect this from this big service.

title: Was slow

review: Do not sign up for subscription through the app because you cannot get a refund when there are problems. The payment comes through the App Store instead of directly to linked in and they are not able to support you. Apple does not make it clear what you are paying for and how.

title: Cancel option for invited
review:
Hi
There is no cancel option even I invite someone by accident and as long as I clicked on the pending status, nothing happened at all

Thanks

title: Not tech savvy guy, thank God for LinkedIn
review:
I‚Äôm not a tech savvy gadgets guy. Really a throwback to the 50‚Äôs (or wish for this time period)

I‚Äôm on LinkedIn almost daily. 

E

title: Glitches

review: Great app but unfortunately it gets stuck on my fone after 30-60 secs of opening it. Its the only app which is playing like this.

review: It works okay, but there is always some little bug that frustrates users. For instance, the saved jobs are UNCLICKABLE and it‚Äôs not even possible to remove them or do anything from the app. This needs to be fixed asap

title: Cannot post or search from App

title: Screening Invitations
review:
Great way to build your network and hire.

I have seen members who require knowing their email address in  order to send an invitation - but I can‚Äôt find that setting.  I‚Äôd change to 5 stars if I knew how to screen by requiring my email address.....

title: Failure to search effectively
review: Search has been failing on the mobile app for a good 6-8 months. Despite several updates, a relatively simple feature fails to work. title: App
review: Easy to use.  I check in most weekly morning to catch up with my contacts and news.

title: LinkedIn and applying for Jobs
review: How did people apply for jobs before LinkedIn what took 2 hours now takes 2 mins the LinkedIn job hunting app is great

title: LinkedIn 1 Awesome App!

review: The app cannot be used by cellular data, only on Wi-Fi. This seems an known issue, because I saw the same complaint in a comment a year ago. I cannot believe this still hasn‚Äôt been fixed after so long time!

Recently the app has been a headache. I am unable to message because the text field is simply not there! Only those suggested responses which make you sound like a robot.  

It also refreshes every time I leave the app and I lose my spot. Not cool.

title: Overcharging
review: I regret updating the app. I now have to pay for a subscription to do things I was able to do before like searching for people. They‚Äôre trying to make money of basic things we were able to do before. Do not get this app. I would give it zero stars if I could.

review: The scrolling capability on the jobs tab of LinkedIn is absolute garbage. You could slide your thumb up three or four times and the page will not move. review: I have appreciated having the LinkedIn app until recently.  Whenever I open my app for information on what‚Äôs going on with universities, etc. I am immediately shown stories on salons.  This is not what I‚Äôm there for and certainly don‚Äôt appreciate having to scroll down forever to see what I‚Äôm looking for

title: Recent stories - app functionality (or lack thereof)
review: The inability to not be able to filter by the most recent stories on the app and instead have to depend on the algorithm to feed you ‚Äútop‚Äù stories is absurd.

title: Recently‚Ä¶
review: Email & app preferences are unreliable. Do not receive notifications via either form if selected or vice/vs. Recently noticed, bc job searching‚Ä¶ No notifications when applied, viewed, downloaded, etc

title: Latest update

title: Salary
review:
It‚Äôs so odd how I can‚Äôt filter jobs by salary. I believe you should edit your postings to make employers post the salary. I don‚Äôt like when I‚Äôm sorting jobs, only to find work that is below my salary requirements.  

Otherwise, thoroughly satisfied with LinkedIn and will continue using it.

title: Notification issues
review: This app continues to pop up a badge notification for my network. When I go check there is no notifications. I had to turn off all of the notifications for this app to stop it.

title: No jobs here!
review: If ur looking for a job you came to the wrong place. This app is for networking rather then applying for places you want to work. Overall this app is for sharing ideas and communication, not for job seekers looking to make a living.

title: How is this app this bad?

You have an established piece of software owned by one of the "leading tech companies" yet the mobile app is unintuitive, and doesn't work. Keeps popping up saying features "need to be opened on app" while I'm in the app 

Which of course just takes you to the app store. To install an already installed app 

How is this so broken? Does Microsoft know what software testing is?

title: I don‚Äôt want the app
review: I sign into linden and it won‚Äôt let me see anything,  it says Linkedin works better with the app. They should say LinkedIn well not work at all without the app. For that reason I haven‚Äôt been on my phone storage is full and I‚Äôm deleting apps. I don‚Äôt want the app on my phone but I can‚Äôt use it unless I do

title: Alerts disappear

title: Too many push notifications
review: 4 or 5 push notifications per day. I tried to unsubscribe from a majority of them. I received one after the fact of the ‚Äúdaily rundown‚Äù variety. I went to check if I had forgotten to unsubscribe from that category. I didn‚Äôt. LinkedIn just ignored my preference.

title: Trash compared to web version
review:
Whenerver I‚Äôm trying to write something, it crahses.

Please fix app broken keyboard.

This is the second time I‚Äôm deleting this trash ios app. After spending 20 minute writing it says it cannot send my post and it won‚Äôt let me to access it‚Äôs text . I use web version from now on.

review: Trying to update my position title, locations, and note to recruiters and the app just errors. LinkedIn help is useless, telling me to uninstall and reinstall the app... NOT a solution. title: App bug

I‚Äôll spend on Indeed, instead.

Update: the canned, pointless response below fortifies my incentive to spend my recruiting dollars elsewhere.

title: Very frustrating to use

title: I‚Äôm Linked In

title: LinkedIn premium
review:
This is a review for the paid version, which is $50/Mo. 

Decided to try out via LinkedIn one month free promo email. It was fine‚Äîwould pay $4.99/Mo for it. Poked around site to see how to deactivate subscription and couldn‚Äôt find it. 

Got email about auto renewal and charge from Apple. Wrote back within hours to explain I did not wish to renew. Then got steps to cancel subscription via Apple (love how this is the ONE area that is not intuitive nor easy to access). I was informed via two robo messages that I would not be reimbursed. AWESOME EXPERIENCE. 

Really, not worth trying the paid version unless you‚Äôre a recruiter.

title: Not meant for the working class, it‚Äôs clear this is designed for corporate America

title: üíó
review: Paid for premium and unable to use premium services. üíó

title: Predatory Garbage

LinkedIn has slowly devolved into a predacious social media site full of useless bots and manipulative marketing campaigns. Profit is LinkedIn‚Äôs biggest inspiration- no matter the outcome for the users

title: Needs some updates

title: You Won‚Äôt Find A Job

review: I shouldn‚Äôt have to pay to message someone I‚Äôm not connected to.  This isn‚Äôt a dating site.
